notes: On 30 March 2022, Pokot militia clashed with Tugen militia in Kamwenje area, near Ol-moran town (Laikipia West, Laikipia). Casualties unknown.

On 21 March 2022, Kenya military forces ambushed a group of 4 suspected Al Shabaab militants at Sarira area, 25 km north of Baure (Lamu East, Lamu county). 2 militants were killed and 2 others managed to escape. Unknown number of guns were recovered from the militants.
On 20 March 2022, overnight, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked Kenya security forces in Rhamu (Mandera North, Mandera). Casualties unknown.
On 17 March 2022, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a Kenya security forces (KDF) convoy travelling between Garissa and Hulugho, near Hulugho town (Hulugho, Garissa). There were no fatalities
On 15 March 2022, suspected Samburu pastoralists attacked Lodokojek police post near Maralal town (Samburu), and shot one police officer dead. The militia made away with four rifles and 200 bullets.
On 13 March 2022, overnight, Al Shabaab militants attacked a base of security forces (assumed police) in Weel Caday village near Khorof Harar town (Khorof, Wajir). Casualties unknown.

On 11 March 2022, suspected Pokot militia ambushed police officers on patrol at Kapkechir Ridge in Mochongoi (Mogotio, Baringo) leading to an armed clash. One officer was shot dead, while 3 others sustained injuries. The militants took away a G3 rifle, 60 bullets, body armor, and a ballistic helmet from the slain officer.

On 9 March 2022, Kenya military forces ambushed the cell of suspected Al Shabaab militants at Milimani (Lamu East, Lamu county). One militant was killed, several others escaped with multiple injuries. One AK47 rifle and three magazines recovered from scene.

On 6 March 2022, unidentified gunmen attacked a Nairobi-bound bus, at Gof Choba area (Saku, Marsabit county), along the Moyale-Isiolo highway. One person was killed, and 4 others sustained injuries during the incident

On 26 February 2022, Kenya military forces ambushed suspected Al Shabaab militants at Sarira area, 25 km north of Baure (Lamu East, Lamu county). 4 people were killed and several militants escaped to Somalia with multiple injuries.

On 26 February 2022, suspected Marakwet militia ambushed Pokot militia at Siromet grazing fields near Chesongoch (Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet). The attackers made away with unknown number of animals. 8 people were killed, including two students.
On 21 February 2022, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked security forces (KDF) in Nasaarada village, near Bargoni town (Lamu county). Casualties unknown.
On 20 February 2022, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked security forces at a base in Amuume near Garissa (Garissa). Casualties unknown.

On 19 February 2022, police ambushed about 10 Al Shabaab militants at a watering point in Takaba (Mandera West, Mandera county). One officer was wounded while 3 militants killed as the rest managed to escape.
On 19 February 2022, about 30 Al Shabaab militants attacked Amuma within Fafi (Fafi, Garissa county), before being repulsed by the police. Casualties unknown.

Around 17 February 2022 (as reported), two unidentified communal militias' clashed in Mathare slums (Ruaraka, Nairobi county), allegedly over a move to mount posters on the wall of a building in the area. One man was killed.

On 12 February 2022, over 10 suspected Pokot militia ambushed private security rangers in the Laikipia Nature and Conservancy, also known as Ol Ari Nyiro (Laikipia West, Laikipia county). One ranger was killed, and another injured during the incident

On 10 February 2022, suspected Samburu militia ambushed police within Sarova Shaba national game reserve area (coded as Shab Hills, Isiolo, Isiolo county). A 45-year-old man was arrested. Some militia escaped with gunshot wounds. No fatalities reported.

On 9 February 2022, suspected Pokot militia (believed to have stolen animals), clashed with police in Mlima Jangili camp near Ol Moran (Laikipia North, Laikipia County). One police officer died, another seriously wounded.

On 8 February 2022, police repulsed suspected Pokot militia, as they attempted to steal cattle in Maralal (Samburu central, Samburu county). The incident left one person seriously injured as the militia made away with property of unknown value.

On 3 February 2022, about 20 suspected Pokot pastoralist militia overpowered the police in a shoot out, as they attacked Napeitom village (Turkana East, Turkana county). A 30-year-old woman and a seven-year-old boy (grade 2 student) were killed and over 130 sheep and goats stolen during the incident.
Around 3 February 2022 (as reported), Al Shabaab militants attacked Kenya security forces at a base near Mandera county, coded as Mandera (Mandera East, Mandera county). Casualties unknown.

On 1 February 2022, police engaged suspected pokot pastoralist militia in an armed clash in Kapindasum (Marigat, Baringo county). Fatalities unknown, while 40 head of cattle previously stolen at Arabal river were recovered with the help of local residents.

On 31 January 2022, suspected Samburu pastoralists attacked Loruko police post (Isiolo county), and shot one police officer dead. The militia made away with food items of unknown value as well as two rifles and rounds of ammunition.

On 30 January 2022, police repulsed over 20 presumed Samburu ethnic militias at Malgis area near Laisamis (Laisamis, Marsabit county). The militia had attempted to steal cows by laying ambush to a lorry transporting about 40 cows from Moyale bound for a slaughterhouse in Nairobi. Casualities unknown.

On 29 January 2022, police repulsed presumed Pokot pastoralist militia, as they attempted to attack Lamaiywe village in Mochongoi area (Mogotio, Baringo). Two people were critically injured during the incident.

On 28 January 2022, suspected Pokot pastoralists attacked Lukuget Secondary School, near Chesongoch (Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet county), with the motive of stealing school goats. Police reservists, manning the school together with locals, managed to repulse the attackers.

Around 28 January 2022 (week of), suspected Pokot militia engaged the police in an armed clash at Eawso Police station near Mukogodo (Laikipia North, Laikipia county). The militia took off with a rifle. There were no fatalities.

On 26 January 2022, police repulsed Al Shabaab militants, as they attempted to attack using a rocket-propelled grenade (RPG) a convoy that included a vehicle carrying court officials at Lango la Simba area near Witu (Lamu West, Lamu county). Two court officials were injured during the incident.
On 22 January 2022, police repulsed an attack by suspected pokot militia in Kapedo village (Tiaty, Baringo county). Casualties unknown.

On 20 January 2022, about 200 armed raiders (presumed Toposa militia from South Sudan) attacked the Natapar village near Kibish (Kalokol, Turkana County), stealing 250 cattle. Police pursued the group heading to the South Sudanese border and clashed with the raiders. One herdsman was killed, and three others injured.
On 17 January 2022, Kenyan security forces in an operation killed 15 Al Shabaab militants in the Bodhei area (Lamu West, Lamu county). Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

On 14 January 2022, police raided Al Shabaab make-shift camps in Takaba (Mandera West, Mandera county), destroying the militant camp and logistical capabilities and paraphernalia. Three militants were killed. An unknown number of militants managed to escape.

On 10 January 2022, suspected Al Shabaab militants ambushed and killed four police officers between Liboi and Kulan area (Liboi, Garissa County) [coded to Liboi]. The militants took away three AK47 rifles and an unknown number of bullets from the slain officers.

On 9 January 2022, about 50 Al Shabaab militants attacked Juhudi/Marafa village in Mpeketoni (Lamu West, Lamu County). Two people were killed. Several houses were torched and food looted during the incident. Police arrived and a firefight ensued, lasting hours. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
On 2 January 2022, a suspected armed Turkana cattle rustler, allegedly on a revenge mission, was killed by the police at Kasarani Village near Isiolo (Isiolo, Isiolo County).

On 2 January 2022, suspected Samburu pastoralists attacked a police station at Archers Post (Samburu East, Samburu), killing one police officer. It is alleged that the attack was a revenge against the security officers, following heightened operations in the area, where stolen livestock were recovered from the morans.

Around 25 December 2021 (as reported), Degodia and Borana ethnic militias engaged in an armed clash, over scarce water and pasture at Basuke, in Marsabit county (coded to Marsabit, Marsabit Central, Saku). 11 people were killed. Over 300 families displaced by the conflict into Basir town in Wajir.
On 25 December 2021, militia allegedly from the Samburu community attacked and killed a police officer in Poro (Samburu Central, Samburu). The reason for the attack is unknown.

On 18 December 2021, suspected ethnic militia attacked a manyatta (homestead) in Jaldesa area (Dukana, Noth Horr, Marsabit County) and made away with 1,000 heads of cattle and 300 goats and sheep. Police forces chased and clashed with them, resulting in 8 fatalities and 3 injuries. All the stolen livestock was recovered.

On 18 December 2021, suspected ethnic militia attacked a manyatta (homestead) in Kubi Kalo (Sagante, Saku, Marsabit County) and made away with 800 heads of cattle and 1,500 goats and sheep. Police forces and local militia pursued them and 4 people were killed during the shootout. The stolen livestock were recovered.
On 14 December 2021, an armed clash ensued between Al Shabaab militants and the National Police Reservists in Olla (Guticha, Mandera North, Mandera County). Two police officers were injured.

On 13 December 2021, an armed clash erupted between suspected Al Shabaab militants and National Police Reservists after militants attempted to abduct worshippers at a mosque in Konton Centre (Khorof, Wajir East, Wajir County). Police forces were joined by Kenya Defence Forces to pursue the militants. There were no fatalities during the incident.

On 12 December 2021, suspected Pokot pastoralists raided two villages near Chepkesin (Baringo North, Baringo County). One police officer was killed and locals were forced to flee to a nearby primary school. Journalists were also targeted.

On 20 July 2021, about 100 Pokot ethnic militia clashed with the Marakwet ethnic militia who were herding along the border at Chepkorowo grazing field near Kapsowar town (Kapyego, Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet). Five people were killed and five others were injured.

On 15 July 2021, herders from the Marakwet ethnic militia clashed with herders from the Pokot ethnic militia at a grazing field near Kerio river in Keiyo Valley (Tambach, Keiyo North, Elgeyo Marakwet). Two people were killed.

On 9 July 2021, Borana ethnic militia clashed with the Garba ethnic militia in Kiwanja Ndege area in Marsabit town (Marsabit Central, Saku, Marsabit). One person, who was a standard three pupil, was killed.
On 9 July 2021, Borana ethnic militia clashed with the Garba ethnic militia in Shegel village near Marsabit town (Marsabit Central, Saku, Marsabit). Two people were killed.
On 8 July 2021, Borana ethnic militia clashed with the Garba ethnic militia at Manyatta Daba area in Jirime village (Marsabit Central, Saku, Marsabit). Two people were killed, including a woman.

On 5 July 2021, Borana ethnic militia clashed with the Garba ethnic militia at Manyatta Daba area in Jirime village (Marsabit Central, Saku, Marsabit). Five people were killed, several houses set alight.

On 23 June 2021, members of the Kenya's anti-terrorism police in Kwale (Matuga, Kwale) attacked and killed one Al Shabaab militia member. Police seized one AK47 rifle, 763 rounds of ammunition, a laptop and several other electronic devices.

On 4 July 2020, Oloirien and Maasai community members clashed over land in in the Mikululo area (Kajiado Central, Kajiado). One person was killed and four injured.
On 4 July 2020, Al Shabaab members attacked a police station in Fafi village (Fafi, Garissa). No fatalities reported.

source: Capital FM; The Star (Kenya); Daily Nation (Kenya)
notes: On 14 June 2020, clashes between Borana and Gabra communities left four boys dead at a watering point in Saku subcounty (Saku, Marsabit).

On 14 June 2020, National Police Reservists repulsed an Al Shabaab attack on a telecommunications mast at Warankara in Lafey (Lafey, Mandera). One police officer and one militant were killed. Several injuries reported. Conflicting reports suggest that three policemen were killed.
On 10 June 2020, armed herders clashed over a watering point in Gof-Choba near Sololo (Moyale, Marsabit). Three fatalities reported.
On 8 June 2020, a police officer was attacked and killed by three men, armed with pangas, knives and clubs, in Tchundwa village in Lamu East (Basuba, Lamu East, Lamu).

On 6 June 2020, four people were reportedly killed in clashes between Borana and Degodia communities at Barderero, Moyale (Moyale, Marsabit). Conflicting reports suggested that there were 7 fatalities.

source: AP; Daily Nation (Kenya); Kenya Standard; Citizen (Kenya)
notes: On 30 May 2020, police officers shot and killed a suspected Al Shabaab militant and two children he used as a shield in Diani (Msambweni, Kwale) after he threw a grenade at the police. The suspect's wife and three other children were also injured.
Around 29 May 2020, two Kenya military officers and a police officers were injured during a clash with suspected Al Shabaab members in Garissa town (Dujis, Garissa).

Around 25 May 2020 (between 23 May - 27 May), Kipsigis and Maasai communities clashed in Ololbangi in Narok South Subcounty (Narok) and Olpusimoru in Narok North subcounty (Narok), respectively. Eight fatalities reported. Two confirmed in Oloruasi area, one confirmed on the Narok-Nakuru border. Several houses were torched. The clash was reportedly over livestock theft. Fatalities split between two events.

Around 25 May 2020 (between 23 May - 27 May), Kipsigis and Maasai communities clashed in Ololbangi in Narok South Subcounty (location coded to Olololunga, Narok South, Narok) and Olpusimoru in Narok North subcounty (Narok), respectively. Eight fatalities. Two confirmed in Oloruasi area, one confirmed on the Narok-Nakuru border. Several houses were torched. The clash was over livestock theft. Fatalities split between two events.

On 22 May 2020, Ikoli and Nandi community militias, armed with arrows, clashed in Kakamega County (Kakamega, Lurambi, Kakamega). Villagers in Ikoli accused some Nandi villagers of trespassing into their grazing fields. Five injuries and one fatality reported.
On 18 May 2020, Al Shabaab members shot at police officers along the Bura-East-Garissa Lappset road (Mwatate, Taita Taveta) after the police vehicle missed a planted IED. No fatalities reported.

On 15 May 2020, an unknown number of suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked the Khorof Harar police post in Wajir East, near Qarsa (Wajir East, Wajir). The armed attackers raided the police post with motors and grenades and launched heavy gunfire. 7 police officers killed.
On 13 May 2020, armed bandits clashed with police forces during an attack on Ngaratuko village (Baringo North, Baringo) and injured a Tugen National Police Reservist.

Around 5 May 2020 (as reported), a KFS officer was attacked by a group of youth, armed with swords, over the eviction of squatters from Kirisia Forest near Maralal (Samburu West, Samburu). No fatalities reported.
On 24 April 2020, police killed a suspect accused of being part or a terror group in Likoni (Likoni, Mombasa) and seized several weapons.
Around 24 April 2020, a Kenyan military base was attacked in Sheikh Barrow (Lafey, Mandera). Al Shabaab claimed responsibility. No casualties reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
notes: On 22 April 2020, a shootout was reported between Jubaland troops and the Somali National Army (SNA) in Mandera Town (Mandera East, Mandera). No casualties reported.
Around 15 April 2020 (month of), a fire fight was reported in Qaqabey near Wajir (Wajir East, Wajir) between police and suspected al Shabaab members. At least 10 fatalities reported.

On 13 April 2020, two suspected Al Shabaab militants were killed and several police officers were injured during a gun battle in Wajir (Wajir East, Wajir). Number of casualties not confirmed by police.
On 7 April 2020, 10 houses were set alight during inter-clan clashes between two Maasai ethnic militias in Pimbinyiet (Narok South, Narok).

On 3 April 2020, one person was fatally shot when Isiria and Erwasingishu clans from the Maasai ethnic group clashed in Trans Mara district (Transmara West, Narok) over livestock theft. Police intervened.
On 21 March 2020, Kenyan military forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants in Milihoi (Mkunumbi, Lamu West, Lamu). No casualties were reported.
Around 19 March 2020, Kenyan Military Forces killed 12 Al Shabaab militants in Boni National Reserve (Hulugho, Garissa).

actor1: Military Forces of Kenya (2013-) Special Forces
notes: On 13 March 2020, Kenyan special forces killed six suspected Al Shabaab militants and captured one in the Jirole area in Garissa (Dujis, Garissa).

On 4 March 2020, a large group of youth from Siaya district (armed with machetes) attacked Shibina village in Mumias West constituency (Kakamega district), prompting fighting with youth from the village, resulting in two deaths (one from each side). The cause of the clash is said to be related to cattle rustling in the area.
On 26 February 2020, armed clashes broke out between residents and a group of at least 50 men hired by a private developer regarding a land dispute in Athi River (Mavoko, Machakos).

On 26 February 2020, unidentified assailants attacked the Naibung'a conservancy near Mukogodo (Mugogodo West, Laikipia North, Laikipia). 2 police reservists and 2 attackers were killed and a school building was destroyed.
On 25 February 2020, clashes broke out between two groups of people in Arbeqarmso (coded as Wajir) over a land dispute. 1 person was killed and 18 others injured.
On 21 February 2020, alleged armed bandits attacked and killed three National Police Reservists from the Tugen ethnic group near Chemorongion (Marigat, Baringo) during cattle raids.
On 11 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants clashed with police in Bula Golol, Fafi. 1 police officer was killed.
On 9 February 2020, Al Shabaab clashed with police in Milihoi, Lamu. They burnt two construction vehicles. No casualties were reported.
Around 8 February 2020, Al Shabaab claims it attacked the Hulugho police station in Garissa County. 3 police officers were wounded.
On 27 January 2020, the Siria and Uasin Gushi clans clashed in Trans Mara, leaving 70 people displaced.
On 27 January 2020, a police officer was killed by unidentified armed assailants related to inter-clan clashes in Trans Mara (Transmara West, Narok).
On 27 January 2020, Pokot militants attacked Turkanas working in construction near Lomelo in Kapedo. 1 police officer was killed in the attack, along with 2 others. 14 others were injured.
On 23 January 2020, unidentified armed assailants clashed with police between Liboi and Dadaab in Garissa County. 1 police officer was injured.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Kenya (2013-); Pandanguo Communal Militia (Kenya)
notes: On 18 January 2020, around 60 suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked Pandanguo (Lamu West, Lamu), engaging residents in a gunfight before clashing with Kenyan General Service Unit Police and military forces. No fatalities were reported.
On 11 January 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a police post and then a communications post nearby in Olla, Mandera County. No casualties were reported.

On 7 January 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired at a Safaricom mast and clashed with police guarding the facility in Saretho in Dadaab, Garissa County. Children from a nearby school were also targeted in the attack. 4 civilians and 2 attackers were killed.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: On 5 January 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked Camp Simba military base in Manda Bay (Lamu) used by Kenyan and US military forces. Soldiers repelled the attack and killed 4 militants. 1 Kenyan soldier and 3 US soldiers were also killed, though Kenyan authorities denied the casualty.
On 2 January 2020, Kenyan soldiers killed 4 suspected Al Shabaab fighters and arrested 1 other in Nyangoro (Lamu County) after the fighters had attacked a bus in the area.
On 21 December 2019, inter-clan clashes took place in Narok County, leaving 3 people dead and 15 more injured.

On 8 December 2019, members of the Kieleweke and Tanga Tanga groups clashed in Nyeri outside of a school where Deputy President William Ruto was going to be attending an event. Over 10 people were arrested.

In the early hours of 4 December 2019, Al Shabaab militants reportedly attacked the city of Diiso in Fafi, Garissa county, with no report of fatalities nor injuries. While the organisation claimed to have taken control of the city, including its police station, Kenyan media sources only reported about police forces thwarting an attack on a Safaricom mast in the city, with militants only destroying a diesel generator before fleeing towards the Somali border.

On or before November 8, 2019, police clashed with cattle raiders at an unspecified location on the Meru side of the Meru-Isiolo border (coordinates for Ndumuru, Meru county, used at prec2). Reports suggest that gunfire was involved, though police have denied this.

On 5 November 2019, an unidentified armed group attacked Jaldesa (Marsabit county), killing at least 7, including 2 police who were engaged in a firefight with the attackers. The attack is said to be retaliatory in nature, though there is no further information.

Around Oct 27th 2019 (exact date not reported), two Siria and Ruasi Ngishu clans clashed at the Enoororet-Enoorsoen border in Trans Mara district. 31 people were shot with arrows. No fatalities reported.

Around Oct 26th 2019 (exact date not reported) clashes took place in Trans Mara district between Siria and Ilwuasi Ngishu clan militias. 6 people were injured, including one officer deployed to sepatate the clans.
On Oct 15th 2019, 10 unknown men ambushed and shot a security ranger, who was patrolling Laikipia Nature and Conservancy ranch with two colleagues. After and exchange of fire, one person died.

On Oct 14th 2019, in Wangwachi (coded as Sipili with GP2, for unfound Wangwachi) unknown armed men shot and wounded two National Police Reservists, who were transported to Sipili Hospital. No fatalities reported.

On 6 October 2019, in Mau forest (no exact location reported, location coded as Mau Narok with GP2) a Kenya Forest Service officer on patrol was shot with an arrow by some forest settlers facing eviction, who had been complaining over police harassment, destruction of property, and the closure of roads leading to their former homes. No reported fatalities.
01 Oct. 3 Suspected Alshabaab militants killed by Kenyan police in Likoni. The suspects were on the mission to carry out terrorist attack according to the report

On Aug 28th, in the village of Kosovo, at the border of Naivasha and Narok counties (coded as Naivasha with GP2 for unfound Kosovo), a police officer was killed by locals. After 2,000 acres were sold to some pastoralists by ADC, a group locals claimed that the land belonged to their ancestors. While a manager of the the Agricultural Development Corporation, his staff and the police officer were visiting the land, they were attacked by an unknown armed group of around 50 youth who killed a police officer by a poisoned arrow. A tractor belonging to ADC was burnt by the attackers.

Between 25th and 26th of Sep. two people killed in the clash between Maasai's two clans. The two clans, Siria and Uasin Gishu are fighting over a two-acre parcel of land located at the border in Trans Mara District. One source reported the event to be on the 25th while the other source reported it to be on the 26th.
On Sept 20th, in Mkocheni village (coded as Taveta with precision2), a fight between farmers and herders over access to a water source arose, leaving serious injuries.

On Sept 17th 2019, in Garba Tula, Borana and Somalis clashed. Armed Borana allegedly descended on their Somali counterparts, killing the three herders. In a retaliatory attack, a Borana elder was killed and five others were injured.
On Sept 10th, the body of a dead soldier was found by residents of Mtongwe (Mombasa neighborhood), where he was believed to be based. No further information is available.
On 10 September 2019, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a KDF convoy near Elwak (Mandera county), killing at least 5 soldiers.
On Aug 25th 2019, in Safarisi, herders and farmers clashed over pasture. Farmers accused the herders (mostly from Tana River and Garissa counties) of grazing animals on their farms. A man was killed.
22 August: Al Shabaab militants attacked Kenyan security forces in Mandera. Two Kenyan police killed in the attack.
27 July: One Kenyan airport police was killed in the clash with a group of armed men that approached them pretending to be GSU, General Service Unit police.

actor2: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) Border Patrol Unit
notes: 15 July: Three suspected Al Shabaab militants were killed in Lamu by Kenya border patrol police soon after the detonated IED injured two officers in Kiunga -Somalia road.
20 June: Al Shabaab militants attacked a police camp in Garissa. 3 Al Shabaab militants were killed in the fight
On Jun 14th 2019, in Quri area of Garba Tula, Borana and Somalis clashed. Five people, among which a young girl, were killed. Several were injured.
04 June: Al Shabaab and Kenyan police forces clashed in Fino, Mandera county. One person from each group killed in the clash.

In May 2019 (exact date not reported), Borana and Somalis clashed in El Digale, at the Isiolo-Garissa border (location coded as Garba Tula with GP2, for unfound El Digale). Two teenage herders were killed and one injured.
05 May: Al Shabaab militants attacked a village in Mandera. One kenyan police wounded as they tried to fight back.
23 April: Police clashed with bandits in an operation to recover stolen cattle in Marti, Samburu. One police shot dead, three others seriously injured and two children abducted.
12 April: Armed men abducted 2 Cuban doctors in Mandera after killing their body guard, a police officer.
08 April: Kenyan police exchanged fire with a group of five gunmen who were pretending to be policemen and imposing illegal roadblock on the Machakos road. 3 killed.

On Mar 24th 2019, at the border of Isiolo and Garissa counties (coded as Mado Gashi with GP2) two herders were killed. The motives of the clash, according to authorities, might be linked to natural resoucers, as the two herders were killed at water points.
13 March: 3 people killed in ethnic clash between Borana Oromo and Gabra tribes in Saku.
07 March: Unidentified armed group stopped police car and started firing at them. The police fired back and killed two of them and left two wounded in Limuru
27 February: Kenyan police killed two armed men who were transporting illegal ammunition in West Pokot County.
16 February: Three people including a police officer died in clashes between Pokot and Turkana communties in Kainuk.

15-16 January: Al Shabaab militants attacked the DusitD2 hotel in Westlands, Nairobi using hand grenades, guns, suicide bombings and blowing up vehicles. Soldiers and police reacted with gunfire. 21 people total (including the attackers, civilians and one member of security forces) were killed in the attack. It is not clear if the al Shabaab fatalities were due to suicide bombings or the security response. 28 others were injured. The attack began on the afternoon of the 15th and carried into the following day. One American and one Briton were among the dead.

15-16 January: Al Shabaab militants attacked the DusitD2 hotel in Westlands, Nairobi using hand grenades, guns, suicide bombings and blowing up vehicles. Soldiers and police reacted with gunfire. 21 people total (including the attackers, civilians and one member of security forces) were killed in the attack. It is not clear if the al Shabaab fatalities were due to suicide bombings or the security response. 28 others were injured. The attack began on the afternoon of the 15th and carried into the following day. One American and one Briton were among the dead.
25 December: Al Shabaab claimed to have killed two Kenyan police and injured three others in Mandera town.
17 December: Members of Kenya Defense Forces clashed with Al Shabaab members trying to plant an explosive device at Bodhei, Lamu County. No casualties reported.

On December 14th or 15th, clashes erupted in Ololoipangi, Nkoben and Oloruasi in Narok South in the area of Olololunga. One elderly man was killed, and up to eight people injured, seemingly with arrows. The clashes follows violence in September between the Maasai and Kipsigi groups (who have been coded as the actors for this event).

On December 14th or 15th, clashes erupted in Ololoipangi, Nkoben and Oloruasi in Narok South in the area of Olololunga. One elderly man was killed, and up to eight people injured, seemingly with arrows. The clashes follows violence in September between the Maasai and Kipsigi groups (who have been coded as the actors for this event).

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) Rapid Deployment Unit
notes: On or around December 13th, 14 police from the Rapid Deployment Unit at Kapedo entered Mandera police station in order to release a colleague who was being held for robbery with violence. The Kapedo police fired in the air - and held the Madera police commander hostage -whilst they released the detained officer from the cells, before walking back to Kapedo. No injuries were reported.

On 12 December 2018, unknown gunmen shot dead the former deputy governor of Kilifi outside his house in Nyali (Mombasa) in the presence of his security guard. The gunmen were reported to have been attempting to rob the victim, and proceeded to rob his security guard of Ksh 6,000.

On 10 December 2018, two sections of the Lou Nuer clashed in the Kakuma Refugee camp (Turkana), reportedly over a girl who had been impregnated. Two people were reported to have died, and eight (seemingly civilians) were injured, one seriously. The source does not specify which weapons were used in the incident, if any.
On or around December 8th, an armed gang (wearing police uniforms) robbed a petrol station in Mandera town, killing a security guard in the process. Police are investigating.
On 6 December 2018, police and two gang members exchanged gunfire at Kayole (Nairobi). One gang member died in the exchange, another fled the scene.
On or before November 29th, police fired shots at anti-corruption police who came to arrest two regular police office as part of a sting operation in Nairobi.

On 27 November 2018, police shot dead two suspected gang members and wounded a third at an unspecified location along the Nakuru-Nairobi highway (coordinates for Nakuru town used). The gang had stolen a lorry, and were being pursued by the police. The injured gang member is at large.

On 24 November 2018, a gang known as 'Military' engaged in a firefight with police as they were attacking civilians in Likoni (Mombasa). Police shot one gang member, who died later in hospital, and arrested seven. The gang members retaliated later against civilians (coded in separate event).

On 23 November 2018, a gang attacked a police officer on patrol in Ganjoni (Mombasa), seriously wounding the officer. The gang also robbed 5,000 KSH from the officer. The source indicates the victim was attacked with a machete.

On 22 November 2018, clashes between the Kapkeny and Kabasiran clans broke out in the Mogil area (coordinates for Kapsowar, Elgeyo-Marakwet, used) leaving one person killed and two wounded. The sources states that the violence relates to a long-running land dispute.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) Border Patrol Unit
notes: On 19 November 2018, the Police Border Patrol Unit repulsed an attack from Al Shabaab in or near the Boni forest of Ijara (Garissa county), killing either one or four fighters, and injuring several (coded as lowest etimate). There were no reports of casualties among the police.
On 16 November 2018, alleged bandits from Marakwet attacked the area of Chemusto in Pokot (coordinates for Kapenguria, West Pokot, used). During the raid, two of the suspected bandits were killed.
On 15 November 2018, after unknown gunmen killed a civilian in Sewes (Elgeyo-Marakwet, coordinates for Endo used), a police reservist responded to the distress call and was shot dead by the group.

On November 8th or 9th, the Matan and Geledle clans once again clashed, at an unspecified location in Wajir (coordinates for Wajir used). Three civilians, including a teenage girl, were killed in the violence.

On 7 November 2018, suspected Turkana raiders killed three police reservists and wounded two as they attempted to prevent them from stealing livestock at an unspecified location along the Igembe Central and Isiolo North border (coordinates for Isiolo town used).

On 7 November 2018, Matan and Geledle clans fought over a disputed joint settlement scheme in Qara (Wajir, coordinates for Kara Agarsu used, precision 2). One person was killed in the clash, and two injured.

On 6 November 2018, clash between suspected pastoralists from Lagdera and Uchana communities in the area of Janju (Isiolo, close to Mado Gashi) in retaliation for earlier violence in the area.Three people died in the clash, including one 'raider' and two children, and an unknown number of people were wounded.

On 4 November 2018, clash between suspected pastoralists from Lagdera and Uchana communities in Mado Gashi market (Isiolo) after an earlier 'botched raid' by the Lagdera in Mata Bofu. One person was injured.

On 3 November 2018, clashes between pastoralist communities from Lagdera in Garissa county and Uchana in Isiollo. Two members of the Ladgera died in the skirmish, whilst two local militiamen were injured. It is unclear what caused the clash. This came amidst tensions in Garba Tula as approx 250 people displaced from Eldera over land were refusing to move from Garba Tula.

On or before November 2nd, two Maasai clans were reported to have clashed in Nkararo, Trans Mara West (coordinates for Trans Mara, Narok, used). Four people were injured by arrow fire, and police intervened to separate the groups. The source states that the clashes were part of a border dispute.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) Prison Guards
actor2: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) Prison Guards
notes: On 2 November 2018, two senior prison officers assaulted another prison officer at Malindi prison (Kilifi). After pistol whipping the victim, they ran him over with a Land Cruiser. The victim survived, and is currently in hospital. Police are investigating the incident.

On 31 October 2018, suspected bandits attacked Kapkondot in Marakwet East (Elegeyo-Marakwet), seemingly to loot cattle. The bandits clashed with local police reservists, resulting in one fatality on the side of the bandits.
On 28 October 2018, police tracked and shot dead six gang members suspected of raping a woman, in the Dandora suburb of Nairobi.

On 26 October 2018, a gang shot and wounded a police officer during a failed robbery in the Mathare neighbourhood of Nairobi. The gang member was then killed by police, though two other suspects escaped the scene.

On 19 October 2018, police clashed with an armed gang in Kayole (Nairobi). One gang member was killed, and a police officer is in critical condition after being shot in the head. Police were reported to have arrested 200 local residents, which the source described as 'suspects'.

On or before October 17th, two people were killed in a clash in Jaldesa (Marsabit), and two police reservists were wounded in the crossfire. The violence comes amidst recent ethnically-motivated clashes in the area. A number of local politicians have been questioned.

During the week beginning October 15th, clashes occurred at an unspecified location in Marsabit amidst ethnic violence. 10 killed (coded as 8 here and 2 for a clash in Jaldesa). Two local politicians were arrested on October 22nd over their alleged role in the violence.

On 12 October 2018, a British-South African manager of the Olarro Nature Conservancy was shot in the head with an arrow at close range in Maji Moto (Narok). The attacker was wearing Maasai clothing. The manager fired two shots in the air, before escaping. He was patrolling near a disputed dam, that Maji Moto communities accused the conservationists of badly managing.

On 12 October 2018, an armed group attacked Shurr village in Marsabit county (coordinates for the state capital of Marsabit town used). In the ensuing gunfight, three residents of the town were killed, as was one of the attackers. The source describes the clash as being 'ethnic' in nature.

On 1 October 2018, 12 gang members broke into a biscuit factory in Thika town (Kiambu county), and assaulted the security guards, before looting goods from the factory. Police arrived and shot six of the robbers dead, whilst six of the robbers fled the scene, apparently after all had sustained gunshot wounds. The police claimed that one of the gang members was in possession of a crude firearm.
25 September 2018: Al-Shabaab forces reportedly killed a Kenyan soldier in Lamu county (location unspecified by the source).

On 25 September 2018, a pro-Al Shabaab radio station reported that Al Shabaab forces had attacked a KDF camp at Taksile, north of Lamu (coordinates for Lamu used). According to the source, 10 KDF soldiers were killed, and three Al Shabaab fighters were also killed.

24 September 2018: Al-Shabaab militants claim to have overrun a Kenyan military base in Taksile area north of Pandaguo, Lamu County, killing 10 Kenyan soldiers and admitting three deaths among their own ranks. Kenyan military sources also reported the clashes, although they claimed that 10 Al-Shabaab fighters had been killed. Fatalities coded at the most conservative estimate.

On 24 September 2018, KDF soldiers attacked an Al Shabaab hideout at Taksile, north of Lamu (coordinates for Lamu used), killing 10 Al Shabaab fighters, and seizing weapons and ammunition. 3 KDF soldiers were reported to have been injured in the attack and weapons were recovered.

On 25 September 2018, Kipsigi and Maasai militias clashed at Olpusimo (Narok). Seven people were injured in arrow fire, and 10 dwellings were torched. Police intervened to separate the two groups, and security has been increased in the area.

At some point during the middle of September, two communal militias clashed in the village of Oronderi in Marsabit county (coordinates for the state capital of Marsabit town used), reportedly over a land dispute. No further detail is provided in the source.
On 15 September 2018, suspected Pokot militiamen shot and wounded three police officers in an ambush in Ramacha, Baringo South.

On 14 September 2018, a local militia fired arrows at police in Nessuit (Njoro, Nakuru). Police then fired at the attackers, killing one. Several arrests took place that day, including of the Deputy Speaker of the county, and two tribal chiefs. The events are part of ongoing violence in the area.
On or before September 13th, clashes took place in Ndoswa (Nakuru, approximate coordinates used), with a number of Ogiek buildings burnt. There were no reports of injuries or deaths.
On 13 September 2018, armed men attacked and killed a Nyumba Kumi official, an unarmed community watch officer associated with police, at Barsheba area in Kisauni, Mombasa.

On 13 September 2018, further clashes were reported between the Ogiek and Kipsigi groups in Nessuit, Eastern Mau Forest (Nakuru, coordinates for Mau Narok used). One person was killed, and more houses were torched.

On September 11th and 12th, armed clashes were reported in the Nessuiet, Mariashoni, Mauche, and other wards of Njoro county (Nakuru) between the Ogiek and Kipsigi groups, which resulted in 6 deaths (coded across 6 events) and 17 injuries. Houses were also torched in the clashes. The identities of the victims are not known. The clashes are likely spillover from violence in neighbouring Narok that flared up after a dispute over livestock theft and occupation of land on the edges of the Mau Forest.

On September 11th and 12th, armed clashes were reported in the Nessuiet, Mariashoni, Mauche, and other wards of Njoro county (Nakuru) between the Ogiek and Kipsigi groups, which resulted in 6 deaths (coded across 6 events) and 17 injuries. Houses were also torched in the clashes. The identities of the victims are not known. The clashes are likely spillover from violence in neighbouring Narok that flared up after a dispute over livestock theft and occupation of land on the edges of the Mau Forest.

Houses were also torched in the clashes. The identities of the victims are not known. The clashes are likely spillover from violence in neighbouring Narok that flared up after a dispute over livestock theft and occupation of land on the edges of the Mau Forest.

On 12 September 2018, police killed two suspected gang members who had been active in the Juja area, at Karuguru close to the Eastern Bypass (coordinates for Juja, Kiambu, used). Eight gang members escaped.

On September 11th and 12th, armed clashes were reported in the Nessuiet, Mariashoni, Mauche, and other wards of Njoro county (Nakuru) between the Ogiek and Kipsigi groups, which resulted in 6 deaths (coded across 6 events) and 17 injuries. Houses were also torched in the clashes. The identities of the victims are not known. The clashes are likely spillover from violence in neighbouring Narok that flared up after a dispute over livestock theft and occupation of land on the edges of the Mau Forest.

Houses were also torched in the clashes. The identities of the victims are not known. The clashes are likely spillover from violence in neighbouring Narok that flared up after a dispute over livestock theft and occupation of land on the edges of the Mau Forest.
