Houses were also torched in the clashes. The identities of the victims are not known. The clashes are likely spillover from violence in neighbouring Narok that flared up after a dispute over livestock theft and occupation of land on the edges of the Mau Forest.

07 September. Two days of clashes took place on September 6th and 7th in Olmekenyu (Narok county), between Maasai and Kipsigi militias, seemingly in response to the murder of a herder on September 4th. Two people were killed in the clashes (which involved spears and bows and arrows), and at least thirteen injured, whilst a significant amount of property was torched and cattle looted (the deaths have been split over two events). Police attempted to separate the groups, and used tear gas at one point. Subsequent reports have suggested the violence has its roots in land disputes and/or involvement of local politicians, which have been exacerbated by incidents of theft.

Two days of clashes on or before September 6th in Olmekenyu (Narok county), between Maasai and Kipsigi militias, seemingly in response to the murder of a herder on September 4th. Two people were killed in the clashes (which involved spears and bows and arrows), and thirteen injured, whilst a significant amount of property was torched (the deaths have been split over two events). Police attempted to separate the groups, and used tear gas at one point.

On 5 September 2018, two people were killed following armed clashes between Gabra and Borana pastoralist militia over pasture in Horonder, between Moyale and Marsabit. The first person died during clashes on 5 Sept, while the second passed away the following morning. Three other people were wounded.

On or before September 4th, police killed three men suspected of murdering a local chief, in Kanyagia village (Nyeri county). Police activities against political militias have been stepped up in the area.

On or before September 3rd, armed gangsters raided a petrol station in Oyugis town (Homa Bay district). The two security guards at the station had their hands tied, and an unspecified amount of money was stolen. Two of the robbers were wearing police uniforms and carry AKs, whilst the remaining six were not.

On or before September 3rd, a militia comprising traders from the Maasai ethnic group attacked traders at Muthurwa market in Narok Town and set fire to the market, following the destruction of Maasai stalls by the local government. The Maasai were said to be armed, whilst the traders they were attacking used machetes to defend themselves. One person (from an unspecified group) was killed, and seven were injured. Police were also attacked once they became involved.
On or before August 26th, police killed five gang members in the Dandora area of Nairobi. The police ambushed the gang members following a tip-off, and seized weapons and cannabis.
On or before August 26th, police killed a gang member in the Lucky Summer neighbourhood of Nairobi, following a failed robbery attempt on a matutu. Three gang members escaped.
26 July. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a group of police in Milihoi. One dead, two injured. Security forces added personnel to the region in response.

12 July. Rural Border Patrol Unit repulsed an attempted al Shabaab attack on their camp at Manza in Sheikh Barrow (coordinates approx), Mandera County. No police injury; al Shabaab casualty not known.

10 July. Al Shabaab elements raid Hamey police post in Loboi, Garissa post during the early morning hours. A gunbattle ensued. One officer missing, four others wounded. Al Shabaab also destroyed communication masts in the area. A second report indicates al Shabaab overran the post, killing three officers and stealing weapons.

03 July. Four police officers have been injured when they were ambushed by suspected al-Shabab militants in Garissa's Ijara Sub-County, eastern Kenya. The officers were escorting a grader when they were ambushed between Sangailu and Handaro in Ijara by heavily armed suspected members of al-Shabab. Al Shabaab claims 7 dead.
28 June. One member of al Shabaab is dead and a second wounded following a gunbattle with security forces in Tarbaj sub-location of Wajir County.
23 June. One dead and several injured after two groups of Wajir herders clashed over pasture land.

21 May. Two people are feared dead and four missing after two rival pastoralist communities clashed in Isiolo County. Fighting occurred in in Lotik, Loruko, Attan, Alamach, Emegen and Ngaremara. The identities of the perpetrators is not known.

21 May. Two people are feared dead and four missing after two rival pastoralist communities clashed in Isiolo County. Fighting occurred in in Lotik, Loruko, Attan, Alamach, Emegen and Ngaremara. The identities of the perpetrators is not known.
15 May. Two suspected Al-Shabaab returnees were shot dead in Kwale by unidentified gunmen on motorcycles.
13 May. Two police reservists were shot dead, while two others sustained injuries after suspected Pokot militia attacked the Kapedo Catholic church. The police were serving as church guards.
04 May. A perpetrator, 'pretending to be a boda boda rider' shoots and injures a police officer in Kilifi. The officer was shot in the chest five times.

03 May. Al Shabaab attacks Mandera, killing four 'non-Muslim' quarry workers. Several other injuries reported. The police later 'rescued' 150 workers involved in the incident. However, it is not certain if any of the workers were held hostage at any point.
21 April. Cattle thieves engage Tugen militia in a gun battle. One Tugen herder killed, 50 cows stolen.
Al Shabaab fighters attack Fino, Mandera. Four police and one reservist killed, two police missing.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: 28 Feb. Police repulsed an al Shabaab attack on a station in Wajir. Three suspects were arrested by a combined team of General Service Unit and AP officers. Police said the attackers fired into the camps, leading to a gunfight that lasted almost 20 minutes.

Seven suspects believed to be part of a group of militants arrested in Isiolo County last week were arrested by security officers in Mbarambate, Garbatulla. Two others were shot and killed while trying to escape.

Police have foiled a 'major terrorist attack' after fighting off gunmen, killing one and arresting two others, after which they found a cache of arms including 36 grenades and five automatic rifles. Initial investigations showed the car was headed to Nairobi where the group planned to use it as a Vehicle Borne Improvised Explosive Device (VBIED).

An al Shabaab suspect was killed while two others were arrested after engaging police officers in a gun battle at their hideout in Merti, Isiolo County. Police recovered more than 1,000 bullets, 36 grenades, 18 IEDs, 5 AK-47 rifles and an assortment of other weapons.
Two Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) soldiers have been killed during a shootout between them and police officers at Sheikh Barrow in Mandera County. The exchange may have been a case of mistaken identity.
14/02, AM, Boni Forrest: Kenyan forces claim to kill three al Shabaab after being ambushed.
Al Shabaab attacks a military camp at Kutulo, Wajir during the morning hours. The bodies of three belonging to the attackers were later found in the area.

Two soldiers were killed after their truck ran over an Improvised Explosive Device at Handaro, Holugho sub-county, Garissa County. Three other soldiers who tried to jump off the vehicle were reportedly shot at close range by the suspected militia and were seriously wounded.
Since December 2017, more than [8] people have been killed in clashes between members of the Arjuran and Degodia clans at the Eldas and Wajir North sub-counties boundary. Dates not provided.
Kenyan officials said a civilian was killed and several policemen wounded when suspected members of the Somalia-based group al-Shabaab attacked a convoy of vehicles.

Al-Shabab has claimed responsibility for an attack on a Kenyan police station located along the common border in Mandera on 2 January. 'Reports from al-Shabab Mujahideen say that six soldiers (police) were killed in the attack with one being the commander of the police in the area, four were killed in the raid on the police camp while two other soldiers were killed in an ambush while they were rushing to back up their colleagues from El Waq town,' the website reported.

Kenya Defence Forces soldiers killed five suspected al-Shabab militants believed to have been involved in the attack on Ijara Police Station in Garissa. KDF said a vehicle that had been taken away by the militants during the attack on the Ijara station on Saturday, 30 December was destroyed after explosives it was carrying exploded during a gunfight that ensued between the soldiers and the militants.

Al Shabaab terrorists have set on fire two police camps in Ijara, in the latest attack from the Somalia-based militant group. The attackers also destroyed the main communication equipment used in the town before speeding off with a police land cruiser which is yet to be recovered. A senior police officer briefed on the matter has told Capital News beat that no casualty was reported in the attack.
Since December 2017, more than [8] people have been killed in clashes between members of the Arjuran and Degodia clans at the Eldas and Wajir North sub-counties boundary. Dates not provided.

Two Administration Police officers have died while three others have been injured after suspected Al-Shabaab militants ambushed an escort vehicle they were travelling in at Lango La Simba in Nyongoro, along the Lamu-Malindi road.

Kenya's security forces on Monday destroyed six Al-Shabaab training camps in an ongoing operation to flush out militants from the vast Boni forest in the coastal town of Lamu. 'Many' Al-Shabaab militants were killed and others injured during the operation.

Three police officers were killed on Tuesday. A team of police officers were headed back to a settlement called Lomelo from Kapedo where they delivered food rations to police camps when bandits sprayed their vehicle with bullets, killing the officers. A group of officers sent for reinforcement and rescue their colleagues were also caught up in the ambush, which left 10 with injuries and one missing.

At least eleven houses have been razed at Esoit in Trans Mara as renewed fighting between Kipsigis and Maasai communities erupted. No fatalities following the incident as residents of Bogoria Village had temporarily abandoned their homes following prolonged insecurity.

Beneficiaries of government-allocated land clashed with squatters in Taveta. Eye witnesses report that 2 people were killed by bows and arrows in the clashes, although the authorities deny these deaths.

Transport in Mandera County has been paralysed after operators suspended bus services in the county for three days after al-Shabab attacked two police vehicles on Monday evening. Al-Shabab militants ambushed and burnt down two police land cruisers in an attack in Daba City, Mandera County on Monday. The two vehicles carrying police officers were escorting a bus to Mandera when they were hit by rocket-propelled grenades. 12 killed, several wounded.

The KDF intercepted an Al Shabaab group of militants who was heavily armed and planning to carry out attacks in Lamu West on Thursday. An operation (Linda Boni) was called to capture the militants who escaped during the gun battle into the Boni forest. During the incident, six AK-47 assault rifles, 321 bullets, three grenades and explosives were recovered.

Police were patrolling the private ranches in Ol Moran and Ratia and were attacked by the pastoralists when they tried to evict them. There was an exchange of fire between the officers and the pastoralists who were all armed. The latter destroyed a vehicle, after which the police countered with fire in a 2-hour long battle.
Police gunned down three men suspected of having killed the two police officers. They also recovered the stolen weapons and the AK-47s. The fighting lasted for 5 hours.

As a revenge to the previous event, the Kikuyu joined forces and attacked the Luo. The ethnic tensions and violence led to one severely injured person. Residents claims three were killed and dozens, including three school children, were injured.
2 Kenyan police officers are killed during an ambush in Nairobi. The attackers were armed with AK47s and they stole the officers weapons after killing them with shots from the back.
Four Al-Shabaab members were killed by the KDF in Mararani after the soldiers raided the camp on Monday, forcing the other militants to abandon it.

On 16 October 2017, three people were injured in clashes between the Luo and the Kuria communities living in Karamu village in Migori County, located at the border of Suna West and Kuria West constituencies. One motorcycle was burnt by armed youths.
5 Al Shabaab militants were killed by Kenyan military during an operation in Boni Forest.
On 10 October 2017, more than 10 police officers exchanged fire with suspected al-Shabab militants after nearly hitting an IED at Mambore-Mkokoni area .
On 9 October 2017, five militants were killed by the Kenyan Defence Force during a raid in Boni Forest. Others escaped with injuries.
Eight men were found dead in Trans Mara district after dispute over land between the Maasai and Kipsigis.
Al Shabaab militants who attempted to carry out an attack were driven out by the officers from the Rural Border Patrol Unit on Monday.

A gun battle was reported between police and Al Shabaab militants in Mandera Town Monday morning. Mandera County Commissioner Fredrick Shisia said more security personnel had been deployed to secure the area but could not confirm if there were casualties so far.
Two Police Officers were killed and their rifles were stolen by unknown gunmen. The two officers were manning the church compound when they were killed.

Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) and police exchanged fire with Al Shabaab militants after they destroyed a telecommunication mast in Mandera County. The police reservists were overpowered by the attackers as they engaged in gunfight but none was injured during the 1:30 a.m. attack at Dabacity area. A loud explosion was heard and police reservists guarding the mast reported an attack at Dabacity by the militants but none of the police reservists was injured in the incident.
Two policemen were Friday afternoon shot dead by unknown gunmen while on patrol at Miti Kenda area in Kibichoi, Kiambu County.

Anti-terror police shot dead wanted Al Shabaab member Hussein Said Omar. He was one of the Al Shabaab militants behind the Mpeketoni attack that claimed lives of more than 60 people in June 2014. He engaged security personnel in a shootout from his hideout in Bamburi before he was shot dead by the police. The event took place on 18/08 or before.

2 police officers were killed in post-election riots in Nairobi. Reports indicate that that incident occurred in Kiambu,where gunmen pumped four bullets into each of the officers before jumping into waiting motorcycles and riding off. The attackers snatched an AK-47 rifle from one of the officers. Suspected Al-Shabaab but not confirmed.

Five unidentified attackers armed with knives attacked a polling station where elections results were being tallied in Hola town, stabbing one person. Police intervened, shooting dead two of the assailants. The three others escaped.
5 knife-wielding men attacked a polling station in Galole. They killed 1 person, before police opened fire, killing 2 of the attackers.
Police officers engaged in a shoot out with Al Shabaab, after a landmine injured civilians in Nyorongo
Al Shabab forces attacked the village of Damase in Garissa county and seized it fully after brief fighting with Kenyan police officers who fled the area during the fighting.
A Police Officer was killed during an attempted attack by Al-Shabaab at Lafey police station. Some of Al-Shabaab members suffered injuries when police responded wih gunshots. A police car was stolen
A police officer was shot dead by a colleague on Wednesday. Police are investigating the case
One attacker was shot and killed, while a police officer was found dead after being taken hostage during a 20-hour siege at the home of Deputy President William Ruto.

actor2: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: A police officer was injured when the home of deputy president was broken into by an unidentified armed group. A police officer used as a human shield is killed while the GSU kill one of the attackers.
Two suspected robbers were on Saturday morning killed in Kikuyu, Kiambu County. One of the robbers was lynched by a mob while the other was gunned down by police at Ndumbo-ini.
After a violent cattle raid, polie clash with the raiders and recapture the stolen livestock

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: Police repulse an attack by Al Shabaab on Mokowe GSU camp.

Pokot and Tugen herders clash for several hours in Kapkechir after an attack by the Pokot. The Pokot attackers killed four Tugen herder and stole their cattle. The attack led to a protest in nearby Mochongoi.

Five security officers were killed during an operation to rescue a principal secretary in the ministry of lands and physical planning. A battle between the security personnel and Al Shabaab fighters left five security officers dead
Six police officers have been killed, while four have been injured, during a shootout with Pokot bandits who ambushed them at a ranch in Kamwenje area.
After Pokot raiders kill four, one bandit was shot by police
Two herdsmen and a suspected bandit were killed in a shootout that lasted for more than an hour in Kapkechir village in Baringo.

At least three police officers and one Al shabaab member were killed after Al Shabaab raided Pandanguo Police Camp in Lamu. Al Shabaab engaged in a gun battle with the police that lasted for hours. One police officer was unaccounted for. Al Shabaab planted IEDs while raiding the station. Government troops were later deployed to Lamu to look for al-Shabab. The Kenya Standard claims 2 police dead in the attack.
There was a gunfight between cattle-raiding militants and police officers. The shots disrupted a political rally at Karumaindo shopping centre as the residents fled.
Police officers exchanged fire with Al Shabaab after they attacked the Equity Back in Elwak Town. Five police reported dead.
An Administration Police officer shot dead two of his colleagues in Baringo County, in unclear circumstances.

A police officer is admitted Nyahururu hospital after he was shot by herders during a security operation to remove illegal herders from the Laikipia Nature Conservancy. The herders and police engaged in a gun battle.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: A member of the GSU is non-fatally shot by 'bandits'.

Two people were killed and three others injured after about 200 armed bandits attacked Kamuge village in Turkana East. The bandits are said to be from Baringo East. Police reservists responded and exchange of fire with the bandits.

Raiders from Isiolo attacked an Administration Police (AP) camp at Mlango, about 30 kilometres from Isiolo Town. At the same time, five people were shot dead during a battle between police and armed communal militia at Mlango in Burat Ward, Isiolo County, who had stolen cattle. The militiamen were believed to be from Isolio and Samburu counties.
Three suspected Al-Shaabab militants were killed in a gun battle with police in Tana River County on Monday.
Three rangers were shot dead and five others seriously injured by Moran local fighters on Sunday

Herders from Isiolo and Marsabit are feared dead as they engaged each other in a deadly gun battle throughout Friday. Residents from the two sides said the herders exchanged fire that led to deaths estimated to be over 10 people. Both sides had casualties, but the Isiolo side reportedly lost more men.
3 rangers were killed in a battle with Moran cattle raiders in Archers Post.

Heavily-armed al-Shabab mujahideen movement forces have launched a major attack on a village on the outskirts of the city of Garissa [northeast Kenya].Reports from the Somali-dominated NFD [Northern Frontier Districts] of Kenya say the attack caused heavy casualties.Kenyan government officials have not officially commented on the death toll from the attack. Sources say al-Shabab forces seized control of the village, known as Amuma, with Kenyan police officials also confirming the attack to the media.

Al Shabaab militants raided Omar Jilo, in northern Kenya, where they clashed with police forces. 2 local administrators were killed and 2 police reservists were abducted. Security personnel are pursuing the attackers.

Cattle rustlers attacked the village of Seretion on 09/05/2017, recovering goats that had been stolen three days earlier. A police reservist and a suspected robber were killed in the shootout. Hundreds of locals are fleeing now to safer places, as similar attacks have taken place in the region recently.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: Police engage communal gunmen who attacked a conservationist. Two killed

Pokot raiders and police reservists engage in a firefight in Keiyo Valley on 22/04/2017. Four Pokot warriors and two civilians were killed in the shootout. According to the source, the attack could have been politically motivated and meant to intimidate communities not to take part in the Jubilee Coalition nominations.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: Two General Service Unit (GSU) officers are reported missing following a weekend shootout with herders at Matweku near the Laikipia Nature Conservancy at the border of Laikipia and Baringo counties.
Pokot militia raided several villages in Marakwet East, but were repulsed by the police.
Pokot militia raided several villages in Marakwet East, but were repulsed by the police.
There were intense firefights between Pokot militias and government forces near Olmaiso, in Laikipia.

Pokot raiders attacked Matweku police post in Ol Ari Nyiro Nature Conservancy, killing a police officer and abducting two others on 13/04/2017. Later the captured policemen were found dead at Kamwenje in Baringo. It is believed that the policemen were killed by Pokots.
A police officer and a civilian died in a firefight between Pokot militias and government forces near Olmaiso, in Laikipia, on 13/04/2017.
At least seven Pokot were killed by police during a security operation in Tiaty, Baringo County. The gunmen were allegedly planning a livestock raid.
4 people are killed by herders in Nakwomuru village in central Pokot county. Police reservists engage with the raiders, killing three of them
Pokot gunmen open fire at Ol Moran livestock market in bid to steal cattle. There are no references to injuries. But the police engage the gunmen in a battle later. No deaths reported
The car of ODM politician Hassan Joho was attacked by gunmen. Joho's bodyguard was shot and injured but no fatalities is reported. Joho claims it to be an attempt of assassination.
Mukutan Lodge was attacked by herders seeking pasture. They exchanged gunfire with the security forces and burned down the lodge.
Two unidentified neighbouring communities clash in Garissa, along its border with Wajir over a boundary dispute. One bystander was reportedly killed in the clash. Date not clear - source dated 28/03.
Three are killed in a clash between Turkana and Samburu militias. The clash was sparked by revenge for cattle theft.
At least 10 people have been killed in Kom, Isiolo County between Borana and Samburu militias. The clash was spurred over drought.
On 19/03 in Mukutani, four police officers were wounded when suspected Pokot herdsmen fired on their vehicle as they escorted members of the Ilchamus community to safety.
The KDF engaged Al Shabaab fighters at Kolbio.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: Pokot fighters attacked a Red Cross convoy that was evacuating children injured in the attack on Mukutani the previous evening. 4 police officers were injured.

In a continuance of ethnic violence, two Pokot woman are killed by suspected Tugen-Ilchamus raiders, after an attack on a police vehicle. It is not clear if the Pokot women were affiliated with the police, or if the police were simply caught in crossfire. In retaliation, Pokot militias soon after attacked Mukutan market, killing five women and four children and looting shops and homes. Other were reported injured.

Two are dead in a clash between Tugen-Ilchamus and Pokot group after the former attempted a raid to steal cattle in Baringo County. The clash lead to further ethnic violence in the following days. Exact location in Baringo was not reported by the source, though it stands to reason the violence occurred in Mukutani ward, as subsequent attacks occurred in Mukutan.

Auliyan militia attacked Duse centre in Isiolo County in a retaliatory attack following their expulsion for the area by government forces weeks prior. Five killed, six injured. Two of the attackers were shot and killed by police.
Al-Shabaab fighters have attacked a Kenyan military convoy at Lamu. Al Shabaab claimed killing four. Kenya acknowledged the attack, but said only one was killed.
On 04/03, a police helicopter was shot at by Pokot or Samburu raidersas security officers carried out aerial surveillance.

Eight are dead in clashes between Tugen-Ilchamus and Pokot clans during the weeks of 26/02-12/03, exact dates, location and other details not known. Accounting for the activity between the clans in the present week, the fatality total stands at 21.
Security forces kill a suspected al Shabaab member in Kwale and recover weapons.
Three are killed in clashes over land in the Athi River area. Following, police made 92 arrests.
A fight between a Pokot and Marakwet near Kerio River led to the death of one.
A police officer was hacked to death at Mangala in Makueni County by a group of sand harvesters over the right to land.
At least 12 houses were torched in Pimbinyiet, Trans Mara West after clashes between two communities lasted over two days.
At least 12 houses were torched in Pimbinyiet, Trans Mara West after clashes between two communities lasted over two days.
Armed herders trespassing on illegal land shoot and injure a police officer after they were confronted near Rumuruti.

100+ gunmen believed to be al-Shabaab attacked a police post and destroyed communication masts in Arabia area, Mandera County. At least one bystander died in the attack. Number of other casualties not known, as al Shabaab had destroyed communication masts in the area. Shabelle Media Network reports an 'unknown number of police officers were killed.'
A Kenya Police Reservist (KPR) was killed after suspected Al-Shabaab perpetrators hurled explosives at a bank and two hotels in Mandera town on the morning of 23/01.
Three are killed in a land dispute in Kanyakwar. The following day a group protest at the office of the 'assistant chief', claiming he 'had a hand in the dispute.'
On 16 January 2017, Kowow clan and residents of Maron sub-location clashed. Several houses were torched in Marakwet East after the body of a 62 year old woman was found.

A bystander student was killed on Sunday as renewed clashes between the Kipsigis and Maasai communities escalated at Pimbinyiet on the Trans Mara West-Trans Mara East border in Narok County. A similar clash took place at the location on 04/01.
One is dead following clashes between Kipsigis and Maasai militias at Pimbinyiet on the Trans Mara West-Trans Mara East border in Narok County.
On 26 December 2016, 20 people were injured as residents from Matundura and Gituro villages (Naivasha and Kinangop constituencies) clashed over a boundary dispute.
On 24 December 2016, one person was shot and injured when suspected Pokot militia raided Chemwoyo and Murkutwo. Marakwet herders retaliated leading to an hour of heavy gunfire.

One attacker died and three police officers were wounded Friday after a group of men armed with machetes and bows assaulted a coastal police post to steal guns, an official said. No group has claimed responsibility, but initial suspicion has fallen on a secessionist group called the Mombasa Republican Council that wants the coastal region to secede from Kenya, claiming marginalization.

Three people were on 21/12 are killed in Esoit, Trans Mara West (outside Kilgoris) in Narok County as fighting between the Kipsigis and Maasai communities. The fighting was an escalation of tit-for-tat attacks the previous day.

On 20 December 2016, interclan skirmishes were reported in the Kerio Valley. This is a continuation from the previous day. 25 houses were burned and two people were killed in total in the attacks. Fatalities coded on 19 December.
Military forces kill four members of al Shabaab in Hulugho during the mid-morning of 15/12.

Suspected Al-Shabaab have attacked Dabacity in Elwak, Mandera County and destroyed a Safaricom telecommunication mast. County Commissioner Fredrick Shisia said the attack occurred at about 1.45am on 12/12.The attackers overpowered five security operatives guarding the mast, causing them to flee.
A military patrol encounters and kill four suspected members of al Shabaab in the Hulugho area on 09/12.

On 27 November 2016, a woman was killed and a 12-year old girl injured in a shootout near Lomelo between armed pastoralists. The Rift Valley coordinator dismissed reports that 14 people were shot dead.

Unidentified gunmen open fire on a group of students sitting for examination in Wajir. The gunmen later exchanged fire with police with were guarding the institution. Motive not known. No reported deaths.
A clash between Jimo and Agoro clans lasts over two days. One death reported the first day, two the second.
Four Al-Shabaab members were killed in El-Wak, Mandera County after a combined team of security officers thwarted a planned terror attack against specific high value targets including police camps.
A clash between Jimo and Agoro clans lasts over two days. One death reported the first day, two the second.
Six people died and two others were injured in fighting between Jibril and Matan clans in Wajir county [in northeast Kenya] on Saturday.
One person has died while eight others have been injured in morning clashes between the Kisii and Kipsigis groups at Olmelil along the Narok-Kisii border.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: A man was shot and killed by Kenyan police outside the US embassy in the capital Nairobi on Thursday after stabbing a GSU officer with a knife. IS later claimed responsibility.
A night guard was on Monday night killed by a stray bullet during a shootout between police and suspected al Shabaab gunmen in Mandera. One death reported.
Police kill an al Shabaab recruiter during a shootout.
Al Shabaab, numbering 50, attacks a police station in Liboi. One of the assailants was killed and several seriously injured during a gunbattle.
Al Shabaab attacks a police station in Hamey, near Garissa. The insurgents killed six officers and captured two others.
Ethnic clash over rights of a watering hole near Molot. Several houses were burnt in the melee.

A group of three women (later learned to had pledged allegiance to Islamic State) attack a police station in Mombasa. The three entered the police station on 11/09 under the guise to report a stolen phone. One drew a knife, the second threw an explosive and the third attempted to detonate a dud suicide pack. The officers responded and killed the three. Two police injured. A fourth suspect was arrested in the following days.

At least four more people have been killed in raging armed conflict between Borana and Somali herders (Auliyan) along the Isiolo-Garissa border [northeastern Kenya]. The fighting took place in Tana village about 11km north of Garba-Tula town on Saturday [10 September].
One is dead following a fight between two rival communities Kuri, Isiolo County on 14/08.

Police have gunned down a al Shabaab terror suspect and recovered two hand grenades in Vingirika (Diani) village, Kwale County. The suspect Mohamed Bakari was shot dead by Anti-terrorism detectives after he hauled a hand grenade at the officers.
Police kill two al Shabaab suspects during a gunbattle in the Kisauni area of Mombasa.
Four police officers were injured during an attack by suspected Al-Shabaab militants who tried to force their way into the Basuba General Service Unit (GSU) camp in Lamu East on Saturday evening.

A Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) convoy was ambushed after their vehicle overran an explosive in Fino Town, Mandera County. Between 6 and 10 causalities. Elsewhere in Fino on the same date Al Shabaab destroys a communication mast in Fino and engage police in a gunfight. Four injuries.
Police raid a al Shabaab hideout, kill two suspects.
An al-Shabaab suspect was killed in Kenyas coastal town of Lamu in a foiled dawn attack at a local police station. One officer was injured.

A suspected [al Shabaab] held at a police station in western Kenya grabbed a gun and shot at police officers, killing between six, leading to a hostage situation. Despite initial reports, the police force later revealed the shooter was likely a disgruntled police officer.
Police officers, on their way to Lamu, escaped death by a whisker after al Shabaab militia men attempted to attack their vehicle which was heading to Mokowe in Lamu County on Sunday.

More than 100 Al Shabaab raided Diff Police station in Wajir on early Saturday morning, stealing firearms and bullets. They left one police officer wounded, and are believed to have escaped with serious injuries during an exchange of fire with officers during the 1 am incident. Al Shabaab gained control of the town after several hours of fighting. The Somali Memo reports causalities without number.
Suspected [al Shabaab] was on Wednesday morning shot dead by police in Kibundani, Msambweni Sub County.
Police shoot and kill a al Shabaab suspect in Kwale town.
Al Shabaab claims it has killed 6 KDF soldiers in an ambush attack on a base of Kenyan troops in Lamu Island near Somalia border. KDF denies either the attack took place or the causality figure.
Kenyan forces kill four members of al Shabaab in Milimani and recover weapons.
Five Kenyan policemen escorting a passenger bus have been killed after al-Shabaab fighters ambushed their convoy in El Wak on 20/06. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.
Anti-terrorism police on 20/06 thwarted an attack and killed a wanted al-Shabaab fighter in the coastal town of Kwale.
Two are dead in or near Kopere trading centre over a land control issue. Violence related to the land continued in the general area midweek.
Four people were shot and killed while one person is missing as renewed inter-clan fighting erupted at Kachamcham farm, Kerio Valley in Elgeyo-Marakwet County.
Al Shabaab fighters attack a police station in Dif on 10/04, injuring three officers before escaping in the police vehicle.
Kikuyu and Luo ethnic communities clash in Kariobangi suburb over voter registration. One death reported.
Militias from Maasai and Kalenjin clash over land at Kosovo in Naivasha (Mathare). Six houses destroyed, 1 killed and 1 injured.
Security forces kill four members of al Shabaab and recover weapons in Boni Forest on 02/02.

Three people were killed while another one was seriously injured after morans from two communities clashed over land in Leparua on the Isiolo-Laikipia border. The identity of the actors are not known.
The Anti-Terrorism Police Unit on [20 January] morning killed four al Shabaab after a shootout in Kwachocha, Malindi.

Suspected al Shabaab ambushed a police convoy in Lamu on the afternoon of 01/01, injuring security officials and setting a police truck on fire. There was a fierce gun battle at the scene preceded by an explosion. Shortly after the attack police forces in the area launched a large security operation.
Two police are attacked on 27/12 along the Lafey-Elwak road, Mandera county. Two others reported dead as well. No immediate claim of responsibility, though al Shabaab are suspected.
Three are killed in renewed clashes between Kalenjin and Maasais groups in the Olposimoru area of Narok on 27/12.
Four are injured in continued clashes between Kalenjin and Maasais groups on 26/12 in the Olposimoru area of Narok.

Many houses are destroyed, causing 2,000 residents to flee following renewed violence between Kalenjins and Maasais groups in the Olposimoru area of Narok on 25/12. Causalities, injuries from the clash are not known.
Four police officers are feared dead following an al Shabaab attack on Bodhei, Lamu County on 25/12.
Two headers are killed in violence between Kalenjin and Maasais in Maasai Mau Narok forest, Narok South Sub-County on 23/12.
One dead and several injured following a border attack between two villages in Kisumu county on 22/12.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills three police officers outside Mandera on 21/12. The attack may have been coordinated or related to an attack on bus travellers in the area.
Two are killed during a gun battle between al Shabaab and security forces in Milihoi.
Suspected al Shabaab ambush a group of soldiers in (or near) Mandera on 13/12, killing one and wounding two others.
Al Shabaab attacks Kenyan forces in Lamu on 06/12, seven soldiers killed, ten wounded.
Al Shabaab lays siege to on Wajir on 27/11, but are quickly repelled by government soldiers. No reported death or injuries.
Ethiopian-OLF forces and Kenyan police clash in Sololo on 19/11, three police dead. The clash began following an OLF invasion in the area.

A member of al Shabaab escape police, takes the officers weapon and fires several shots. Hundreds of officers cordoned off the area and engaged the suspect in a shootout until he ran out of bullets and was arrested. The suspect was injured.
One dead, eleven injured and property destroyed in a clash over sand harvesting in Kasikeu.

On 12 October 2015 at 10:30, an INGO vehicle travelling without escort was stopped by a group of five armed men who had fired shots in their direction. The men kidnapped a non-local female Kenyan from the vehicle and fled after coming under fire by police.

A young boy is killed during clashes over land between Kapkeny and Kabasirian clans in Kerio Valley. Later reported suggest the battle caused the destructions of many homes and displaced hundreds. Fighting also spilled over into Shaban and Kachesoom areas.

Nine are dead and six are injured in a fight between pastoralists and farmers in Tana River. Additionally, several houses were destroyed. The clashes between Wardei pastoralists and Mijikenda farmers occurred in Wachu Oda in Garsen. A reported 1,500 people displaced as a result of the clashes.
KDF soldiers killed three al Shabaab when they repulsed an attack at Basuba, Lamu county, on Wednesday (29/07) morning. Three members of the military forces were injured.
Another person dies in a clan war over land on 12/07.
One person dies in a clash between the Kabasiran and Kapkeny clans in Elgeyo Marakwet.
Al Shabaab attacks a police convoy, including a civilian bus travelling in Mkunumbi, no reported causalities.

Al Shabaab attacks several locations of Lamu Island and were able to briefly overtake the area known as 'Mangai,' an area they found with little resistance. Other places attacked included a school and a military camp. Military forces eventually repelled the attackers. 'Several' casualties reported, eleven of which were recorded as al Shabaab. Later reports suggest a British-born member of al Shabaab (known as Thomas Evans or Abdul Akim) may have been a leader in the attack and is among the dead. Another suspect of the attack was apprehended on 20/06.

At least 10 pastoralists from Isiolo have been killed in clashes with Laikipia residents after the herders invade the area with hundreds of animals. The herders also shot two security personnel after they were ordered to vacate the land during the clashes.
At least three people were killed and several others injured on the morning of 06/06 in inter-community clashes at Lowangila in Isiolo County. The clash may be related to rights to cattle or land.
Al Shabaab attacks a police post Yumbis on the night of 25/05, killing 20. Al Shabaab had also attacked the area the previous week.
Al Shabaab gunmen attack Yumbis and Wel Marer villages in Fafi, each about 80 Km north east of Garissa. Security forces pushed back the attackers, no reported causalities.
Al Shabaab gunmen attack Yumbis and Wel Marer villages in Fafi, each about 80 Km north east of Garissa. Security forces pushed back the attackers, no reported causalities.
Two suspected Al-Shabab gunmen and a police officer killed in shoot out at Dadaab Hamey Patrol Base in Garissa.

Turkana raiders attack a Pokot village close to Nadome along the Turkana-East Pokot district border, killing 18 residents. Following the attack a Pokot militia assembled, chasing the attackers to nearby Kogh-Tuw village and killing 36.
Kenyan police on 11/04 shot dead two al Shabaab suspects in an incident that left one police officer injured in Kwale.

Al Shabaab gunmen attack Garissa University during the morning hours in an operation that lasted the majority of the day. Four attackers were killed during the siege, and the police are holding another five individuals for questioning.
A senior Mombasa police detective is gunned down in an apparent well organized assassination. The perpetrator is not unknown, though the source cites al Shabaab presence in the area.

Three pirates have been shot dead in Migingo Island by Ugandan security forces. The pirates, believed to be Tanzanian nationals, were accosted inside the lake while robbing fishermen. Three other pirates were arrested. Kenya and Uganda have both staked claim to the fish-rich island - a row that has lasted since 2002.
Two unidentified sub tribes clash over land at Kathanje (Kathangei), Chuka Igambangombe constituency. One death, plus other injuries reported.
Tugan and Pokot militias exchange fire over grazing land and cattle ownership at Kapndasum in Marigat. An unarmed bystander was killed in the shootout, several others missing.
Three men are killed when Kikuyu and Maasai groups clashed over a farms ownership.
The Kenya Defence Forces killed eight al Shabaab and injured several others during an encounter with the insurgents in Basuba, Lamu county. A KDF soldier died while three others were injured.

An unidentified attacker targeted a crowded Mombasa church, but are repulsed by police guarding the door. Police engaged the assailant in a shootout before he escaped. The reason for the attack is not known. One church official was reported dead following the incident.
Pokot gunmen killed a school guard during the late morning hours. Motive unknown.

One police reservist has been killed and another injured in Wajir. The report says weapons belonging to the two policemen were taken away by the unnamed attackers. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility several days following the incident.
A hotel security guard is shot and killed and his colleague injured after ten gunmen dressed in police uniform attacked the two in Diani. Perpetrators not identified.
At least ten people are killed following two days of ethnic clashes in Kinango, Kwale County. Both communities claimed grazing rights on a ranch.
At least ten people are killed following two days of ethnic clashes in Kinango, Kwale County. Both communities claimed grazing rights on a ranch.
One man was seriously injured and property worth thousands of shillings destroyed after members of the Kikuyu and Maasai communities clashed over a parcel of land near Eburu Forest.
Two people were injured as herders from the Tugen community battled suspected Pokot bandits. The battle broke out at Chemoe, near the Baringo North and Tiaty subcounty border.

Gunmen attack and killed a police officer and wound two others in Kilifi during the overnight hours. There was no immediate claim of responsibility, but previous attacks have been blamed on Islamist groups accused of links to Somalias Al-Qaeda-affiliated Shebab rebels, or to a separatist movement called the Mombasa Republican Council (MRC).
A Kenyan police officer was shot dead and another seriously wounded in an attack by suspected al Shabaab at Dadaab Refugee Camp.
At least five people were killed and four others reported missing following clashes in Dukana, Marsabit County or rights to cattle and property.

At least eight people were killed and four others seriously injured in inter- communal clashes in northern Kenyas Isiolo County. The clash reportedly lasted for several hours. The clash occurred at Leruko on Isiolo side, a few meters from the bridge that connects Isiolos Buffalo Springs game reserve with Samburu Park.
A tribal clash over land causes the death of one and several houses destroyed. The clash occurred in Kuvasali village, Kakamega County.

A security operation against a group of Pokot militia yields the recovery of weapons and the deaths of six bandits, who had been launching attacks in the area recently. An MP said banditry attacks were instigated by people who want Kapedo to be annexed to Baringo.
Six al Shabaab suspects were shot dead and a soldier seriously injured in an attempted invasion of the KDF Nyali Barracks in Mombasa early in the day.

At least 24 police officers and Kenya Police Reservists (KPR) are feared dead, 17 injured, in a fresh attack in Kapedo in Tiaty Sub-county Baringo County after Pokot raiders attacked the at Lomelo and Kapau areas of the city.

source: Sudan Tribune; Anadolu Agency; VOA; Hiiraan (Somalia)
notes: On 1 November 2014, clashes between Dinka and Nuer refugees (armed with hand weapons) took place once again at Kakuma Refugee Camp (Turkana West, Turkana), after a Nuer child was hit by a motorbike driven by a Congolese national (which elements of the Nuer community claimed was an attack masterminded by Dinka refugees). At least eight people were killed in two days of clashes (fatalities distributed evenly across two events), with some reports stating that 20 people died. Conflicting reports suggest that some of those caught up in the violence may have been Burundian and Congolese nationals, with one unconfirmed report claiming that ethnic Turkana were also attacked during the events.

Seven police members are dead and 17 missing following an attack on their post by local tribesmen. Attackers targeted three police vehicles and burned one of them. The motive for the attack is not known. A similar attack occurred in the area the previous week.

source: Anadolu Agency; Hiiraan (Somalia); Sudan Tribune; VOA
notes: On 31 October 2014, clashes between Dinka and Nuer refugees (armed with hand weapons) took place once again at Kakuma Refugee Camp (Turkana West, Turkana), after a Nuer child was hit by a motorbike driven by a Congolese national (which elements of the Nuer community claimed was an attack masterminded by Dinka refugees). At least eight people were killed in two days of clashes (fatalities distributed evenly across two events), with some reports stating that 20 people died. Conflicting reports suggest that some of those caught up in the violence may have been Burundian and Congolese nationals, with one unconfirmed report claiming that ethnic Turkana were also attacked during the events.

On 30 October 2014, clashes between Nuer and Dinka refugees (armed with hand weapons) took place at Kakuma Refugee Camp (Turkana West, Turkana), following the alleged rape of a female Nuer child by a Dinka man. At least one person was killed, and at least eight were wounded.
Suspected local tribesmen attack a police post in Kapedo. Five dead, including three police officers.

KDF forces kill five suspected al Shabaab fighters who were attempting to drive an explosive laden car into Kenya from Ethiopia. Mandera is situated at a point where a border is shared by both Ethiopia and Somalia.
Unknown gunmen killed a police officer near the border with Somalia before escaping.

A police officer is killed by two suspected al Shabaab outside the Royal Court Hotel on Haile Selassie Road, Mombasa. Sources said the killing may be a revenge mission after police recently killed a man they said was a wanted suspect with links to Al-Shabaab.
Rival Maasai groups clash over land ownership at a farm in Nakuru. One death, one injury reported.

Anti-terrorism police forces gun down a suspected and wanted al Shabaab member during an early morning raid on their hideout. It is believed the target of the operation was responsible for the killing of a German tourist.

One civilian is killed and two police officers injured in an attack on a lorry carrying supplies for a food programme. The attackers are unknown, but are believed to be related to an ongoing clash between the Degodia and Garre clans.

Four al Shabaab-linked gunmen shoot and kill a senior police officer in the Tudor area of Mombasa. Some accounts claim the attack occurred in Old Town, which is a short distance south. Apparently two of the gunmen were foreign, German and Russian.
A clash between Garre and Degodia clans continue into a second day. Two additional combatants killed. The Garre may have been from Ethiopia, who came later to reinforce the Kenyan Garre.
Twenty dead (range as high as 30) and 300 displaced as a result of a seven-hour ethnically driven gun battle in Rhamu. Police have made at least one arrest and recovered various light arms.
Samburu and Borana herders clash over a water source. Four killed, two each side.

Suspected al Shabaab attack a police post in Bothai around the midnight hour between Monday and Tuesday. The ensuing gun battle lasted five hours, eventually causing the police forces to abandon their post. After the police fled the gunmen ransacked the village, stealing drugs. Deaths reported, though no hard numbers were provided.

Two police officers were injured during the evening hours injured after al Shabaab gunmen attacked a police station in Mandera. The gang of about 100 is said to have attacked at the Fino Police station in the night using rifles.
Police shoot two al Shabaab suspects who were attempting to place bombs on a ship docked at the cities port.
Police shoot two suspected al Shabaab members dead as they foil a planned attack on the city.
Unidentified gunmen attack a Mombasa-bound bus outside of Witu, kill seven, including police officers. The following morning al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

A group of 30 to 50 armed men, believed to be attached to the recent attacks in Hindi, attack Gamba police station (Ndeu area) during the evening hours. The attackers overpowered the security officers the torched the station. One officer reported dead, two others injured. Shabelle Media Network reports nine officers dead.
At least 12 people were killed when attackers managed to get a suspected ringleader of Mpeketoni attacks out of a police station in Kenyas Tana Delta County.

Two unidentified gunmen shoot and killed a police officer in the Kisauni area. The reason for the attack is not known, though the source implies the attackers may have some connection to the killing of Muslim clerics recently.

Six suspected militants have been killed at the Timau police road block during a shoot out with police during the morning hours. Buuri OCPD said the six are suspected to be militants although the County Commander says the six were poachers.
At least 20 (some reports 30) have been killed in ethnic clashes in Tarbaj involving the Degodia and Garre clans. The fighting stemmed from a boundary dispute. The clash may have occurred on 21/06.

Five suspects linked to the two Mpeketoni attacks have been shot dead in Bochai area in Mpeketoni, Lamu county by security personnel. The ministry say three AK 47 guns and several bullets were recovered in Bochai after the incident.

At least 10 more people were killed during the night-time hours in a second attack in Mpeketoni, Porokomo, Lamu County area by al Shabaab. Police said gunmen raided Poromoko village and set several houses ablaze. Al Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack claiming they had killed 20 police and wildlife wardens. Other sources claim 15 deaths.

Two men, suspected to be Somali al Shabaab, attack a group of police and military personnel, and are shot. Following the attack residents protest the killings, asserting that at least one of the attackers were known Sheikh in the region.

Suspected al-Shabaab militants killed two Kenya Defense Forces (KDF) soldiers and injured another at the common frontier with Somalia, police have said. The divisional police commander, who confirmed the incident, said the officers were attacked by the insurgents who emerged from the bonny forest along Lamu-Malindi road on a Pick-Up vehicle.
Somalia based al Shabaab fighters attack a truck carry khat in the Mandera region which sparked a clash between they and security reservists. Twelve reportedly KIA.
Three men are killed in clashes suspected to be between the Degodia and Gare clans over a boundary dispute in Wajir County.

Three guards were hacked to death and two others wounded in unclear circumstances over a disputed piece of land in Ngara area. The victims were killed early in the day by unknown assailants who raided their makeshift homes. The land has been in contention between the Jamia mosque and a group of mechanics.
Unidentified assailants attack and killed a police officer in his home. The reason for the attack is not known and investigators discovered nothing missing from the residence.
A group of 30 members of suspected al Shabaab attack a power station. Police respond, killing two, arresting one and recovering weapons.
Unidentified attackers raid a police camp, making off with weapons. No reported injuries or causalities.

The funeral of a politicians wife is disrupted by clashes of opposing political parties, namely supporters of after Governor Okoth Obado and Siaya Senator James Orengo of the PDM and ODM. Injuries not known.
Police in Diani Town of Kwale County [southern Kenya] on [25 April] morning gunned down an Al-Shabab terror suspect they believe has been behind a spate of criminal activities.
Five are hurt during a ethnically driven clash over rights to a pasture.

An unknown number of assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Wajir in the early hours of the day, hurling grenades and firing their weapons, with no casualties reported. The attackers also stone a number of weapons from the post.
Police forces shot and kill two al Shabaab suspects believed to be in connection with an attack on a church on 23/03.

'One UN staff member was shot in the leg by five armed robbers who broke into his personal residence and stole valuables; he was hospitalized and is in stable condition. The robbers also killed one security guard.'
Warring between the Auliyan and Abdiwak clans causes the destruction of homes and the displacement of many in Qabobey, Garissa county. No causalities reported.

An unknown number of armed men carried out an armed attack against the Central AP camp in Mandera in the night of 13-14/03. Employing multiple vectors, they first lobbed two hand grenades into the camp and subsequently fired against the police for a few minutes before departing the scene. One Police reservist was killed and another wounded in the aftermath of the attack. The KPRs were reportedly having a small break after long hours of patrolling around that area. The perpetrators reportedly crossed over to the Somali side of the border after the attack.

Five persons has been killed and several houses burned in a row pitying residents over a controversial piece of land at Urumwe Mukaro settlement scheme in Marmanet, Nyahururu. Several other people sustained injuries after residents clashed over the course of three days. It is not clear if the combatants were divided along ethnic lines.

Five persons has been killed and several houses burned in a row pitying residents over a controversial piece of land at Urumwe Mukaro settlement scheme in Marmanet, Nyahururu. Several other people sustained injuries after residents clashed over the course of three days. It is not clear if the combatants were divided along ethnic lines.

Five persons has been killed and several houses burned in a row pitying residents over a controversial piece of land at Urumwe Mukaro settlement scheme in Marmanet, Nyahururu. Several other people sustained injuries after residents clashed over the course of three days. It is not clear if the combatants were divided along ethnic lines. Of the dead, two were killed on 07/03 and three on 08/03.
Two al Shabaab members are killed by police during a raid in the Dadaab refugee complex.

A group of farmers clashed with pastoralists over grazing land around Lake Naivasha. The farmers who claim to be members of the Mau Mau group accused the herders of driving their animals into the farms. Causalities not known or reported.

Six people were injured during a confrontation between farmers and pastoralists at Mtondoni area in Hongwe ward, Lamu West district. The conflict ensued when pastoralists were accused of driving their animals into the farms and destroying crops. The identities of the two groups is not known.

A Kenya police officer was shot and wounded by suspected al-Shabaab adherent in coastal town of Ukunda in Kwale district. Security officials in Kenyas coastal city of Mombasa said police officer was shot at close range by a gunmen riding in a motorbike before escaping with his gun.

A police officer and two youths are killed in a confrontation at the Masjid Musa Mosque in Mombasa. Police had stormed the mosque to arrest youths who were suspected to have been holding an al Shabaab recruitment meeting. At time of the raid the mosque was donned with al-Shabaab flags. Following the raid a three hour battle ensued, wile the youths, holed up in the Mosque mounted a resistance. Police fired teargas canisters to smoke them out of the mosque and in the process a police officer was killed. Two youths were also shot dead by police and several other people injured. 129 arrests reported, a court later charged all with being members of al Shabaab. Twenty-one were released in the following week.

Nine are feared dead in Moyale as fights between Borana and Gabra-Burji militia. On the morning of 30/01 suspected Gabra-Burji militias attacked Kate village, some 50 kilometres from Moyale town. The Borana group responded with heavy resistance. After about half an hour of intense exchange, the fights moved from the village into the bush. As at 11am fierce exchange was heard towards Funan-nyata about 15 kilometres from Kate.

Ethiopian Merrile militia attack a group of fishermen in the north-west Turkana border district, on Lake Turkana, killing one and injuring several others. The motive for the attack is not clear, though several similar raid had been persistent in the area. Responding to the fishermens distress calls, Kenyan police battled the Merrile, pushing them back into Ethiopia. No causality figures provided from the police battle.

Unidentified militia, believed to be from nearby Ethiopia attack the ethnic Gabra border town of North Horr, killing two police and injuring 'scores' of civilians. It was reported cattle was stolen in the raid.
One is killed and two are others injured in a ethnic clash over the course of two days.
One is killed and two are others injured in a ethnic clash over the course of two days.
A hand grenade is thrown at a police officer in the Diani area. The ordinance did not explode. The perpetrators escaped.

Four people were killed at Odha area, 15 kilometres from Moyale [northeastern Kenya] town following fresh tribal skirmishes in Moyale District between the Boranas and Gabbras. The clash was believed to have been sparked by the use of a water hole. The clash took place during the evening hours. In an effort to maintain order, military reservists were sent to the area in the following days.

A Kenya police reservist was shot dead by unidentified armed raiders in a fresh attack at Turkwel on Pokot-Turkana border. The police officer of the Turkana ethnic group, though it was not clear if ethnicity was the motive for the attack.
Al Shabaab launches an attack on a border town, killing three civilians and five police. Liboi hosts an AMISOM military, often used to supply forces in Somalia.

Two General Service Unit officers (paramilitary wing of the Kenyan Military) were injured when a vehicle they were travelling in was attacked in West Pokot county. The attackers may have been thieves.
Ethnic clashes continue near Moyale on 07/12. 'Dozens' reported dead.
Seventeen are killed in ongoing ethnic clashes over a 36 hour period Butiye village in Moyale town.
Seventeen are killed in ongoing ethnic clashes over a 36 hour period Butiye village in Moyale town.

At least 12 people were killed with many others injured in Marsabit county of northern Kenya following clashes between rival militia groups, Borana and Burji, Gabra. The clash caused 30,000 nearby Moyale residents, fearing for their safety, to flee north into Ethiopia. Clashes were sporadic throughout the week, though no specific date is provided. Some sources have causality totals at 70 or more.

Police forces launch an operation to retake police posts occupied by Pokot militia. The Pokot militiamen responded with 'heavy resistance.' It is not clear if the operation was successful. Causalities not known.

Armed Pokot militiamen attack and hold hostage three police posts in Lorokon village. It is not clear how many police officers are effected by the attack. Causalities not known. The siege is likely related to a border dispute between the Pokots and Turkana communities that has been causing tension in the area.
An unidentified gunmen is killed and a police officer is wounded after the gunmen launched an attack in the Lexington area of Nairobi. The motive for the attack is not known.
A clash between Ganze police and MRC youths leads to a gunshot wound of a bystander civilian.
A police officer is shot twice, in the head and back, by two unknown gunmen on a motorcycle at around 8.30pm at Afisi ya Kanu stage in Mwandoni Ndogo.

Three people were shot dead after youths armed with arrows attacked Ruga police post in Muhoroni Sub County. The three are reported to have been shot dead in an arrow and fire exchange at Nyangore sub-location in Chemelil. The youths are suspected to have come from Nandi community. The youths had vowed to kill a senior police officer, accusing police of contributing to the rampant chaos along the nearby border area.

Political separatists of the Mombasa Republican Council (MRC) attack a police post in Palakumi, Kilifi, injuring one officer. According to Kilifi County AP Commandant Elijah Ngetich, 10 suspected MRC militants, armed with arrows and bows, carried out the midnight raid at Palakumi in Ganze. The motive has not been established although some claim they were out to steal weapons.
Four people have died following inter-Tribal conflict in Waso Rongai Village, Baragoi. The groups involved were not identified.
Renewed ethnic clashes in Moyale Monday (October 14th) injured at least five people and led to parts of the city being shut down.
A group of police who were returning from patrol opened fire on a group of men planting an IED along the side of the road the night of 11/10. The police failed to hit or capture any of the men.

A crowd of squatters believed to be composed of Nandi youths invaded a farm belonging to a former judge and attacked an AP officer who was guarding the premise. The motive for the attack is believed to be concerning the control of land.

The more than 200 cross-border Ugandan-Pokot raiders attacked Apuko village in Pokot North and drove away the animals after a fierce morning battle with Pokot herdsmen and security officers. Causalities not known.

The more than 200 cross-border Ugandan-Pokot raiders attacked Apuko village in Pokot North and drove away the animals after a fierce morning battle with Pokot herdsmen and security officers. Causalities not known.

Police sentries in the main Mandera Police Line reportedly opened fire in the night of 27/09. The reason behind the shooting is unclear. Reports indicate that although police claim to have been fired upon, there is no evidence that an attack took place.

Al Shabaab fighters, reportedly ten in number, attacked the Central Administration Police camp in Mandera in the night of 26/09. The attackers exchanged small arms, hand grenades and RPGs for about 30 minutes after which they withdrew. Three vehicles parked in the compound got burnt in the fighting. Initial casualty reports indicate that two police officers were killed and one seriously wounded. One perpetrator was wounded in the attack. A conflicting report by the Nairobi Star holds three police deaths.

Al Shabaab attackers hurled a hand grenade at a group of police officers patrolling the Army/Airport road near Basabra Supermarket in Wajir on the evening of 25/09. The police opened fire after the blast. A second explosion was heard shortly after the first. The cause of the second explosion is currently unclear. One person was killed and three others were injured. Police arrested an injured man they believed to be one the perpetrators.

Early on the fourth day, a senior police source declared the operation to clear the building was 'over', however journalists outside reported that sporadic gunfire was continuing. The confirmed death toll is 61 civilians, six security officers and five militants (72 total), plus 175 injuries. It is thought that the death toll could rise, as bodies could possibly concealed under the rubble. Authorities have said they have found 'some' of the missing. 61 are still considered missing. Security forces are holding eight suspected al Shabaab militants in connection to the attack. The al Shabaab leader, Sheikh Ahmed Aw Abdi Godane 'Abu Zubeir,' issued an audio message 25/09 on the Westgate attack in Nairobi. In his message the al Shabaab leader praised the perpetrators and explained that the attack was to punish Kenya for invading Somalia and killing vulnerable Muslims in Somalia.

Kenyan forces continue assaults on al Shabaab positions within the Westgate Mall during the morning hours. Security forces claim they have gained control of all levels of the mall. Six additional deaths reported, including 11 injuries. 200 hostages rescued over the course of the sedge.
During battles with Al-Shabaab two Kenyan soldiers are killed and 11 are injured. Three of the injured die the next day from their wounds. Three of the Al Shabaab gunmen are killed during the day.

source: New York Police Department; Star (Kenya); AFP
notes: Kenyan forces battle with Al-Shabaab. Two soldiers are injured in a grenade attack. One gunmen is shot in the leg and does not reappear.

Approximately one hour after the initial attack on the Westgate Mall, Kenyan security forces, including police and military, enter the building and begin engaging al Shabaab in gun battles. Running gun battles continue into the evening.
Troops and GUS personnel exchange fire in Westgate mall due to mistaken identity. 1 GSU officer dies.
Garre and Degodia militia clashed at Meriley water dam in Banissa District in the afternoon of 16/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly. No causalities reported.

Unidentified men riding in a taxi hurled a hand grenade at a police vehicle passing by the Nairobi Hotel in Manderas main market in the evening of 05/09. The group then directed small arms fire at the police, forcing the police to withdraw quickly, before their damaged vehicle broke down along the road to the police station. Three police officers and a civilian (a cashier at the Nairobi Hotel) were injured in the attack. The attackers managed to escape the scene without suffering any casualties.
A group of Ethiopian Dassanach cross the shared border and kill a police reservist along the west bank of the Lake Turkana.
Dassanach raiders enter Kenya near Lake Turkana, kill a police reservist and injure two others at a post at Loarengak.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found. Many residents have fled the area.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.
Kenyan forces stationed in Madera County chase several al Shabaab fighters into Beled Hawo following cross-border gunfire. Causalities not known.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

Twenty Al-Shabab militiamen are killed by the Kenya Defence Forces [KDF] near the border town of Hulugho, Garissa. The militants were crossing the border to Somalia and are believed to be part of a group of nearly 40 militiamen who attacked an Administration Police camp at Galmagala Division last Friday [16 August] evening killing four Administration Police officers.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. Specifically, this days clashes were in the Oda and Hellu area. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

About 20-30 al Shabaab fighters attacked Galmagala police post in Fafi District in the evening of 16/08. The attackers used small arms and RPGs during the attack. Four administration police officers were killed and local teacher was injured in the attack. The attackers also set fire to the police post, destroying its complex of buildings. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack on its Twitter account, claiming to have killed five police officers and seized weapons and communications equipment.
An ethnic clash over land caused one death along the Trans Mara West and Kuria East district border.

Suspected Al Shabaab militia attacked a Kenyan police post, about 80 km from northern town of Mandera along the common border on Friday. About 35 gunmen attack Arabia Administration Police Post at around 22:00, sparking an exchange of fire.
Eight houses were yesterday burnt at Kaburuet village in lwakhakha division, Bungoma county, in clashes between members of two communities.

Two people have been killed and property destroyed at Bar Osimbo village in Siaya in the last week following a land dispute between a family and an assistant chief. The dispute between the family of Bruno Oloo and the area assistant chief Raphael Oduor has led to the destruction of 15 acres of crops and six houses have also been torched
Four police officers were seriously injured following an attack by armed bandits in Liboi, northern Kenya.

Three people were injured when the two groups clashed over grazing land at Mara North Conservancy in Maasai Mara game reserve in Narok South District. The disagreement occurred when one of the groups tried to forceful evict the rival group from the land which met resistance.

Police arrest 29 Ugandan terror suspected who they believed were traveling to Somalia to join Al Shabaab. The arrests occurred in the Kasarani neighborhood of Nairobi.
Gunmen kill three police officers near the Somali border.

Somali Islamist rebels stormed a remote police camp in northeastern Kenya, killing seven people and kidnapping three. The town was four miles from the border and known as Gerille. Among the dead were three police, a civil servant, school teacher and a pregnant woman.
At six people, including three children, were killed in a tribal clash over grazing land and other resources in northeast Kenya near the Ethiopian border.

Clashes continue between the Tugen and Pokot communities in Baringo county. Escalation of hostilities since January has, according to the Kenya Red Cross Society (KRCS), left more than 7,500 Tugen people displaced from their homes, living either with other members of their community or in rudimentary shelters in the bush.
Three suspected members of the Al-Qaeda were shot and killed by security forces. A number of AK-47s were recovered.

On 14 March 2022, a remote controlled IED by Al Shabaab militants, detonated targeting Kenya security forces (KDF) convoy in Girileey village near Dif town (Wajir South, Wajir). Al Shabaab claimed killing 11 soldiers.

On 13 March 2022, an IED by suspected Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting road construction workers along the Banisa-Takaba road in Banissa (Banissa, Mandera). Three workers were injured during the incident.
On 23 February 2022, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a military forces convoy travelling between Kiunga and Mararani, near Kiunga, (Lamu East, Lamu County). The militants claimed killing 13 soldiers.

Around 15 February 2022 (month of), an IED planted by suspected Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting a private vehicle along the Milimani and Baure road, near Baure (Lamu East, Lamu county). One person was injured while six others escaped unhurt.

On 10 February 2022, suspected Al Shabaab militants launched an IED or grenade, targeting a vehicle traveling to Hulugho from Masalani and ferrying six persons, at Dagega area near Sangailu (Hulugho, Garissa county). Four people were killed and two others injured.

On 2 February 2022, presumed Al Shabaab militants launched an IED targeting a vehicle (land cruiser) carrying foodstuffs and plying the Wajir-Gerile road, at Handaki area near Dif (Wajir South, Wajir County). All the four people on board were killed.

On 31 January 2022, an IED from an unidentified armed group (presumed colonial military bases) detonated in Elnur/Tulatula ward, near El Das (Wajir North, Wajir County). Two children and their mother were injured during the incident.

On 31 January 2022, at least seven suspected Al Shabaab militants launched an IED targeting a matatu (public service vehicle) plying the Mandera Arabia road at Hargasu near Mandera town (Mandera East, Mandera County). Seven people were killed and 13 injured.

On 7 January 2022, Al Shabab militants launched an IED or grenade attack at a police vehicle in Milihoi (Lamu West, Lamu county). Four police officers were killed and an unknown number injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
On 1 January 2022, a boda boda taxi rider was killed after his motorcycle ran over an IED, set by suspected Al Shabaab militants, on the road in Kiunga (Lamu East, Lamu county).
On 7 December 2021, a suspected Al Shabaab suicide bomber detonated himself, killing two civilians and injuring another person in Kamloma village, Katito town (Nyakach, Kisumu).

On 4 December 2021, a remote controlled IED by Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting a Kenyan police convoy travelling from Rhamu to Mandera, near Jabi area 40km to Mandera town (Mandera East, Mandera). Two police officers were killed and 12 others injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

On 1 November 2021, an IED by Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting Kenya military vehicle travelling from Mararani to Kiunga town, near Sankuri town (Lamu East, Lamu). A ranger working with the Aweer Community Conservancy was killed, and a driver and a student were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

On 21 October 2021, unidentified gunmen threw a hand grenade at the home of a human rights activist in Kenanie village (Athi River, Machakos). The house, under construction, was partially damaged. The motive for the attack is unknown. There were no casualties.

Around 18 October 2021 (as reported), an IED by Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting a Kenya defense force convoy traveling in the areas of Kiunga and Sankuri town (Lamu East, Lamu). At least 3 soldiers were killed and more than a dozen injured. Al Shabaab claimed killing 15 soldiers. Forces responded with gunfire after the blast (no indication to where and at whom) and started conducting operations to find the perpetrators of planting the IED.

On 12 October 2021, an IED by Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting the convoy of the Kenya defense forces under Operation Amani Boni travelling between Milimani and Baure town (Lamu East, Lamu). Al Shabaab militants claimed killing 14 soldiers.

On 21 September 2021, a hand grenade by an unknown group detonated, killing two boys who were playing with the device after mistaking it for a football outside a home in Matarba village near Merti town (Merti, Isiolo).

actor2: Military Forces of Kenya (2013-) Kenya Wildlife Service
notes: On 9 June 2021, an IED planted by suspected Al Shabaab militants detonated, targeting Kenya Wildlife Service (KWS) officers along the Mandera-Wardud-Takaba road at Ireskinto village (Mandera West, Mandera). One officer and one civilian were killed.
