On 18 February 2022, suspected Al Shabaab militants abducted three health workers in Fino (Lafey, Mandera county). Later, the militants let two health workers (locals) go before proceeding into Somalia, taking the remaining health worker (allegedly non-local) with.

On 17 February 2022, suspected Pokot armed militia attacked a school bus carrying students from Tot High School, from an academic trip along Arror-Tot road at Chesuman near Tunyo (Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet. The driver was shot dead while six students and three teachers sustained gunshot wounds.

On 15 February 2022, suspected Pokot militia attacked Ng'aratuko village [coded to Ngaratuko, Baringo North, Baringo county], killing one man and stealing 341 animals in a suspected retaliation attack in Loruk (coded separately).

On 12 February 2022, suspected Pokot pastoralist militia ambushed Turkana herders grazing livestock in Kainuk (Turkana South, Turkana County). One herder was shot dead and another one injured during the incident, as the militia made away with over 20 goats

On 5 February 2022, a police officer was engaged in a scuffle with a motorist in Nyali (Nyali , Mombasa county). The motorist strangled the officer to death. The incident allegedly happened following a scuffle after the slain officer stopped the motorist, asking for his driving licence.
On 5 February 2022, suspected Pokot militia shot and killed a motorcycle rider (boda boda) along the Lomelo-Kapedo road, near Kapendo (Tiaty, Baringo county).

On 5 February 2022, suspected Turkana militia staged a retaliatory attack against the Pokot community in Lokeke village near Turkwel River (Pokot North, West Pokot) and made away with more than 100 goats. Casualties unknown.
On 4 February 2022, 12 men, suspected to be police officers, abducted a 43-year-old carpenter, suspected to have links to terrorism, in Mtwapa (Kilifi South, Kilifi County).
On 4 February 2022, presumed Pokot militia attacked Ewaso centre near Mukogodo (Laikipia North, Laikipia), killing one woman.

On 3 February 2022, about 20 suspected Pokot pastoralist militia attacked Karenyang and Ecolodge villages in Kainuk (Turkana South, Turkana). More than 3000 livestock were stolen and several people sustained injuries during the incident.
On 2 February 2022, seven men, with no uniforms, presumed to be police officers (and coded as such) abducted a businessman along muhoho road near Nyayo National Stadium (Langata, Nairobi county).
On 1 February 2022, suspected Pokot militia attacked Sinoni village (Marigat, Baringo county), killing two brothers aged 29 and 26 years.

On 1 February 2022, presumed Toposa militia from South Sudan, attacked members of the Turkana ethnic group in Kapetadie within Nanam ward, coded as Nanam (Turkana West, Turkana county). 4 people were killed and 2 others injured, during the incident.

On 31 January 2022, suspected Pokot pastoralist militia, attacked herders watering animals at Arabal river near Marigat (Marigat, Baringo county). One person was killed; two others injured and close to 40 cattle stolen during the incident
On 28 January 2022, suspected Pokot pastoralist militias shot and killed one man, near Chesoi, lower Sambirir ward (Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet county). The motive of the killing remains unknown.

On 28 January 2022, suspected Pokot pastoralist militias shot and killed two women in Chemwonyo village, within Kaben ward (Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet county). The motive of the killing remains unknown.

On 27 January 2022, suspected pokot pastoralist militias attacked Koibirir and Mogil areas near Chesongoch (Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet County). On person was killed and an unknown number of livestock stolen.
On 26 January 2022, suspected pokot pastoralist militias attacked herders at the Koboilat area near Kapsowar (Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet County). One person was killed during the incident.
On 25 January 2022, South Sudanese refugees in collaboration with unidentified local armed group allegedly attacked Burundi refugees in Kakuma Refugee Camp (Turkana West, Turkana).

On 18 January 2022, suspected Pokot pastoralist militia attacked Kagir village near Ngaratuko (Baringo North, Baringo), and made away with more than 460 goats belonging to 10 families. There were no fatalities.

On 14 January 2022, presumed Pokot militia attacked civilian pastoralists in Lamaiywe in the Mochongoi area (Mogotio, Baringo), killing one man before setting his body and motorbike on fire. Several houses were also torched, forcing many residents to flee the area.
On 11 January 2022, suspected Pokot pastoral militia attacked Kagir village near Ngaratuko (Baringo North, Baringo), and made away with at least 242 goats. There were no fatalities.
On 9 January 2022, suspected Al Shabaab militants kidnapped two former councilors in Khorof Harar (Wajir East, Wajir). The abductees later managed to escape.
On 7 January 2022, suspected Pokot armed militia raided Kesumet village near Bartabwa (Baringo North, Baringo) and killed one person and stole an unknown number of livestock.
On 7 January 2022, suspected Pokot militia raided Murkutwa village near Tot (Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet) and killed one person. An unknown number of livestock was stolen.

Around 5 January 2022 (as reported), presumed Pokot pastoralists attacked villages near Tunyo (Marakwet West, Elgeyo Marakwet). Three people were seriously injured, including 2 students and were taken to the hospital.

On 5 January 2022, suspected Somali ethnic militia staged a retaliatory attack in Mweronkoro village near (Tigania West, Meru) after Meru herders had driven their camels away from their farms. At least 6 people were killed.

Around 4 January 2022, Al Shabaab militants abducted three wine tappers in Kibokoni area, Hindi division (Lamu West, Lamu). One man fled and filed the report at the police station. The bodies of were found later. Evidence suggests they were killed around the same day they were abducted.
On 4 January 2022, suspected Pokot pastoralist militia attacked Yatya (Yatia) village, Saimo (Baringo North, Baringo county), killing a 24-year-old herder.

On 3 January 2022, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a village near Hindi (Lamu West, Lamu County). 1 person was killed, and 3 houses torched during the incident. 4 suspected Al Shabab militants were arrested by the police following the recent attacks in Lamu.
On 3 January 2022, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked Witu area (Widhu Majembeni) (Lamu West, Lamu County). 6 fatalities reported, and several houses were torched during the incident.

Around 1 January 2022 (as reported), police shot and killed a young man (university student) and placed the body in the back of the car near Kayole (Embakasi Central, Nairobi County). The motive of the attack remains unknown.
On 1 January 2022, suspected Marakwet cattle rustlers attacked Cheptulel village (Pokot Central, West Pokot County). Four people were killed. No further details.

On 29 December 2021, 12 men, with no uniform, suspecetd to be police officers (and coded as such) abducted a 21-year-old taxi driver, suspected of having links to terrorism, in Garissa (Garissa, Garissa County).

On 23 December 2021, an unknown group identifying themselves as police officers abducted a trader near Mwala (Mwala, Machakos county). The motive of the abduction might be linked to Wajir clan politics. Other sources mention possible terror links.

On 22 December 2021, an unidentified armed group (presumed from the neighboring pastoral communities) attacked a village near Merti (Merit, Isiolo County). Two people were killed and an unknown number of livestock stolen.
On 17 December 2021, suspected Pokot pastoralists attacked Chemisto area in Embobut ward (Endo, Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet). One student was killed.

On 16 December 2021, suspected ethnic militia attacked a matatu (minibus taxi) along the Isiolo Marasabit highway in Mlima Tatu area (Burat, Isiolo, Isiolo county). Two people were injured from the incident.

On 16 December 2021, suspected Pokot pastoralists attacked Matuiku, Rubere and village Eighteen in Kinamba (Githiga, Laikipia West, Laikipia). Some 106 pupils and 28 parents were displaced and were seeking refuge at Lobere primary school.
On 15 December 2021, suspected Marakwet cattle rustlers raided Cheptulel centre in Chesogon (Pokot Central, West Pokot). Two people were injured while working on their farm, and 14 goats stolen.

On 13 December 2021, a suspected ethnic militia attacked the Chari Ashe area, near Maikona (Maikona, North Horr, Marsabit County). Three people were killed and six others injured. Fatalities split across two events.
On 13 December 2021, a suspected ethnic militia attacked North Horr (North Horr, North Horr, Marsabit County). Three people were killed and six others injured. Fatalities split across two events.
On 11 December 2021, suspected Pokot pastoralists attacked the Ol Moran area (Segera, Laikipia West, Laikipia County). One man was injured during the incident.

On 11 December 2021, one person was shot dead and another injured by suspected Pokot pastoralists along the Mogil-Arror road, near Chesongoch (Endo, Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet County). The injured was taken to the hospital for emergency treatment. No further details.
On 6 December 2021, an unknown group identifying themselves as police officers abducted a 22-year-old man, suspected of links to terrorism, in Garissa (Garissa, Garissa county).

On 27 November 2021, over 60 heavily armed suspected Pokot militia attacked pastoralists at Kapkobil grazing field near Tot town (Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet). Four people were killed and several others injured. Hundreds of livestock were stolen.

On 23 November 2021, over 40 heavily armed suspected Pokot militia attacked pastoralists in Kaptora area near Tot town (Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet). There were no causalities. Over 43 animals were stolen.

On 19 November 2021, plain clothed police officers abducted an Ethiopian businessman from the Tigray ethnic group in Kileleshwa (Dagoretti North, Nairobi). The businessman was stopped by a traffic police officer and later removed by other men in civilian clothes.

On 19 November 2021, armed men, riding motorcycles, attacked a civilian home in Kiwanja Ndege area in Marsabit town (Saku, Marsabit). Three people were injured. The incident is related to inter-ethnic violence happening in the area.
On 19 November 2021, a suspected plain cloth police officer abducted a businessman in Moyale town (Moyale, Marsabit).

On 19 November 2021, police officers arrested a group of women after prayers at the mosque and took them to the police station in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi). The women was forced to strip naked and was then assaulted with stinging nettles and had to undergo invasive body searches and were later released. One women was found dead after being released.

On 16 November 2021, unidentified gunmen ambushed a vehicle en route to Buluk and Dukana, near Gof Choba village (Saku, Marsabit). One person who was working for Safaricom was killed and two others were injured. The attack is believed to have been a retaliation for an earlier incident where members from Borana militia attacked civilians from the Burji clan near Marsabit town on 4 November (coded separately).
On 16 November 2021, unidentified gunmen abducted a loan officer who was out collecting loan repayment money from traders in Macalder (Nyatike, Migori).

On 8 November 2021, members from Borana militia shot and killed a civilian from the Gabra ethnic group who was a former spy at Kiwanja Ndege in Marsabit town (Saku, Marsabit). This was due to retaliation for previous killings. Violence escalated between the Burji, Gabra and Borana communities.

On 4 November 2021, members from Borana militia attacked civilians from the Burji clan travelling in a lorry along Marsabit -Badasa, near Marsabit town (Saku, Marsabit). Six people were killed and 11 others injured. The motive of the attack is unknown/not reported.

On 28 October 2021, unidentified gunmen abducted the former Westlands Member of Parliament's sister-in-law and her driver in Muthaiga area in Westlands (Westlands, Nairobi). The victims were ambushed outside the house of the former Westlands member of parliament. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 28 October 2021, police officers, in civilian clothes, abducted three people, including a lawyer, his client who was released after spending 10 years in prison on terror-related charges and for being part of the Al Shabaab, and the former prisoner's cousin in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi). The lawyer was later released on 8 November 2021.

Around 27 October 2021 (as reported), Toposa militants from South Sudan attacked Turkana pastoralists at Kaamuny Napas in Mogila (Turkana West, Turkana county). One herder was killed and two others injured as the attackers made away with unknown number of cattle.

On 15 October 2021, an unidentified armed group shot and killed an agricultural extension officer along Tot-Chesongoch road in Kapkobil village (Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet). The motive for the killing is unknown.

On 15 October 2021, an unidentified armed group shot and killed three people, a woman and her two children, harvesting their millet farm in Kaben village (Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet). The motive for the killing is unknown.
On 14 October 2021, about seven suspected police officers abducted a young man coming from a mosque in Majengo village (Mvita, Mombasa).
On 10 October 2021, suspected Pokot militia shot and killed three people and injured another while fishing at a dam in Mbogoini near Laikipia (Laikipia West, Laikipia). The group also stole 32 cows.
On 5 October 2021, seven armed Samburu ethnic militia shot and killed a father and his son near market in Poro village (Samburu Central, Samburu) and stole an unknown number of goats.
On 2 October 2021, unidentified gunmen shot and killed an old man who was a watchman at a building in Wajir town (Wajir East, Wajir). The motive of the killing is believed to be clan revenge.

On 29 September 2021, unidentified militia attacked a gold mining site in Isulu village, Bushiangala (Ikolomani, Kakamega county), killing a Tanzanian miner and injuring five other local miners. It is alleged that outsiders had dominated gold mining activities in the area at the expense of residents.

On 28 September 2021, three police officers from the Big Tree police assaulted two men in Kiminini town (Kiminini, Trans Nzoia). One of the men succumbed to his injuries. The three officers were arrested.

On 27 September 2021, police officers from the Kapcherop police station shot and injured a former member of county assembly (MCA) after he refused to wear a face mask as per the coronavirus regulations at the Kapsigilai center in Cherangani town (Cherangany, Trans Nzoia).
On 26 September 2021, unidentified gunmen shot and killed two people in Arapal village (Laisamis, Marsabit)

On 24 September 2021, police officers shot and killed a boda boda driver for riding on the wrong side of Kirinyaga road in Nairobi city (Starehe, Nairobi). The police officer stopped the driver and demanded a bribe before shooting the driver.
On 23 September 2021, suspected Pokot militia killed two pastoralists and raided several villages stealing over a thousand heads of cattle from pastoralists near Lamaiywet village (Soy, Uasin Gishu).
On 23 September 2021, suspected Pokot militia shot and killed a civilian pastoralist in Ol-moran village (Laikipia West, Laikipia). The group stole 30 cattle.
On 23 September 2021, suspected Samburu pastoralists attacked pastoralists from the Borana group near Arapal village (Laisamis, Marsabit). Two people were killed.

On 21 September 2021, members from Borana ethnic militia shot and killed an ethnic Gabra businessman at his shop in Marsabit town (Saku, Marsabit). The motive was due to retaliatory attack and clan revenge.

On 20 September 2021, suspected Gabra ethnic militia shot and killed the Borana Peace Committee chairperson in Kituruni village (Saku, Marsabit). The motive was due to retaliatory attack and clan revenges.

On 20 September 2021, suspected Gabra ethnic militia shot and killed a boda boda rider from the Borana ethnic group at the Gabra scheme in Jaldesa town (North Horr, Marsabit). The motive was due to retaliatory attack and clan revenges.

On 15 September 2021, unidentified gunmen abducted a civilian from his home at the Kombedu area in Kogony town (Kisumu West, Kisumu). The victim was handling a sensitive matter concerning a grabbed market land within the area.

On 13 September 2021, suspected police officers abducted a man who was a sergeant police officer (assumed off-duty) near Delmonte area in Thika town (Thika Town, Kiambu). The victim was based at Laisamis police station in Marsabit county.

On 7 September 2021, Samburu pastoralist militia attacked civilian pastoralists (presumed from the Borana Ethnic Group) along the Isiolo-Samburu border at the Hare Dida area near Kom village (Merti, Isiolo). One person was killed and five others were injured.

On 29 August 2021, suspected Pokot ethnic militia shot and killed three civilians from the Marakwet ethnic group from Lomut market, who were heading to Sokouto area at the Cheptulel area in Chesogon village (Pokot Central, West Pokot).
On 26 August 2021, suspected Al Shabaab militants abducted Fino chief from his hotel in Lafey town (Mandera). The chief was later released on 2 March 2022

On 23 August 2021, unidentified gunmen abducted a journalist in Kabarnet and dumped him in Lodwar town (Turkana Central, Turkana). He said the three introduced themselves as police officers from the DCI and asked him to accompany them to the police station for investigations into an unknown offence.

On 18 August 2021, suspected police officers from the Anti-Terror Police Unit (ATPU) abducted a man who was returning home from a mosque in Kuze, Old town in Mombasa town (Majengo, Mvita, Mombasa). The victim has an ongoing terrorism-related case at a court in Shanzu, Mombasa, that started in 2018.

On 18 August 2021, police officers on patrol allegedly beat and killed a person for violating the 10pm-4am coronavirus curfew at Tushauriane stage in Kayole village (Kayole South, Embakasi Central, Nairobi).

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
notes: On 5 August 2021, Uganda military (Fisheries Protection Unit) shot and killed a Kenyan fishermen who was based in Lolwe Island, after leaving Sindo Gateway beach for a fishing expedition near Ringiti Island in Sindo town (Kaksingiri West, Suba, Homa Bay), within Kenya boundaries.

On 5 August 2021, an unidentified communal militia shot and killed a pastoralist in the Embosos area in Arabal village (Mukutani, Marigat, Baringo). At least 38 cattle were stolen. The pastoralists were in search of pasture and water.

On 5 August 2021, suspected Pokot ethnic militia shot and killed a civilian pastoralist and stole 38 cows in Kasiela town (Mochongoi, Marigat, Baringo). The group also surrounded a security camp in the area. The group drove the animals towards Chepkalacha in Tiaty (Pokot inhabited area).

On 4 August 2021, Al Shabaab militants abducted two miraa drivers along the Wajir-Garissa border, between Kulan village and Liboi town (Dadaab, Garissa). The militants have released the drivers for ransom.
On 31 July 2021, Al Shabaab militants attacked a private vehicle on the outskirts of Fino town (Fino, Lafey, Mandera). Two people were killed, a man and his son.

On 31 July 2021, Al Shabaab militants ambushed three people who were travelling in a vehicle from Fino to Mandera at Komor village (Bulla Mpya, Mandera East, Mandera). One person was killed and two others were injured.

On 30 July 2021, unidentified gunmen shot and killed two civilians, including a police inspector, along the Mombasa-Nairobi highway in Machakos town (Township, Machakos). The officer was in charge of the crime branch at Masii police station.

On 29 July 2021, suspected Pokot militias from Barigo shot and killed a civilian at the Laikipia Nature Conservancy in Wangwachi village in Ol-Moran town (Ol-moran, Laikipia West, Laikipia). The militia invaded eight homes and farms in search of pasture and water.

On 19 July 2021, herders from the Samburu ethnic militia attacked herders from the Borana ethnic group in Yachis village near Gotu town (Cherab, Merti, Isiolo). Two people were killed and 300 goats were stolen.

On 19 July 2021, herders suspectedly from the Degodia ethnic militia attacked herders from the Borana ethnic group in Urura village near Merti town (Cherab, Merti, Isiolo). Two people were killed and unknown number of goats were stolen.
On 18 July 2021, Borana ethnic militia attacked herders from Samburu ethnic group in Marti village (Nachola, Samburu North, Samburu). Two people were killed and over 500 animals stolen.
On 18 July 2021, suspected Pokot ethnic militia shot and killed a civilian from the Marakwet ethnic group when they raided Kabetwa village (Endo, Marakwet East, Elgeyo Marakwet).
On 15 July 2021, Borana ethnic militia rustlers raided Marti village (Nachola, Samburu North, Samburu), stole more than 200 goats and injured a herder.

On 15 July 2021, unidentified gunmen shot and killed a prominent environment activist near her home on the outskirts of Nairobi (Nairobi Central, Starehe, Nairobi). She received multiple death threats following her campaign against the development of wetlands in a national park in Kiambu. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 14 July 2021, Borana ethnic militia attacked civilian pastoralists from the Degodia ethnic group near Hadado town (Hadado, Wajir West, Wajir). Eight people were killed. The motive was a retaliatory attack between the communities.

On 10 July 2021, Marakwet ethnic militia attacked civilian pastoralists from the Pokot ethnic group in Keiyo Valley village (Tambach, Keiyo North, Elgeyo Marakwet). Five people were killed, including a university student, and over 300 animals were stolen in a revenge attack.

On 8 July 2021, an unidentified communal militia shot and killed a teacher from the Samburu ethnic group traveling from Maralal to Forole, near Marsabit town (Marsabit Central, Saku, Marsabit). The motive of the attack is clan revenge.

On 4 July 2021, Pokot ethnic militia attacked civilian pastoralists from Marakwet ethnic group in Keiyo Valley village (Tambach, Keiyo North, Elgeyo Marakwet) in a revenge attack. Five people were killed and hundreds of livestock stolen.

assoc_actor_2: Marakwet Ethnic Group (Kenya); Students (Kenya); Aid Workers (Kenya)
notes: On 3 July 2021, Pokot ethnic militia shot and killed two civilians, including a well-known peace worker and a standard four pupil from the Marakwet ethnic group, in Keiyo Valley village (Tambach, Keiyo North, Elgeyo Marakwet). The attack was reported as a retaliatory attack.
On 1 July 2021, suspected Samburu militia attacked civilian pastoralists in Aremiet (Erimet) (Isiolo, Isiolo county) and killed four people and injured two others.
On 27 June 2021, Kenya police forces shot and killed a student for not wearing a face mask in Marani town (Kitutu Chache North, Kisii).
Around 23 June 2021, a group of people, presumably police officers, in Mandera (Mandera East, Mandera) attacked civilians. One person was killed and five injured.

source: Somali Memo; GardaWorld; Radio Dalsan; Radio Simba; Hiiraan (Somalia); Kenyan Television NTV; Daily Nation (Kenya); BBC News; Shabelle Media Network; The Star (Kenya)
notes: On 21 June 2021, Al Shabaab militants attacked civilians in Jabibar near Rhamu district (Mandera, Mandera) and Falama (coded separately). The assailants were wearing police uniforms. One Al Shabaab militant was killed, ran over by a lorry that was carrying miraa. At least three people were killed and three abducted.

source: BBC News; Shabelle Media Network; The Star (Kenya); Twitter; GardaWorld
notes: On 21 June 2021, Al Shabaab militants attacked civilians who were constructing a road in Falama near Rhamu (Mandera North, Mandera). The driver of a truck and his crew were abducted and the truck was set on fire before insurgents escaped towards the Kenya-Somalia border. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

Around 20 June 2021 (as reported), a group of unidentified armed men in Mwangaza in Isiolo (Isiolo, Isiolo) attacked a cleric and a 14-year-old kid. The cleric was shot on his leg and the boy was shot on the stomach. The group stole 87 goats.

source: BBC News; The Star (Kenya); Citizen (Kenya); Twitter
notes: On 20 June 2021, a group of armed people presumably from Wajir attacked civilians in Mado village in Isiolo (Isiolo, Isiolo). The group burnt down a borehole generator with police confirming that the conflict was due to pasture dispute. At least five people were killed.
On 19 June 2021, a group of residents in Kutus (Kirinyaga South, Kirinyaga) attacked and killed a suspected member of a gang, killing him with axes and machetes.

Around 19 June 2021 (as reported), a man in Nairobi (Starehem, Nairobi) accused a police officer who arrested him of assault, claiming he was badly injured. The man was arrested because he was accused of stealing a food warmer table at a hotel.

On 19 June 2021, armed individuals wearing security officers' uniforms abducted a man in Mkunumbi (Lamu West, Lamu). The man's car was blocked by a GK Landcruiser. The attackers left the man's wife, his son and a hitchhiker in the car. The victim was later released on 9 June 2022

assoc_actor_2: Labour Group (Kenya); Police Forces of Kenya (2013-)
notes: On 6 June 2021, suspected Al Shabaab militants ambushed two buses along the Rhamu to Banisa road, near Kormatto area in between Serman and Olla village (Guticha, Mandera North, Mandera). Three people were killed including two police officers.
On 5 June 2021, Wardei ethnic militia shot and killed a Pokomo pastoralist in Galma village near Garsen town (Garsen West, Tana River). This is related to clan revenge and dispute over land.

Around 4 June 2021 (as reported), two police officers attached to KBC Police Station in Matungulu Sub County in Joska town (Matungulu, Matungulu West, Machakos) tortured and killed a civilian in the police cell. They were later arrested.

On 30 May 2021, Borana Ethnic militia attacked civilian pastoralist settlements is Qubi Ella village near Forole town (Maikona, North Horr, Marsabit). Two people were killed and two others were injured.

On 27 May 2021, a group of Luo ethnic militia from Irate village attacked civilians in Otera village near Kisumu city (Railways, Kisumu Central). One man was killed and two houses set ablaze. The motive of the attack is related revenge between the community.

On 20 May 2021, an unidentified militia, suspected to be from South Sudan, shot and killed a grade four pupil at Kiserian Primary School and his grandfather near Kiserian town (Olkeri, Kajiado North, Kajiado). The militia drove away an unknown number of livestock towards Ramacha Hills.

Around 19 May 2021 (week of), suspected Auliyan ethnic militia abducted and killed a boy grazing goats on the Isiolo-Garissa border in the Duse area near Kinna town (Garbatulla, Isiolo). The raiders took off with more than 200 goats.
On 1 May 2021, Kenya police attacked the Deutsche Welle (DW) East Africa correspondent, while he covered a protest near the Kenya national archives in Nairobi city (Nairobi Central, Starehe).

On 26 April 2021, unidentified gunmen from Ethiopia attacked Turkana herders along the border of Kenya- Ethiopia, killing three Turkana residents at Kibish town in Kalokol district (Turkana, Central, Turkana).
On 21 April 2021, unidentified gunmen shot and killed two people from th Rendilles clan at T-works near the old Midroc camp in the Saku town (Marsabit Central, Marsabit).
On 15 April 2021, unidentified gunmen ambushed Burundian refugees travelling between Kalobeyei camp and Kakuma Refugee Camp (Kakuma, Turkana). One person was killed and others injured.
On 1 April 2021, suspected looters shot and killed a civilian and burned houses in Makutani village (Marigat, Baringo South, Baringo). The group also injured two other people.

On 16 March 2021, police officers based at Naishi police station shot and killed a boda-boda operator in Naishi village (Njoro, Nakuru). The victim was earlier involved in a domestic disagreement with his wife.
On 4 March 2021, unidentified gunmen shot and killed a boda boda driver in Bulawaso village in Isiolo town (Isiolo North, Isiolo). The man was accused of stealing motorcycle spare parts.
On 2 March 2021, a suspected Al Shabaab militants abducted a student from Wajir Bor secondary school at Shallete village in Wajir town (Wajir East, Wajir).

On 21 January 2021, Pokot ethnic militia shot and killed a chief inspector of police and his driver travelling from Kapendo camp on the border of Baringo-Turkana counties near Kapedo town (Tiaty, Baringo).

Around 20 January 2021 (as reported), six bodies with gunshot wounds were found in the banditry-prone area of Arabal in Baringo south after a Pokot ethnic militia attack in Chemolingot town (Tiaty, Baringo). More than 50 cows were stolen in the attack. The attack is believed to be related to clan revenge and land dispute.
On 15 January 2021, a Borana militia killed one person, injured another and stole over 300 heads of cattle at Haro Halakhe Yayo watering point in Saku town (Saku, Marsabit).

On 12 January 2021, suspected Al Shabaab militants ambushed an Almkaram bus that left Mandera heading to Nairobi along Darkut -Mandera road between Kotulo and Tarbaj town (Tarbaj, Wajir). The militants took some food and robbed the conductor of Sh40,000 and warned him not to carry non-locals on their bus. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 11 January 2021, Al Shabaab militants abducted three people travelling in a private vehicle transporting examination materials from Nairobi to Mandera along the Banisa-Takaba road near Takaba town (Mandera West, Mandera).
On 11 January 2021, suspected Al Shabaab militants ambushed a Nairobi-bound bus at Banissa ( Banissa, Mandera county). There were no casualties.

On 11 January 2021, suspected Pokot ethnic militia shot and killed a member of the Turkana clan in Kapedo town (East Turkana). Two others were injured and at least ten houses were also torched during the attack. The motive of the attack was retaliation between the clans.
On 1 January 2021, unidentified gunmen killed four people, including a student, in a suspected retaliatory bandit attack at Urura village near Merti town (Isiolo North, Isiolo).

Around 21 December 2020 (as reported), the decapitated body of a chief who was abducted along with four other people by Al Shabaab militants (previously coded) on 18 January was found along the Chinese cutline between Koton and Khorof Harar town (Wajir East, Wajir).
On 19 December 2020, a police officer enforcing the national coronavirus curfew shot and killed a local phone technician in Kisii town (Nyaribari Chache, Kisii).

On 18 December 2020, Al Shabaab militants abducted a chief and four other people from Gumerey village center near Khorof Harar town (Wajir East, Wajir). The group entered the center and ordered residents to switch off their phones before lecturing them.

On 11 December 2020, a Kenyan police officer shot and killed a university student after he stopped the officers from pouring out his father's alcohol in Namanjalala village near Kiminini town (Kiminini, Trans Nzoia).

On 1 December 2020, unknown gunmen shot and killed a man outside his house at Chepyuk market in Bureti town (Mt. Elgon, Bungoma). The circumstances are unclear. According to reports, it is suspected that the attack could be an indication of a resurgence of the outlawed Sabaot Land Defense Force.

On 29 November 2020, a Borana militia shot and killed a pastoralist from the Auliyan clan in Quri grazing area near Garba Tula town (Isiolo South, Isiolo). The motive of the killing was a land dispute between the clans.
On 27 November 2020, a police officer shot and killed a civilian for not wearing a mask in Malaba town (Teso North, Busia) during a coronavirus-related operation.
On 24 November 2020, Ethiopian federal police abducted nine Kenyans for allegedly providing refuge to Oromo Liberation Front (OLF) militia near Moyale town (Moyale, Marsabit).
On 22 November 2020, Samburu militia shot and killed a bodaboda rider in Nkoriche area near South Horr town (Samburu North, Samburu). The motive of the attack is believed to be clan revenge.
On 22 November 2020, Turkana militia shot and killed a young Samburu boy when they stormed Natiti village (Samburu North, Samburu). They also stole an unknown number of livestock.
On 19 November 2020, suspected armed Pokot militia attacked a group of men who were fetching firewood in Kapedo village (Turkana East). Four people were killed including a student.
On 14 November 2020, suspected police officers abducted a sheikh from Barwaqo village in Wajir town (Wajir East, Wajir). The sheikh had travelled from Sire location in Korondinle division.
On 12 November 2020, a Tukrana ethnic militia shot and killed a civilian looking after his cattle in the vicinity of Maua town (Igembe South, Meru). The incident is related to land dispute.
On 7 November 2020, unknown gunmen shot and killed a teacher from the Dakabaricha mixed secondary school at his home in Marsabit town (Saku, Marsabit). The motive is unknown.

On 6 November 2020, Pokot ethnic militiamen shot and killed two young boys and stole animals they were herding in the vicinity of Elegeyo-Marakwet town (Marakwet West, Elgeyo Marakwet). The incident is related to land dispute.

On 18 October 2020, an armed agent for the Tigania West MP agent (assumed police officer) attacked a royal media services journalist at Urru stadium in Tigania town (Tigania West, Meru). The Muuga FM reporter was beaten as he interviewed residents.

On 9 October 2020, a man was abducted by five armed men, identifying themselves as security forces in Nairobi town (Starehe, Nairobi). The man is a Somali refugee and he was a suspect in the 2013 Westgate Mall attack that left 68 people dead.
On 6 October 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot at a bus between Kutulo and El Wak town (Mandera South, Mandera). Four people were injured.
On 23 September 2020, Al Shabaab militants abducted three civilians travelling to Mandera town in the vicinity of Lafey town (Lafey, Mandera).
On 17 September 2020, unknown gunmen attacked boys herding cattle at Kilepoi village near Baragoi town (Samburu North, Samburu). One boy was killed.
On 16 September 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked two traders on a motorbike along Fino-sheikh Barrow road (location coded to Sheikh Barrow, Lafey, Mandera). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 13 September 2020, an unknown clan militia attacked people in Marashoni village (Molo, Nakuru). The attackers torched at least 10 houses, killing one and injuring seven others.
On 11 September 2020, armed raiders from Ethiopia ambushed a group of herders at River Nakuwa near Lowerangak location (Turkana North, Turkana). Four Pastoralists were killed in the attack.

On 10 September 2020, a Pokot ethnic militia attack and raided Marakwet pastoralists in Kipchumwa location (Marakwet East, Elgeyo-Marakwet) following an earlier raid by Marakwet pastoralists in Chepkokou, coded separately. One person was killed.

On 10 September 2020, a Marakwet militia attacked pastoralists in Chepkokou location near Kapenguria town (Kapenguria, West Pokot). Five civilians were killed. The attack was related to ongoing retaliation between the Marakwets and the Pokots.
On 2 September 2020, two gunmen on a motorcycle shot and injured a prominent lawyer in Maua town (Igembe South, Meru).

On 18 August 2020, two online journalists were detained and attacked by police after they were reportedly lured to a hotel in Upper Hill, Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi). The journalists had been working on a report on alleged corruption at Kenya Rural Roads Authority (KURA) and were taken to four different police stations.

On 9 August 2020, police fatally shot a man in Kwasasi village in Lumu West (Hindi, Lamu West, Lamu). Police went to the man's house after a tip off that he was part of the group that injured a police officer with a panga.

On 1 August 2020, a group of people, armed with crude weapons fatally assaulted a woman and seriously injured her husband over a land dispute in Kathuma village, Machakos county (Machakos Town, Machakos).

On 30 July 2020, two people, including a a Nyumba Kumi member, were injured with arrows when they were attacked by 10 youth in Ndoswa (Molo, Nakuru). The attack is suspected to be related to a land dispute and the recent evictions overseen by the Kenya Forest Service in Marioshoni area. One fatality reported.

On 28 July 2020, the MCA for Mlango Kubwa was hospitalised after being assaulted by police officers in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi), after she and other MCAs attempted to serve the speaker an impeachment. [women targeted: politicians]
On 27 July 2020, suspected cattle raiders shot and injured a teenager from another ethnic group herding livestock in the Olmariko area near Olpusimoru in Narok North subcounty.
Around 19 July 2020 (as reported), an armed group of another community attacked and killed a young herder boy in Marti (Samburu North, Samburu) and stole a hundred goats and seventy cattle.

On 10 July 2020, armed cattle raiders attacked and injured a cattle herder in Nassoukro, near Kabarnet (Baringo Central, Baringo), and made off with over 100 head of cattle. The herder later died from his injuries.

Around 9 July 2020 (as reported), the bodies of two teenagers who went missing after herding livestock were found dead with arrows in the corpses in the Maasai Mau forest near Olposimoru (Narok South, Narok).

On 7 July 2020, suspected Al Shabaab members hijacked and kidnapped 8 people in the Dabacity area near Wajir (Wajir East, Wajir). Police recovered the vehicle. No casualties and/or fatalities reported.
Around 5 July 2020, police fatally shot a man selling hand sanitizers during the national coronavirus curfew in Rioma near Kisii (Nyaribari Chache, Kisii).
On 5 July 2020, two Pokot herders were injured after Turkana raiders attacked Atirir village near Salawa (Tiaty, Baringo).

source: Kenya Standard; Citizen (Kenya); The Star (Kenya); Daily Nation (Kenya)

Around 21 June 2020 (as reported), a man was severely assaulted and injured by police in Mpeketoni (Lamu West, Lamu County) during the enforcement of the national coronavirus lockdown.
On 15 June 2020, two police officers severely assaulted and injured a man in Litein (Buret, Kericho) during the national coronavirus curfew.
On 14 June 2020, suspected Al Shabaab members raided a village in Fino near Mandera (Mandera East, Mandera) and sexually assaulted two young girls. [women targeted: girls]

notes: On 8 June 2020, 4 people, including a student and motor bike operator, were killed in a suspected tribal attack in Songa (Saku, Marsabit). All victims were from the Rendilles ethnic group.

notes: On 7 June 2020, a woman, accused of breaking into the house of a police officer, was dragged behind a motorcycle by policemen in Olenguruone in Narok county (Narok North, Narok).
On 7 June 2020, a man, suspected of theft, was hospitalised after being shot by police with live ammunition in Makutano (Kapenguria, West Pokot) during the national coronavirus curfew.

On 1 June 2020, police fatally shot a homeless man working at Marikiti market in Mathare (Mathare, Nairobi). The IPOA are currently investigating several cases of police brutality in Kenya during the national coronavirus lockdown.

On 31 May 2020, police fatally shot a woman at a roadblock in Emali (Makueni). The IPOA are currently investigating several cases of police brutality in Kenya during the national coronavirus lockdown.
On 31 May 2020, a police officer sexually assaulted a woman he was interrogating at the Manyatta Police Station (Manyatta, Embu).

On 30 May 2020, police fatally shot three family members in Kwale (Matuga, Kwale). The IPOA are currently investigating several cases of police brutality in Kenya during the national coronavirus lockdown.

On 29 May 2020, police fatally shot two people in Katanin Village near Kapsabet (Emgwen, Nandi). The IPOA are currently investigating several cases of police brutality in Kenya during the national coronavirus lockdown.
Around 27 May 2020 (week of), suspected police officers severely assaulted a man with batons in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) during the national coronavirus curfew.
On 20 May 2020, a carpenter was assaulted and injured by police in Kisumu (Kisumu Central, Kisumu) for not wearing a mask during the national coronavirus curfew. He later succumbed from his injuries.

On 17 May 2020, the father of a Lamu senator was shot by police at the Doldol Police Station (Laikipia North, Laikipia) after police arrested him for failing to wear a face mask during the national coronavirus curfew. The man was severely injured.
Around 10 May 2020 (as reported), police reportedly assaulted a man at Keliot village in the area of Bomet township (Bomet East, Bomet) when enforcing the national coronavirus curfew.
Around 6 May 2020 (week of), police reportedly assaulted a man with whips and blunt objects at Silibwet trading centre near Bomet (Bomet East, Bomet) during the enforcement of the coronavirus curfew.
On 4 May 2020, a man was fatally assaulted by police in Mathare (Mathare, Nairobi), within the context of coronavirus measures.
Around 3 May 2020 (week of), a police officer reportedly sexually assaulted a man, who he arrested, at the Nakuru Central Police Station (Nakuru Town East, Nakuru).
On 24 April 2020, unidentified individuals abducted two men and a driver (coded as taxi driver) in Kayole (Embakasi Central, Nairobi). They are yet to be found.

On 13 April 2020, ten men, armed with crude weapons, stormed the house of a People Daily journalist in Tente, near Nyamira (West Mugirango, Nyamira). Neighbours alerted police, one suspect arrested after neighbours caught and assaulted him. Reports indicate the ambush was over a news story involving political figures.
On 10 April 2020, a man was fatally assaulted by police in Ruai (Kasarani, Nairobi), within the context of coronavirus measures.

On 7 April 2020, a trader was killed during a police operation in Mumias (Mumias West, Kakamega) after police used teargas to disperse a crowd during the national coronavirus curfew. Police are accused of beating traders.
On 4 April 2020, a trader was fatally assaulted by police in Kawangware (Kilimani, Nairobi) during the national coronavirus curfew.

On 3 April 2020, a woman was allegedly shot and injured by police when they opened fire to disperse a crowd at a market in Mumias (Mumias West, Kakamega) during enforcement of the ongoing national coronavirus curfew.

On 3 April 2020, a 13 year old was hospitalised with fractures on his right leg after he was allegedly assaulted with clubs and gun butts by police officers in Busia town (Matayos, Busia) during the enforcement of the national coronavirus curfew.
On 2 April 2020, a man was allegedly assaulted by police officers in Mumias (Mumias West, Kakamega), during enforcement of the ongoing national coronavirus curfew.
On 2 April 2020, armed Tugen youth raided Ngiyang near Kolowa (Tiaty, Baringo), injuring a Pokot herder and stealing 60 goats.
On 2 April 2020, police reportedly assaulted a man inside his compound in Mwangulu area in Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) during the coronavirus curfew.
Around 2 April 2020, a police officer raped a women who had been arrested for theft inside his house on the Matuu police station base (Yatta, Machakos).

On 1 April 2020, a man succumbed from his injuries after being allegedly beaten up by police in Ukunda (Msambweni, Kwale) during enforcement of the national coronavirus curfew. Police had also used teargas to disperse at least 12 people, including the deceased, at a bar.
On 1 April 2020, police officers allegedly broke the limbs of civilians in Mauche (Njoro, Nakuru) when enforcing the national coronavirus curfew.
On 1 April 2020, a few shoppers were reportedly assaulted by police in Kipevu (Changamwe, Mombasa) with whips and batons during the coronavirus curfew.
Around 1 April 2020, a man succumbed to his injuries after being allegedly beaten up by police in Kakamega (Lurambi, Kakamega) during enforcement of the national coronavirus curfew.
Around 1 April 2020, police officers allegedly broke the limbs of civilians in Nakuru (Nakuru North, Nakuru) when enforcing the national coronavirus curfew.

Around 30 March 2020 (week of), a man succumbed from his injuries after police assaulted him in Nakuru (Nakuru Town East, Nakuru).
On 29 March 2020, a boda boda driver was fatally assaulted by police in Homabay (Homa Bay), during the national coronavirus lockdown.
On 29 March 2020, a boda boda driver was reportedly seriously injured after police assaulted him in a village near Busia (Matayos, Busia).
Around 29 March 2020 (week of), a man succumbed from his injuries after being assaulted by police in Dandora (Embakasi North, Nairobi).
On 28 March 2020, police reportedly assaulted people in a block of six units in the Kayole neighborhood, Matopeni area in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) during the coronavirus curfew.
On 28 March 2020, police used teargas to disperse residents in Nyamasaria (Kisumu East, Kisumu) defying a curfew order to curb the spread of coronavirus.

On 28 March 2020, three police officers whipped women during the enforcement of coronavirus social distancing at the Mitunguu market in South Imenti sub county (Imenti Central, Meru). A journalist who captured the event was also assaulted after refusing to delete the footage of the assaults.
On 27 March 2020, a boda boda driver was fatally wounded by police near the Kosele trading centre in Rachuonyo (Kasipul, Homa Bay) during the enforcement of the national coronavirus curfew.

On 27 March 2020, police were accused of beating motorists and pedestrians in the Nyanza administrative area near Kisumu (Kisumu Central, Kisumu) during the implementation of the national coronavirus curfew.
On 27 March 2020, police were accused of beating and using teargas on civilians in Kondele (Kisumu Central, Kisumu) during the national coronavirus curfew. A boda boda driver was severely assaulted.
On 27 March 2020, at least five people were reportedly injured by police in Kitale (Saboti, Trans Nzoia) during the national coronavirus curfew.

On 27 March 2020, a land activist was fatally shot by a police officer in Kanamai in Majengo (Vihiga). The activist was attempting to block a developer from erecting a perimeter wall on a quarter an acre piece of land. A Kilifi Social Justice Centre Rapid Response officer said the activist could have been targeted because he was a key witness in a forced disappearance case.
On 27 March 2020, police officers beat a delivery driver along with other motorists with batons in Nakuru (Nakuru Town East, Nakuru) during the nationwide coronavirus curfew.

source: Nairobi News; HRW; Washington Post; New York Times
notes: On 27 March 2020, police was accused of kicking and beating hundreds of commuters at a ferry with batons, forced them to lie down and threw teargas canisters at the crowd who attempted to return home before the national coronavirus curfew implementation in Likoni (Likoni, Mombasa). Dozens of people were injured, including a journalist. A boda boda driver died from his injuries after police officers assaulted him following the start of coronavirus curfew.
On 26 March 2020, police used teargas to disperse a crowd at the Muringene and Laare markets in Meru (North Imenti, Meru), during the enforcement of coronavirus social distancing.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) Border Patrol Unit
notes: On 17 March 2020, Border Patrol Units used tear gas to disperse a crowd of civilians in Bungoma (Khalaba, Kanduyi, Bungoma). The civilians had gathered to receive hand sanitizers brought to them by a local politician, while the police dispersed the crowd in order to prevent transmission of coronavirus.

On 15 March 2020, members of an unidentified armed group targeted an ambulance with an IED and opened fire on the ambulance after the IED detonated in Hulugho (Hulugho, Ijara, Garissa), leaving 3 dead.
On 13 March 2020, Ethiopian soldiers crossed the border and killed five people in Sessi, Moyale town (Moyale, Marsabit). The victims were accused of harbouring Ethiopian rebels.
On 11 March 2020, two people were killed in a suspected Al Shabaab attack on the town of Mandera (Mandera East, Mandera).
On 11 March 2020, a man was abducted by suspected Al-Shabaab members when the group ambushed a bus headed to Mandera at Bamboo (Lafey, Mandera) from Nairobi. No casualties reported.
On 23 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Qorisa (coded as Ijara) and burnt down four houses belonging to police reservists.
On 20 February 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants set fire to the home of a Kenyan police reservist in Sangailu (Bura, Fafi, Garissa).
On 19 February 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a public transportation bus in Sarman (Bute, Wajir Central, Wajir), killing 3 people.
Around 19 February 2020 (week of), suspected Pokot militia attacked Ngaratuko village (Baringo North, Baringo) and injured a young boy before stealing a number of animals.
On 12 February 2020, Al Shabaab militant attacked Sangailu in Garissa county.
On 7 February 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants killed a man in Ijara, Garissa county.
On 24 January 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a passenger bus traveling toward Wajir, injuring 2 people.
On 13 January 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a school in Kamuthe, Garissa County, killing 3 male teachers and injuring 1 child. They also destroyed a Safaricom communication mast.

On 11 January 2020, a bishop was picked up by two men on a motorbike allegedly wearing police uniforms from his home in Alego, coded as Siaya in Siaya county. His family suspects he was kidnapped due to a land dispute case.
On 5 January 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants raided a village in Fino (Lafey, Mandera) and abducted five civilians, four were later released. No casualties reported.
On 2 January 2020, Al Shabaab attacked a bus in Lamu county, killing 3 people and injuring 2 others.
On 31 December 2019, a suspected Al Shabaab returnee was killed in Watamu, Dabaso, Kilifi. The victim's family has accused the police of killing him.
On 31 December 2019, a man and his 12-year-old son were killed by unidentified assailans in Baragoi, Samburu.
On 29 December 2019, a police officer shot dead a driver who had refused to bribe him in Trans Mara district, Narok County. The police officer was arrested.
On 28 December 2019, an assailant armed with a machete attacked 3 people along the Kibaoni-Mpeketoni road (coded to Mpeketoni, Lamu West, Lamu County). 3 injuries and no fatalities were reported.
Around 26 December 2019, four police officers raided the home of a civilian. They shot and injured him after questioning him about illegal activities.
On 26 December 2019, Al Shabaab militants kidnapped two civilians who were traveling in the Liboi area (Dadaab, Garissa) and took them to Somalia. They were released on December 27.

On 25 December 2019, police officers in civilian clothes allegedly took two boys to a petrol station in Pangani (Starehe, Nairobi) and shot them. The police boss claims the incident was a shootout between police officers and criminals.
Around 23 December 2019, a suspected crime gang leader was killed in uncertain circumstances and his body dumbed in Maungu, Taita Taveta County.
On 17 December 2019, three people were kidnapped by suspected Al Shabaab militants between Riba and Konton. One of the potential victims escaped.
On 17 December 2019, two suspects held for the murder of a priest alleged that they had been tortured by police while in custody in Embu (Kirimari, Manyatta).
Around 16 December 2019, Al Shabaab claimed it killed 9 people in Harbul village near Garissa town.
On 11 December 2019, two unidentified attackers wearing Islamic clothing for women hacked to death a Lamu chief and his assistant in their office in Mbwajumwali.

assoc_actor_2: Christian Group (Kenya); Police Forces of Kenya (2013-); Teachers (Kenya); Health Workers (Kenya)
notes: On 6 December 2019, Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for an attack on a bus bound for Mandera between Kotulo and Waragud areas of Tarbaj, Wajir county, which killed 11 Christian passengers after militants separated locals and non-locals (victims consist of 8 policemen, 2 teachers and a doctor) . The militants then fled to neighbouring Somalia as Kenyan forces deployed to the area, while the bus driver and a passanger were arrested.

assoc_actor_1: Turkana Ethnic Militia (Kenya); Pokot Ethnic Militia (Kenya)
assoc_actor_2: Women (Kenya); Turkana Ethnic Group (Kenya); Pokot Ethnic Group (Kenya)
notes: On 3 December 2019, three women were reported killed and another one injured in an attack on Kapau area near Kapedo in Tiaty, Baringo county. Although the attackers were not clearly identified, the source reported that the incident took place in the context of increased tensions in the area between Turkana and Pokot groups since August.

On 1 December 2019, policemen reportedly patrolled through the streets of Mararani in Lamu East, Lamu county, and beat up residents, arresting 10 of them, after locals had earlier beaten up two policemen after alleged harassment on the citizens.

On 29 November 2019, residents of Jasko in Mavoko, Machakos county, were reportedly attacked by unidentified men who demolished several houses and injured residents, one of whom was allegedly beaten up with crude weapons. Two individuals were later arrested. Jasko residents decry increased attacks over land disputes, accusing 'cartels' to be trying to force them out of the area.

Around 27 November 2019 (week of), a boy was killed in Tiaty subcounty, Baringo county, by attackers who drove away with 50 camels. Attacks happens in context of tension between Turkana and Pokot pastoralist militias, but is is unclear to what extent killing relates to these tensions. Reported on 3 December 2019 as happening 'last week'.

assoc_actor_1: Auliyan Ethnic Militia (Kenya); Abduwak Ethnic Militia (Kenya)
assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Kenya); Abduwak Ethnic Group (Kenya); Auliyan Ethnic Militia (Kenya)
notes: On 25 November 2019, ethnic militiamen reportedly killed a local farmer in Raya area of Balambala sub-county, Garissa county, amid tensions between the Adbuwak and Awlyahan groups in the area.

On 24 November 2019, groups of armed men with machetes reportedly attacked citizens and injured 10 of them in the constituencies of Nyali and Kisauni, Mombasa, as they were on their way to Kongowea market. Most of the victims were businessmen. 11 people were later arrested, with some sources reporting that they belonged to a gang called '86 Battalion' or to the Wakali Kwanza gang.

On 24 November 2019, groups of armed men with machetes reportedly attacked citizens and injured 10 of them in the constituencies of Nyali and Kisauni, Mombasa, as they were on their way to Kongowea market. Most of the victims were businessmen. 11 people were later arrested, with some sources reporting that they belonged to a gang called '86 Battalion' or to the Wakali Kwanza gang.

On the night of 23 to 24 November 2019, a house was set on fire in Nyunzu market a few kilometres away from Wote in Makueni county, killing its four innocupants (an elder woman, her daughter and her two grand daughters) in the early morning of 24 November. A male family member embroiled in a land dispute with the women was arrested the next day. [women targeted: girls]
On 20 November 2019, a KDF soldier shot and killed a boda boda driver outside the naval base in Mtongwe (Mombassa county). The circumstances surronding the killing are disputed.

On 5 November 2019, attackers reportedly raided Atirir and Chepkilowon villages in Tirioko ward of Tiaty, Baringo county, killing two herders and driving away with 4,000 goats, 300 cows and 70 camels belonging to six families. Local sources claims that Turkana herders carried out the attack and were armed with AK-47 rifles - but it's unclear if these reports are substantiated.

On 5 November 2019, an unidentified armed group (described as 'bandits' it some sources) ambushed a vehicle in Kukuto area of Marsabit county (coordinates for Jaldesa used at prec2), killing at least three.
On Oct 29th 2019, an Al Shabaab militia attacked a police station in Dadaj-Bula. The number of fatalities or injuries is not known.

On 29 October 2019, gunmen ambushed a convoy of vehicles carrying mirra (khat) into Baragoi (Samburu county, coordinates used at prec2). The attackers killed one driver and wounded four others. The attackers released the convoy after looting from it, telling the survivors they were not the inteded target.
On Oct 24th 2019, a man suspected of kidnapping a child was killed by police at Homa Bay.
On Oct 23th 2019, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a matatu vehicle in Mandera. The driver managed to speed up avoiding bullets hitting passengers.

On Oct 20th 2019, in Eldama Ravine town, Baringo county askaris beat and abducted a disabled person who was asking to address the public in order to denounce the government's failure to remit funds for disabled for a long time. The man was injured.

On Oct 13th 2019, in Lanyiru, at the Meru-Isiolo border, in a response to an attack occurred the same day in Tigania East, Meru pastoralists killed a man believed to be one of the perpetrators of the attack.
On Oct 9th, four youths were attacked and injured allegedly by the police in Siakago. Circumstances are not clear.
On Oct 7th 2019, a priest was kidnapped, murdered and buried in a shallow grave in Embu County by unknown men. His body was found a week after. The motives of the killing are unclear.
01 Oct. 7 people killed in the attack on Banisaa Village that was carried out by Degodia clan militia.
On 23 September 2019, unidentified attackers killed four pastoralists and stole livestock at Baragoi (Samburu county).

Around Sept 21st 2019, Hulugho villagers were reportedly attacked by the military, who descended on their village at midnight and indiscriminately opened fire. According to pictures circulating on the following days, one man was shot in the head.

Around Sept 20th 2019 (exact date nort reported), a man was shot dead at Ntangilia (coded as Miathene, with GP2) allegedly by Turkana herders who are said to have brought their camels to Meru for pasture.
On Sept 17th 2019, in Isiolo South, four unarmed herdsmen were killed by an unknown armed militia. The killing might be due to boundary disputes or to resources.

On Sept 16th, in Voi, 2 herders were killed and other 3 injured in suspected retiliatory attacks The two herdsmen were suspected to have killed a boda boda driver, who was later found dumped in a forest.
15 Sep. A member of Anti-Stock Theft Unit police shot three civilians and left them wounded in Trans mara district.The motive of shooting is unknown. The police was later arrested.
On 15 September 2019, during an Isiolo-Garissa border attack, three herdsmen were killed and 100 camels stolen by unidentified individuals in Garba Tula.

12 Sep. 4 killed by armed men in Tana Selta, Tana River County (no coordinates available for Tana delta)

On 8 September 2019, pastoralists attacked civilians at unspecified locations in Kitui East and West constituencies (Kitui county), killing 2. Two events coded at Malalani and Kakeani (at geoprec2), with 1 fatality each.
25 Aug. Five people were killed in an attack carried out by suspected militias from Ethiopia in Forole, Marsabit County, Kenya. They also took unknown number of their cows.

25 Aug. Unidentified armed men from Ethiopia attacked the herders in Sabareh, Marsabit County, Kenya. Five herders killed in the attack. The suspected militias took unknown number of their cows and crossed the border into Ethiopia.

On 25 August 2019, a land rights activist was abducted and killed by unknown persons from Muthini village near Kabati (Kandara, Murang'a). Two days later her body was discovered. The activist was investigating abuses meted out to squatters living on parcels of land claimed by some tycoons. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]
On Aug 18th 2019, residents of Nyamembe (coded as Kuria East for unfound Nyamembe) were assaulted over missing cattle. No fatalities reported.

In August (exact date not reported), after the Land Ministry nullified over 1,274 title deeds in advance of the evictions, officials evicting Mau Forest settlers (location coded as Mau Narok with GP2) reportedly beat people, torched homes, and destroyed crops, leaving thousands of people homeless.
10 July : Unidentified armed group attacked Ethiopian refugees in Kakuma refugees camp in Kenya. One killed in the attack and others wounded

On Jul 6th, in Isiolo, Police Forces allegedly beat a man to death. It supposedly happened following a scuffle when they tried to arrest him following accusations he had threatened to kill a person. Police deny the fact occurred.

Around Jul 4th 2019 (exact date not reported) a herder in Sangailu was burnt with a hot object by a soldier. A video, which got frequent airplay on the internet, shows a senior military officer calming down residents, promising to take the victim for treatment.
02 July: Unidentified armed group killed one person and stole 150 cows in Sololo, Marsabit County.

notes: On Jun 27th 2019, in Kainuk a Kenya Red Cross driver was ambushed and shot by an unidentified armed group. No fatalities reported.

14 June: A police officer was shot dead at his home in Kitengela town, Kajiado county. His wife was also shot but survived.
13 June: Unidentified armed men killed a three years old girl and injured 7 others in Isiolo sub-county.
13 June: Unidentified armed men killed a civilian in Turkana. The victim, an old woman, was with a group of other women when she shot dead by armed men.

Around Jun 13th, an MCA raided Gesusu Sub-County Hospital In Kisii and kicked out hospital staffers and patients. During the raid, patients were forcefully discharged and business disrupted for hours. The MCA claimed doing this to ensure the provision of quality services in his ward, as five patients had died at the hospital in the previous month owing to negligence by the health officers.

23 January: In Muruka village, a civilian was shot and wounded by a police officer who was mad after his favourite football team lost. He later died in the hospital

19 January: In West Pokot county, an armed bandit shot and killed a 10 year old child.

15-16 January: Al Shabaab militants attacked the DusitD2 hotel in Westlands, Nairobi using hand grenades, guns, suicide bombings and blowing up vehicles. Soldiers and police reacted with gunfire. 21 people total (including the attackers, civilians and one member of security forces) were killed in the attack. It is not clear if the al Shabaab fatalities were due to suicide bombings or the security response. 28 others were injured. The attack began on the afternoon of the 15th and carried into the following day. One American and one Briton were among the dead.

It is not clear if the al Shabaab fatalities were due to suicide bombings or the security response. 28 others were injured. The attack began on the afternoon of the 15th and carried into the following day. One American and one Briton were among the dead.
11 January: In Bomet county, Konoin, one civilian was found dead in a tea farm. No group has claimed responsibility.
02 January: Nzoia Sugar Company Acting Managing Director Michael Kulundu was kidnapped in Kanduyi. He was tortured to death later.
01 January: Kenya police shot dead one civilian in Mombasa, Kenya. Circumstances unclear.
25 December: In Bondo town, the west Yimbo chief, Daniel Tiang was found dead at a guest house, likely by poison.
22 December: Police allegedly shot and killed a 23 year-old university student claimig that he was a member of a gang that was terrorising Line Saba residents
20 December: In Siakago, Embu County, unidentified armed group attacked a 15 years old boy. They chopped off his private part and left him with deep cut on his head as well.
On 14 December 2018, police reservists shot and wounded a man as he attempted to break into a house in Mandera town.
On 11 December 2018, a gang attacked an unspecified location in the Kegoye sub-county (Vihiga county), wounding four people (who suffered head wounds). There are no further details.
On 10 December 2018, an armed gang comprising four men shot dead a priest as he was travelling to Kikuyu town (Kiambu county), and stole donations that had been made to the priest the previous day.
On or around December 6th, two local government officials were ambushed and killed by suspected raiders from West Pokot, as they travelled from Kapelbok (Turkana, coordinates used) to Nakwamoru.

On 5 December 2018, a gang described as being cattle rustlers attacked Koibirir location in the Elegeyo area. The attackers injured several villagers, and stole cattle. There are no further details on the event.

On 5 December 2018, an unknown group attacked Takaywa (note: unclear if Takaywa is on the West Pokot or Turkana side of the border. Coordinates for Lokichar, Turkana, have been used, at precision 3), killing a child, and stealing an unknown number of cattle. One source indicates the attack took place at Karon, in North Pokot sub-county.

During the week beginning November 26th, herders assaulted a farmer at Banita (Nakuru). The farmer claimed the group wanted him to vacate the land. The event is part of a spate of similar incidents in the area.

During the week beginning November 26th, raiders (suspected of coming from Masol village in West Pokot) attacked the village of Kaakong (Turkana), killing a child, and stealing 150 goats. One source indicates that two people were killed in the attack; two sources suggest the event took place in the following week (time precision of 2 used).

On 29 November 2018, bandits attacked a group of herders at Lobua near Gambela (coordinates for Gambela, Wajir, used), killing one, and wounding two. The bandits then stole 16 cows. The source notes that bandits were suspected of belonging to the Turkana ethnic group, though this has not been confirmed.

On 24 November 2018, a gang known as 'Military' attacked civilians with machetes in Likoni (Mombasa) after one of theirs died in clashes with police (coded in a separate event), killing a Rwandan civilian in the process.

On 23 November 2018, a police DCI shot and killed an unarmed junior officer following a dispute over a police car. He then attempted to shoot his uncle and fired at four bystanders, before retreating to a nearby police station, where he was disarmed and arrested by other police officers. The source does not specify the location, and coordinates for Thimbugua (Kiambu) have been used.

On 23 November 2018, police shot and wounded a man in Kusauni (Mombasa), accusing him of being involved in gang activities (a charge disputed by the victims family). It is not clear if the victim survived the incident, or died.
On 21 November 2018, alleged bandits from Pokot attacked Chemisto village in Kipchumwa (Elgeyo-Marakwet) in a cattle raid. A child was shot in the hand during the attack.

On 20 November 2018, unknown gunmen attacked Chakama town (Kilifi), assaulting and abducting an Italian NGO volunteer, and firing at civilians as they left the town, wounding five (including four children). The identity of the attackers has not been established.

On 19 November 2018, a 60 year-old woman was killed at Lira trading centre near the border between West Pokot and Elgeyo-Marakwet (coordinates for Kapenguria, West Pokot, used). The identity of the attackers is unknown, as is the motive, though the source suggests they are bandits.

On 17 November 2018, at an unspecified location along the Kisumu-Nandi border (coordinates for Chemase, Nandi, used), a farm manager was killed and her son seriously wounded following an attack by an unknown group. The source indicates the incident is part of a land dispute in the area, and also notes that the property belongs to a retired judge.
On 15 November 2018, unknown gunmen killed a civilian in Sewes (Elgeyo-Marakwet, coordinates for Endo used). The source suggest they are bandits.

On 15 November 2018, a youth Pokot militia (whose members are reported to be between the ages of 10 and 14) shot and killed a herder at an unspecified location in Baringo North sub-county (Baringo, coordinates for Bartabwa used). The attackers fled the scene after the attack, stealing 22 head of cattle.

On 14 November 2018, a member of the Baringo county assembly was physically assaulted by other MCAs from the KANU party. The attackers locked the victim inside a room in the assembly building (in Kabarnet), before beating him up. Security guards broke down the down and rescued the victim, who was taken to hospital. The event was sparked by a dispute surrounding the public service board.

During the week beginning 12th November (or shortly before), bandits killed a civilian at an unspecified location in Baringo North sub-county (Baringo, coordinates for Bartabwa used) and stole cattle.

On 10 November 2018, unknown gunmen shot at a Kenya Red Cross vehicle in Ruqa (Garissa, coordinates for Masalani used), wounding a volunteer travelling in the vehicle. Unverified possible connection with Al Shabaab.

On 6 November 2018, a civilian carrying charcoal was shot in the shoulder by a police officer in Magarini (Kilifi). The victim claimed that the officer had ordered him to stop, but he was shot even though he complied with the order (note that it is illegal to sell charcoal in the area).
On 6 November 2018, a police officer shot a fisherman at Naivasha (Nakuru), wounding him in the thigh. The police commander responsible for the area alleged that the fisherman was illegally fishing.
On 4 November 2018, two people were wounded in a 'botched raid' at Mata Bofu, likey in Isiolo south. The attackers were believed to be pastoralists from Lagdera in Garissa county.

On 30 October 2018, a group of at least five men armed with machetes and hand weapons broke into Bushiangala Technical College, attacking and raping at least five students. A suspect has been arrested.

On 30 October 2018, armed cattle rustlers shot and killed an elderly woman at her home in Gathanji, after attempting to steal her two cows (coordinates for Ol Moran, Laikipia, used). Four suspects have been arrested.
On or before October 28th, a gang attacked a motorbike taxi and gang-raped a female passenger, in the Dandora suburb of Nairobi.

On or before October 24th, three herders (out of a group of seven) were killed and another injured when bandits fired upon them. The herders were making their way from Kapoa to Ameyan market (coordinates for Kapedo, Barringo, used).
'A male staff member of an INGO was attacked by unknown assailants near his residence during the evening. The attack led to severe head injuries and a crack on his skull.'

On 11 October 2018, bandits raided the village of Chemisto in Sigor constituency (coordinates for Sigor, West Pokot, used). They killed two civilian, including a child. The bandits also stole a significant amount of livestock. The attack comes three day after a truce was signed between the Pokot and Marakwet, which had been intended to put an end to such raiding and reprisal attacks.

On 10 October 2018, around twenty militants suspected to belong to Al Shabaab attacked a school in Lafey (Mandera). The militants targeted non-Muslim staff, and threw an explosive device into quarters used by non-Muslim teachers, killing two.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) Prison Guards
notes: On 9 October 2018, prison guards pursuing an escaped convict attacked 'dozens' of residents of a deprived neighbourhood in Nyeri. A prison official said that no reports of abuse had been filed.

On 9 October 2018, an armed group (described as bandits in the source) attacked the village of Nkiruni in Tharaka-North county (coordinates for county capital of Kathwana used). The group abducted a mother and her two daughters, and released two soon after. They also looted livestock from the area. [women targeted: girls]

On 7 October 2018, a 22 year old man was shot with arrows, and his corpse beheaded, by an unknown communal militia in the area of Mauche (Nakuru). There were over ten attackers, and four of the victim's friends were able to escape.
On or before October 2nd, Kenyan security services fired at civilians in Madera county (precise location unspecified). At least one person was injured.

On 2 October 2018, during a violent demonstration at the county assembly at Homa Bay town (coded in a separate event), police assaulted a journalist from the Kenya Standard who was covering the demonstration.
27 September 2018: 2 people were reportedly killed by unidentified gunmen near Karasani town as they traveled to Lokori from Kapedo.

27 September 2018: Following an IED landmine attack the day before, Kenyen security forces raided the Daba city village in Mandara county and beat local residents with clubs and kicking them. At least 22 unarmed civilians were hurt during the event.
On or before September 21st, police shot dead a matutu (minibus) tout in Dandora (Nairobi), sparking protests on Sep 21st. There are no further details on the incident.
21 September 2018: Armed men from Marakwet village reportedly raided the Ng'oron village, Tirioko Tiaty Sub-county. According to the report, three people were killed and several others injured.
On 21 September 2018, the police shot dead a youth in Dandora who was allegedly smoking marihuana (bhang). The police stated that the incident occurred due to the youth possessing a weapon.

On 21 September 2018, a herder militia (believed to be Somali in ethnicity) attacked Muthungwe village (coordinates for Mutitu, Kitui, used). The group killed a man and seriously injured his wife, using machetes to do so. The motive for the attack is not clear.

On 21 September 2018, a gang of five men ambushed three people as they returned to Koromangucha village from a party in a nearby village (coordinates for Kuria East, Migori, used). One person was killed, and two others were wounded before they escaped. The attackers used machetes; there was no clear motive for the attack.

On 20 September 2018, a suspected bandit shot dead two herders and a child in Kerio Valley or nearby area as a revenge for the family failing to share cows stolen by one of the victims and the perpetrator during a raid in Tiaty, Baringo county. The attacker later surrendered to the police.

On September 18th and 19th, a criminal gang attacked Ragumo and Ofunyu villages in Kisumu East constituency (coordinates for Nyamasaria, Kisumu used). The group assaulted an unspecified number of residents, and engaged in multiple counts of theft.
On 19 September 2018, the police allegedly shot dead three youth in Dandora who were reportedly smoking marihuana (bhang).

On or around September 18th, an unidentified group carrying axes and machetes attacked and robbed the uncle of a murder victim, which is connected to the Governor of Migori county. The event happened in Nairobi, and the victim was able to fend off the attackers.

On September 18th and 19th, a criminal gang attacked Ragumo and Ofunyu villages in Kisumu East constituency (coordinates for Nyamasaria, Kisumu used). The group assaulted an unspecified number of residents, and engaged in multiple counts of theft.
On 17 September 2018, a bread vendor was shot dead by the police near an armory at the AP line in Kigumo.
At an unspecified time (likely on or after mid-September, precision 3 used) the Mungiki sect reportedly murdered a matatu (minibus) operator in Nairobi, after he refused to pay them protection money.
On 15 September 2018, a man shot dead his neighbour in Irobo village, Shinyalu, Kakamega county following a land dispute.

14 September 2018: A body has been found dumped in a pit latrine in Musegekwa village, Njoro county (coordinates given for Nessuit, which is nearby), most likely a result of ethnic violence that has troubled the area for some time. The victim left his house to graze his animals and was shot shortly after.

14 September 2018: Three people were reportedly killed by Police forces in the Musegekwa village, Njoro county, as police attempted to halt ethnic violence in the area. Coordinates given for Nessuit village, which is nearby.
On 14 September 2018, eight Al Shabaab gunmen ambushed a bus near Ijara, heading to Garissa. They profiled people travelling on the bus and killed two non-local passengers.

On 13 September 2018, a police officer fatally assaulted a minibus driver with his rifle. A mob formed and chased the police officer, lynching him. Another man (a boda boda driver) was killed in the violence. The events took place in the area of Kenyenya (Kisii), and a police Internal Affairs Unit has been dispatched to investigate.

During the week beginning September 10th, police shot dead three young men working on a dumpsite in Dandora (Nairobi). The police claimed one of the individuals was a notorious gangster, and that the deceased had been armed. The events have been contested by the family of one of the victims, who said that he worked at the dumpsite, and was not a robber.

12 September 2018: Security forces reportedly arrested a family of 5 in the town of El-Wak. Three of those arrested were later found dead, and local civilians have accused security forces of being responsible for their deaths.

On 12 September 2018, two men were killed in Kilolapwa and Shamu villages in the area of Ukunda (Kwale county). The victim in Kololapwa was an imam, who had been known to encourage youth not to join fundamentalist Islamic groups. Al Shabaab are suspected, but not confirmed, to have been involved in the deaths, which were within thirty minutes of each other.

On 11 September 2018, police apprehended four members of the same family at Qababa village in Elram (Kotulo ward, Wajir). One was beaten before being released, and the other three were found dead the following day. All had been shot in the head. The police were conducting a search operation in the area following an attack on a police vehicle the same day.

On 10 September 2018, the police allegedly shot dead a young man in Mtongwe, Mombasa following a raid in his home. The killing was done reportedly as part of the police's manhunt for a gang that has been attacking civilians in the local area.

On 10 September 2018, three people - including a 17 year old boy - were wounded at a field near Mauche (Nakuru). The attackers, who were believed to come from a nearby (unspecified) community, fired arrows at the civilians. It is probable that this event is connected to violence in neighbouring Narok area.

On 10 September 2018, a 13 year old boy was hacked to death, and his 12 year old sister and 70 year old grandmother were wounded in the attack in Esimenwa village (coordinates for Narok town used).
