The attack follows violence between the Maasai and Kipsigi groups in the area the following week (which some reports attribute to conflicts over land titles, some to cattle rustling, and others to actions by the government and/or assorted local politicians), though the specific identity of the group of attackers is not specified in the source, nor is the ethnicity of the victims. Police have been deployed to the area, and a suspect has been arrested.

On 6 September 2018, a man was shot with an arrow during a suspected revenge mission in Nkoben area near Maasai Mau forest in Narok county following the killing in the same area on 4 Sept. Tension in the community was high following the incidents.
On 6 September 2018, police killed three youth who they said were suspected criminals at Utage (Mombasa county). Police dismissed claims that these were extra-judicial killings.

On or before September 4th, off-duty Kenyan police officers demanded bribes from civilians drinking at an illicit brewery in Sondu (Kericho). After detaining several civilians, a crowd formed to release them, and the police fired gunshots to disperse the crowd, wounding a bystander. Senior police are reported to be investigating the incident.

On 4 September 2018, a herder (of an unspecified ethnicity) was killed in the Nkoben area of the Maasai Mau forest (coordinates for Mau Narok used). This killing sparked two days of violence in Narok (see separate entries).

On or before September 3rd, herders grazing their cattle in Boni Forest (Garissa county) were reportedly detained and beaten by the Kenyan military. At least eight herders were beaten, some seriously, and they have been separated from their cattle. The KDF denied that it was conducted any operations in the area.

On 3 September 2018, a journalist and a pregnant University student were abducted in Migori. After being attacked, the journalist escaped the moving car he was in, sustaining serious injuries. The student's body was later found in a forest, having been stabbed multiple times, and likely raped. The personal assistant of Governor Okoth Obado has been arrested for allegdly orchestrating the kidnap and murder. Obado was himself charged with aiding and abetting the murder on September 24th.

Between approximately 23 Aug and 6 Sept 2018, a suspect in the attempted murder of a former Garissa Finance executive claimed he had been tortured in custody by the police (where he had been for 15 days) and subjected to inhumane conditions while in Gigiri police station. The detainee is allegedly in need of medical attention.

On August 27th or 28th, a police officer killed a suspected drug dealer, who had been arrested and taken to the police station, before being shot in the head (note that his death took place on Moses Mudavadi road, and that the source does not specify the circumstances). The police officer in question has been arrested in connection with the killing.
On 26 August 2018, a matatu driver was wounded in Bomet after a police officer allegedly knocked out his teeth for refusing to accept a bribe.

On 19 August 2018, three men attacked the former finance county executive of Garissa county, as he was returning home from a mosque in Kilelshwa (Nairobi). The victim was shot in the head at close range, and was critically injured. On August 28th, the Governor of Garrissa - Ali Korane - was arrested and questioned by police in relations to the incident. He was released but remained a person of interest. Three other suspects were arrested, one of whom reportedly committed suicide.
On 16 August 2018, a public service vehicle travelling from Elwak to Mandera was attacked by unidentified gunmen. Three passengers were left in a critical condition.

During the month of August, four people were murdered in the sub-district of Butere (Kakamega county), reportedly by a local gang named 'The 42 Brothers'. The precise times for three of the murders are not specified.

During the month of August, four people were murdered in the sub-district of Butere (Kakamega county), reportedly by a local gang named 'The 42 Brothers'. The precise times for three of the murders are not specified.

During the month of August, four people were murdered in the sub-district of Butere (Kakamega county), reportedly by a local gang named 'The 42 Brothers'. The precise times for three of the murders are not specified.
On 14 August 2018, a civilian was murdered in the sub-district of Butere (Kakamega county), reportedly by a local gang named 'The 42 Brothers'.
On 12 August 2018, armed men shot and killed the driver of an MP at Soy Highway Motel in Kakamega county as they came in looking for the MP.
On 11 August 2018, a 13-year-old girl was beaten to death by six Pokot youths in Nasorot village, Tiaty subcounty, Baringo county for refusing to marry a 60-year-old man. [women targeted: girls]

7 August 2018: Three Somali herders who were grazing their cows on a planted land in Ganze, Kilifi County reportedly attacked the land-owner with knives, seriously injuring him and his brother who came to his aid.
31 July. Ethiopian Merrile militia shoots and kills Todonyang chief Ekal Lochamin in Lowerangak. The militia were believed to be cattle bandits.
18 July. The Transport Chief Administrative Secretary's driver is shot and killed in Kariobangi for unknown reason.

11 July. Suspected Merille (aka Dassanach) bandits from Ethiopia killed two people and seriously injured six others in a retaliatory attack on Olgana camp (coordinates approx) on the shores of Lake Turkana, at the border between Kenya and Ethiopia. The attackers stole cattle.
05 July. During a raid on an illegal brewery, police opened 'indiscriminate' fire, injuring three civilians.

23 June. Security officers, believed to be searching for al Shabaab remnants allegedly rounded up locals, burnt several houses and shops in Kutulo, Boji Garass, Konton and Qarsa in Tarbaj and Wajir East constituencies (approx coordinates for Qarsa and Boji). Several residents report injury.

23 June. Security officers, believed to be searching for al Shabaab remnants allegedly rounded up locals, burnt several houses and shops in Kutulo, Boji Garass, Konton and Qarsa in Tarbaj and Wajir East constituencies (approx coordinates for Qarsa and Boji). Several residents report injury.

23 June. Security officers, believed to be searching for al Shabaab remnants allegedly rounded up locals, burnt several houses and shops in Kutulo, Boji Garass, Konton and Qarsa in Tarbaj and Wajir East constituencies (approx coordinates for Qarsa and Boji). Several residents report injury.

23 June. Security officers, believed to be searching for al Shabaab remnants allegedly rounded up locals, burnt several houses and shops in Kutulo, Boji Garass, Konton and Qarsa in Tarbaj and Wajir East constituencies (approx coordinates for Qarsa and Boji). Several residents report injury.
20 May. Two police officers shoot and kill a woman in City Park, Nairobi. The reason for the attack is not known. The pair of police officers were later formally charged with murder.

04 May. Pokot militia attack a group of Turkana travellers at Chesitet in Tiaty, killing two. Upon hearing of the attack, a group of Turkanas residents in Marigat became angry, and in retaliation killed three Pokot civilians.

04 May. Pokot militia attack a group of Turkana travellers at Chesitet in Tiaty, killing two. Upon hearing of the attack, a group of Turkanas residents in Marigat became angry, and in retaliation killed three Pokot civilians.

03 May. Al Shabaab attacks Mandera, killing four 'non-Muslim' quarry workers. Several other injuries reported. The police later 'rescued' 150 workers involved in the incident. However, it is not certain if any of the workers were held hostage at any point.
13 April. A former district commissioner and three others are attacked and injured in Mwea over a land disagreement. One victim later died.

11 April. Nine members of a church group are injured after unidentified assailants attack a meeting. The reason for the attack is not known, though it may be related to a new member who had recently converted from another, unnamed religion.

11 April. Two people were killed and seven others injured after armed men raided Salima village in Laisamis sub county on April 11, 2018. The attack is believe to be linked to a rivalry between two communities. The attack is believed to be related to an attack in the area under similar circumstances three days prior
11 April. A teacher at Okimaru ACK Primary School, was shot dead in Malakisi, Sirisia by unidentified perpetrators. The reason for the attack is not known.
08 April. Three members of the same family are killed in an attack based on community rivalry in or near Salima village in Laisamis sub county.
03 April. Two are killed including a former Ukunda Ward aspirant in the 2017 General Election and two others injured when unidentified gunmen attacked Ukunda.

28 March. Government authorities assault, drug and deport to the UAE a leading opposition figure, Miguna Miguna (ODM/NRM). Miguna locked himself in the airport washroom to avoid his flight the day before.

28 March. Six people were killed and two others seriously injured in a militia attack near Kenyan border with Ethiopia. Occurring in Chiroqo, Banisa Sub County, most of the victims come from Degodia clan who have been having disputes with Garre community.

27 March. Police officers assault and injured a journalist covering the attempted deportation of Miguna Miguna, a prominent ODM/NRM attorney and opposition activist. The assault took place at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport.
26 March. A woman is attacked and injured in an attack over land control. The attack took place in Osure Legio village in Ndhiwa, Homa Bay County.
24 March. Cattle herders killed 10 in Lopurio area in Samburu North in communal violence.
27 February. A human rights defender was shot and killed by police in Meru by police.

'One INGO male staff member needed medical attention after he was shot twice by armed perpetrators who ambushed the organization's vehicle. The staff members (five in total but only one was wounded) were in the vicinity of Darer Dima and traveling from Malkadaka to Garbatulla when they were attacked. Nothing was stolen from the passengers. While it was reported that the aid workers did not appear to be targeted specifically for their affiliation to an aid organization and that there has been an increase in insecurity in greater Isiolo county, it should also be noted that the vehicle was clearly marked.'

A man who was killed had his eyes gouged out while a pregnant woman is shot and her body mutilated at Malkagufu area. The attack is believed to be related to clashes between Degodia and Arjuran groups since December. It is not clear who the victim/perpetrator is in this instance. The attack occurred on or before 20/02.
Four members of the Nyumba Kumi initiative were shot, hacked and decapitated by unidentified armed group in Saria, Cheptais sub-county. The reason for the attack is not known.
Al Shabaab fighters attack Qarsa Primary School in Wajir. Three teachers killed, one injured. Assailants escaped.
15/02, PM Wajir: Al Shabaab attack a school killing 3 teachers.
Two inmates at Nyeri Prison, King'ong'o, were shot and injured by a senior prison warder in unclear circumstances. Prison staff claimed 'accident.'
A United States conservationist and ivory trade investigator, Esmond Bradley Martin, was found dead in his house in Nairobi under suspicious circumstances.

More than 2,000 people fled their homes on the West Pokot-Elgeyo Marakwet border after 'bandits' burned at least 70 houses.The houses were torched in a retaliatory attack. The group stormed in, injured four people and stole an unknown number of livestock.

Evictions of local indigenous people led to the killing of a member of the local Sengwer community by Kenya Forest Service (KFS) rangers. Regarded as squatters by government, the Sengwer people have resisted efforts to move them from the Embobut Forest, which they see as ancestral lands.
Armed groups killed a woman and injured five police officers at Nyongoro along the Lamu-Malindi road
On 12 January 2018, a woman was burnt to death while her husband was shot and injured when gunmen invaded their home in Nyamira County on Friday night.

Reports from Lamu Island say a deadly attack was carried out in parts of the island. The attack was a well-planned ambush targeting a vehicle carrying 'Kenyan crusaders' travelling on the road that connects Mwitu and Gamba villages in Lamu county. Al-Shabab forces, who are waging jihad in Lamu, captured the vehicle and two Kenyan infidels, who are among those settled in the Muslim land of Lamu.

A suspected 'terrorist' was shot dead by police in Likoni area of Mombasa. According to area police Chief Benjamin Rotich, the suspect was cornered during a raid at his house at about 3 am. The report did not specify whether the man was armed.
Members of the Sabaot Land Defence Force (SLDF) attacked the villages of Masaek and Kutere in Kopsiro Division in the troubled Chepyuk Settlement Scheme, leaving five people killed.

On 19 November 2017, eleven people were allegedly killed in Baba Dogo, Nairobi. Local residents blamed the killing of at least five people on Mungiki. Raila Odinga accused the government of orchestrating the attacks.

assoc_actor_2: Luo Ethnic Group (Kenya); NASA: National Super Alliance
notes: 5 people in Ruaraka were shot dead by unidentified attackers during the night. Odinga says that they were targeted because they were Luos and NASA supporters.
A NASA supporter was killed in Kibera.
Unidentified attackers shot at a bus that was travelling from Merti to Isiolo, killing 8 passengers.
2 people were killed by police reservists in Basargeisa, in Bura.

Three women in Kitui were allegedly tortured by police on claims of insulting a local church leader. Mrs Hellen Kyalo, Ms Janet Mwikali and Mrs Kathini Mwema from Syongila Village in Kitui Central on Friday said the officers inflicted serious injuries on their behind, thighs and legs.
Al Shabaab militants attacked a land cruiser in Arabia. They stole the land cruiser and shot at the passengers. 2 passengers were injured.
Al Shabaab militants hijacked a car and abducted a driver between Fino and Sheikh Barrow. He is alive, but being held in Somalia.
A Land Cruiser carrying five passengers was attacked by Al Shabaab militants at Arabia area. The driver was released and two passengers suffered gunshot wounds but they were in stable condition.
One man was found dead in a sugar cane plantation one day after ethnic tensions between the Luo and Kalenjin communities got into an ethnic clash. The body had been hacked with a panga.
3 police officers mistaken for protesters were beaten on Saturday afternoon by other police forces in Majengo Town during ongoing demonstrations.

Police raided houses of civilians in Kisumu, beating civilians and injuring dozens. Live bullets were used on some civilians, including a 14 year old boy. Of the 29 people injured, 26 had suffered gun shots.
In Migori the police stormed residential estates, where they fired teargas into homes, beat people, and raped women. 1 man was killed when he was shot in the head.
One man was stabbed in the neck in Likoni, Mombasa. It is not yet certain whether he was attacked on the way to vote.
Armed militants (bandits) attacked a community in Laikumuku, in Tigania East. They stole 100 cattle and killed 2 people.

The bodyguard of the Deputy Chief Justice Philomena Mwilu was shot in the shoulder while buying flowers by an armed man/group (unknown). This adds to the tension felt before the presidential election that will take place this week. Because of this, the Deputy Chief did not attend the meeting of the next day where the postponement of the presidentials elections was to take place.
A group of armed men killed 2 people in the Laikumukumu area, Tigania East District, and stole over 1000 cattle.
A catholic priest was assassinated near Chiga Market, in Muhoroni.
A police operation left the son of a business owner shot dead in Nairobi. The police officers had an armoured car and the reasons for the shooting are not yet clear.

Police forces attacked supporters of the opposition that went to the Lucky Summer neighbourhood to check on a ritual of beheading of a sheep that was taking place (suspectedly by the Mungiki sect). The police shot at the civilians. The police confirmed that it shot a man and that the group performing the ritual had sought protection.
The police went from house to house beating people in Ukunda.
Five people were injured when suspected al-Shabab militants sprayed their vehicle with bullets between Bodhei and Ijara, on the border of Lamu and Garissa counties.
Five people are nursing multiple gunshot wounds after their vehicle was shot at by suspected al Shabaab militants
A two-year was shot in the neck whilst playing in Nyamasaria, Kisumu County on 16 October. It is thought the bullet came from police who were engaging protesters in Lower Manyatta.
On 14 October 2017, six people were killed in an attack by suspected South Sudanese raiders on a boarding school in Lokichogio.
On 13 October 2017, several nursery school children were hospitalised after police fired tear gas into the Mt Carmel Academy in the Nyalenda slum.
On 10 October 2017, gunmen killed two female employees of a university in Ukunda, in a suspected extremist attack.
Five Kisumu journalists were harassed, beaten and injured by police while covering the anti-IEBC demos Monday.
On 2 October 2017, police reportedly used tear gas in a nursery in Nyalenda, injuring at least three children.
2 people were killed and 1 person was injured in an attack on Ol Ari Nyiro Nature Conservancy.
A Maasai businessman was shot dead and a young boy was wounded in an incident in Esoit, in Trans Mara. Maasai villagers believe that he was killed by Kipsigi militia.
6 people were injured when unidentified attackers wielding machetes attacked people in Bumula village, in Bungoma.

5 Pokot men were allegedly shot by police officers deployed to flush out bandits who have wreaked havoc in Baringo and Laikipia counties. It is alleged the five were among suspected Pokot bandits behind frequent attacks targeting Tugens, Ilchamus and Marakwets.
Three people have been killed and eight others seriously injured in a banditry attack in Baragoi town, Samburu County
Armed raiders killed 2 students and injured 1 man when they attacked a commmunity in Marakwet East.
A man in Kaptet, in Marakwet East, was shot dead by an armed group from a neighbouring village.
Four people were killed by suspected Al Shabaab militia in Lamu county. Police have launched an investigation.
Four people were killed by suspected Al Shabaab militia in two villages in the Hindi area in Lamu county. Police have launched an investigation.

Al Shabaab militants ambushed a vehicle travelling from Garsen to Lamu. The vehicle drove over an IED and was then shot at by the militants. 2 people were killed. 50m away, a few hours later, the same Al Shabaab militants fired at a truck, killing 1 person. They also destroyed a nearby electricity pylon.
A soldier opened fire on 2 schoolboys in Rumuruti, killing 1 and injuring the other.
A policeman has been apprehended after shooting dead Mwenda Itaeba, a Jubilee politian who had recently lost a primary election.
Four bodies have been pulled up from a Kisumu beach. The victims were likely killed during the post-electoral violence, it is uncertain as to who killed them.
Two foreigners of Caucasian origin found dead, bodies dumped by roadside in Mombasa, reasons unknown.

assoc_actor_2: IEBC: Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission; Women (Kenya)
notes: An IEBC official, Caroline Odiga, was killed and her body was dumped in the bushes near a market.  [women targeted: government officials]
At least three people were killed on Friday by Al Shabaab militants in Witu Lamu County. The Star reports 4 dead.
Al Shabaab militants attacked Maleli village, near Witu town. They burned down houses and killed 4 people.
Women from Boni were abducted and held by Al Shabaab militants in a camp, where they were gang-raped and mistreated.
A nine-year-old was allegedly shot by police while on the third floor balcony of a three-storey building in Nairobi's Mathare North Area 2 on August 13.

Police shoot dead a construction worker as he steps outside of his house. There were no protests taking place where he was shot. It is also alleged that police purposely shot at people looking at the riots from their buildings, resulting in the death of a child.

The police conducted a sweeping search for opposition supporters in Nyalenda, Kisumu. They forced their way into homes to beat people. In one home they beat a six-month old baby. She died the following day. At least 10 people were killed in the searches over 2 days (split between 2 events)

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: GSU Police kill two civilians in house-to-house searches in Mathare.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: Police clash with violent demonstrators on August 10 and 11 and with a smaller group of protestors on August 12. At least two people were killed in circumstances that appear to be unlawful killings, and dozens were shot and injured. One man was killed on the 10th and another was a non-protesting civilian who was beaten to death by the GSU on 11 Aug.

During house to house searches in the village of Dago, 25km north of Kisumu, a police officer shot and killed a 21-year-old who was working with Elections Observations Group (ELOG), a Kenyan organization that has observed the past two elections.
In Kisumu's Nyamasaria , police shot dead a young man by a petrol station. No mention whether the man was protesting.
ODM Kisii Central ward candidate was kidnapped by an unidentified group on Wednesday and reportedly beaten up and his posssions stolen by the unidentified group. He was released soon after.
Police fired tear gas and shot dead a man who was trying to separate to rival supporters from fighting outside Nduru Girls' Secondary School, a tallying centre in South Mugirango constituency.

Five unidentified attackers armed with knives attacked a polling station where elections results were being tallied in Hola town, stabbing one person. Police intervened, shooting dead two of the assailants. The three others escaped.
Suspected Al Shabaab militants hijacked 2 cars carrying voters between Omar Jillo and Lafey.
A police officer attempts to assassinate an election officer in Elgeyo on 08 Aug.
Police officers in Kangemi flogged voters who were not forming straight lines.
The ODM MP candidate and his wife were attacked by unidentified political activists while they were campaigning near Rongo, in Kanyamkago. They have been hospitalised.
Three people were killed and four injured after a passenger bus was ambushed by Al Shabaab.

The bodies of the Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission ICT Manager, Chris Msando, and another youth were found stripped of clothing in a thicket in Kiambu County and were transported to the City Mortuary on Saturday at 11 am by Kikuyu Police Station officers. IEBC denounced the attack as an attack against democracy, considering the victim's role in ensuring credible elections in Kenya.

assoc_actor_2: IEBC: Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission
notes: The IEBC ICT manager, Chris Msando, disappeared from his office in Nairobi. His body and the body of a woman were found the next day on the outskirts of Nairobi. It is believed that Msando was murdered for political reasons.
Al Shabaab militants hijacked a car painted in Jubilee campaign colours in Falana, near Mandera. The driver and a passenger were kidnapped.
The home of the political adviser to the governor of Siaya was petrol bombed by unidentified attackers. His car was destroyed. He was rescued by neighbours. No injuries reported.
A police officer shot and injured a woman outside the KICC in Nairobi
Pokot bandits suspected to be from Tiaty, Baringo East raided Murkutwo in Marakwet East on Saturday, injuring two herders.
Pokot bandits suspected to be from Tiaty, Baringo East raided Murkutwo in Marakwet East on Saturday, injuring two herders. A similar attack took place at Kaben area, which killed one man.
Three people were shot dead and two others injured during an attack at Bendera village in Baragoi town, Samburu County. An unknown number of cattle were also stolen and driven towards Suguta valley

Unknown gunmen on Thursday night shot dead a businessman in Chebukwabi village, Kimilili constituency, in Bungoma County. Robert Barasa, a known campaigner for Bungoma Governor Ken Lusaka, was shot dead by armed men in his home.
Al Shabaab kill two civilians while attacking civilians in the Mararani area.
A Baringo chief who went missing on Tuesday was found dead in a bush at Olmoran range in Laikipia county, the following day, shot.
Three people were killed and several were injured including Public Works Principal Secretary Mariam El Maawy, during an ambush by Al Shabaab attack in Lamu West.
Pokot raiders attacked herdsmen who were repairing an electric fence at Laikipia Natre Conservancy

Jared Ratemo, a lawyer attached to the Kenya Revenue Authority, was found killed on Mombassa road on the morning of 12/07. The date of death may have been the previous day, as it was then he went missing. He may have been killed because of some sensitive investigations he was carrying out at KRA.
About 1,000 people were displaced in Igembe Central, 13 people killed and three people injured following clashes along the Meru-Isiolo boundary on Monday.
Meru inhabitants stabbed 3 Isiolo inhabitants to death at Kiutine market as part of the ongoing Meru-Isiolo border conflict.
In retaliation for the killing of a herder the previous day, a group of herders killed 2 men.
4 Meru youths were attacked and killed by Isiolo inhabitants as they transported milk on the Maua-Garbayulla road as part of the ongoing Isiolo-Meru border conflict.
In Tigania East a herdsman was attacked and killed by cattle rustlers.

At least nine people were killed in Lamu County on Saturday morning, in an attack by Al Shabaab. The attack occurred at Jima and Pandaguo villages near the border with Somalia. At Jima, Al Shabaab beheaded four men (coded in other event).
At least nine people were killed in Lamu County on Saturday morning, in an attack by Al Shabaab. The attack occurred at Jima and Pandaguo village near the border with Somalia
Four men have been beheaded by Al Shabaab at Jima area bordering Pandanguo in Lamu county. Kenya Standard reports 9 people were beheaded and the event took place on the previous day.

Herders in Bambo, Mandera, have discovered five bodies buried in a shallow grave.The five, four men and a woman, were reported missing by their relatives last week.The locals exhumed the bodies on Monday [3 July] morning and took them to Lafey Hospital.Medical personnel at the hospital told Nation.co.ke that a male body had bullet wounds in the forehead and the other bodies appeared to have been strangled.The five were from Fino Ward but their bodies were found in Warankara Ward about 65 kilometres away.

Herders in Bambo, Mandera, have discovered five bodies buried in a shallow grave.The locals exhumed the bodies on Monday [3 July] morning and took them to Lafey Hospital.Medical personnel at the hospital told Nation.co.ke that a male body had bullet wounds in the forehead and the other bodies appeared to have been strangled.The five were from Fino Ward but their bodies were found in Warankara Ward about 65 kilometres away.
Youths suspected to be part of the outlawed Mungiki militia kill a butcher and torch houses in Embakasi. The attack was believed to be over a land dispute.

The county commander said several people have been arrested in connection with an attack on a lorry carrying camels along Laisamis Road. One person was killed. The attackers transferred the animals to another truck and drove off.

A 12 year old boy was beheaded by raiders on Sunday morning in Saku constituency. Another person was seriously injured during the attack. The attack is suspected to be linked to recent violence between the Rendille and Borana communities.
A secondary school student was shot dead by suspected Pokot cattle rustlers in Kaben, Marakwet East at 8am.
Five people were killed when Al Shabaab attacked the Equity bank In Elwak Town.
One criminal was shot dead by police officers at Hongera in Kisauni, Mombasa County.
One person has been killed and about 500 cattle stolen by suspected bandits along the West Pokot-Turkana border. Thsi is believed to be part of a dispute between Pokot and Turkana communities.
A Boda Boda rider was killed by unidentified assailants over the management of campaign money for a local politician.
In Marakwet East, a man was shot dead on Tuesday afternoon by suspected Pokot bandits.
Six people were killed and several others injured after armed Pokot bandits attacked Lokori in Turkana South on Saturday.
A journalist was attacked by a politician's bodyguards.

Unknown gunmen shot dead one person and injured another in Mandera country near the Somalia border. The attackers targeted the vehicle belonging to a local political aspirant Mohamed Abdi who was not in the convoy of the two cars headed to El Wak town.
Al-Shabaab militants burned down a school and abducted two teachers in an overnight attack in Fafi, Garissa. One teacher is killed.
Three Al-Shabaab militants shot dead a Tana River County Assembly driver on Friday
A man was shot dead by a gang in Mai Mahiu on 26/05/2017. The police has yet to establish the motive of the killing.

Land invaders suspected to be from Baringo County attacked residents on 23 May at Rubere in Laikipia West. The 'bandits' paralysed a security meeting by shooting in the air, dispersing the residents and security officers. Several residents were injured as they scampered for safety.

assoc_actor_2: FORD-Kenya: Forum for the Restoration of Democracy-Kenya
notes: In Bungoma, a campaigner of governor challenger Wycliffe Wangamati was seriously injured in an attack in Webuye. Mr Joseph Kubende was driving to his home on Friday night when his car was blocked by a Probox whose occupants pulled him out and hit him with a blunt object on the head.

One person has been shot dead in Kerio Valley by cattle rustlers. The rustlers also stole over 40 goats and cattle during the Thursday afternoon attack.They also killed two goats. Elgeyo Marakwet Police Commander Tom Odera said efforts to apprehend the culprits are ongoing.

The Churo/Amaya ward MCA, Thomas Minito, was reportedly approached by three people at a hotel in Kabarnet town on Tuesday afternoon when he was having lunch with a government official from Tiaty. His body was on Thursday evening found floating in River Athi just under the Donyo Sabuk bridge in Machakos County Reports indicate that the body was retrieved and a small poster found in his coat pocket bearing his name.

Nation correspondent Shaban Makokha was assaulted by administration police officers at Shianda Trading Centre while photographing youths fighting over money given to them by a politician. The journalist was treated at St Mary's Mission Hospital in Mumias and discharged.

A security operation is underway in Mandera town [northeastern Kenya] after a chief said to be instrumental in the war against terror was gunned down by people believed to be al-Shabab militia. The heavily armed al-Shabab militants are said to have raided the home of the chief in Omar Jillo location, Lafey sub-county in Mandera East before killing him on the spot. The military and the police have teamed up in an operation to comb Mandera in search of the assailants
The local MCA was abducted by unidentified attackers. The police did not file a report. His body was found five days later.

An Orange Democratic Movement (ODM) party director of communications Philip Etale was attacked with pepper spray by an unknown group in Nairobi's city centre. He was rushed to Nairobi hospital, where he was treated and discharged later
Suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a village in Mandera and killed a chief before abducting two police reservists on Monday night.

Two more people have been killed in fresh attacks by bandits at Kasiluni in Kitui County [eastern Kenya], a week after a similar attack in the same area. The two were ambushed separately and shot in their farms on Sunday [14 May] in the volatile area, which borders Mwingi Game Reserve, bringing the number of people killed in the last week to four.

Member of County Assembly aspirant's three sons were found dead. The second was discovered on Wednesday, retrieved the same day and taken to the same hospital mortuary in the evening. The third was found on 18/05. The trio were missing since at least 14/05, when they failed to arrive at a church service. The children's disappearance may be related to politics.
Two quarry workers were shot dead Friday and one was missing in a suspected extremist attack in Kenya's northern county of Mandera, a government official said.

Aspiring Woman Representative Esther Passaris (ODM) was held hostage for several hours by 'goons' at University of Nairobi. The attackers were known to be led by a student who was a member of the local County Assembly (political affiliation not known) and demanded a large amount of money for release. The attackers were said to have attacked the candidate, her bodyguards and threatened to burn cars. The leader of the attackers was later arrested and the candidate was freed. [women targeted: candidates for office]
Two people are shot and killed by raids on their farms by unidentified communal gunmen
Dan Ocholla, a journalist at The Standard, was attacked and seriously injured by Kakamega County soldiers while taking photos of injured workers at a construction site in the town.

Cattle rustlers raided the village of Ngaratuko on 06/05/2017. They shot dead two people and stole goats. Due to the recent attacks, many schools are closed and hundreds of locals are fleeing now to safer places.
Al Shabaab militants attacked El Wak town. 2 people were killed.
Gunmen killed five civilians from Pokot and injured another 3 at Kapedo trading centre. This is believed to be a revenge attack.
An Mbita candidate was assaulted in Langata at T-Mall. Police have accused political activist Brian Weke, along with a group of 10 men, of assaulting and attempting to kidnap him.
Morans allegedly raided Kamunge village in the neighbouring Turkana County, killed one person and made away with an unknown number of livestock on Thursday last week.

A house belonging to Mbita MP Millie Odhiambo was set ablaze on Wednesday as protests erupted in Homa Bay over the ODM party nominations. Ms Odhiambo's home in Koyani village in Lambwe was burnt as residents protested after she was announced winner in the Mbita Constituency ODM nominations. No casualties were reported. [women targeted: politicians]

Gunmen have seriously wounded 73-year-old conservationist Kuki Gallmann at her conservation park in the latest of a string of attacks during land invasions in drought-stricken northern Kenya. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]
Scores are injured when unidentified armed youths launch a coordinated attack on a ODM meeting in Rongo.
A man is killed by land invaders near Laikipia Nature Conversatory
Three are injured when they are attacked by unidentified perpetrators during the night-time hours. The attack may be related to an election on 24/04. Date of attack not known - source dated 21/04.
The aspiring ODM Naivasha candidate was arrested and held, and then admitted to hospital.
A Jubilee MP was shot at while he was campaigning in Nairobi. He has been hospitalised.
Sheila Githaiga, who is running for senate in Kieni, was ambushed and beaten by 30 men wielding batons and machetes. [women targeted: candidates for office]

Residents claim that in the last two months 10 people have been killed (4 in March, 6 in April) in raids on several villages in Lamu and Tana River counties. Though mainly related to cattle theft, a resident believes 'some politicians were behind the raids.'

Residents claim that in the last two months 10 people have been killed (4 in March, 6 in April) in raids on several villages in Lamu and Tana River counties. Though mainly related to cattle theft, a resident believes 'some politicians were behind the raids.'
A father of four is killed by 200 'land invaders' that villagers claim had been invading land claiming they were squatters, only to later sell it to private developers.
Two suspected Islamist militants are killed in an extra-judicial killing by unidentified assailants in Naivasha. Both were suspected of recruiting and funding 'terror' activities.
A female Jubilee aspirant who is running for Tetu parliamentary seat, is attacked by four masked men armed with metal bars and a gun at Mbaaini village. [women targeted: candidates for office]
Gabra militia kills five Borana herders at Kubi Kalo; one on 11/04, four on 12/04.
Gabra militia kills five Borana herders at Kubi Kalo; one on 11/04, four on 12/04.
In a crackdown on 'banditry', police set fire to a Pokot village. An infant dies during the raid.
Raiders kill one person in Pokot north during a peace meeting
4 people are killed by herders in Nakwomuru village in central Pokot county. Police reservists engage with the raiders, killing three of them.
Video released on socia media shows a police kill an unarmed man in Eastleigh on 31/03/2017. The victim was suspected of killing two police officers last month.
A young boy is killed by armed raiders involved in a boundary dispute. It is not known in the victim was specifically targeted. Exact date not clear - source dated 28/03.
A boda boda driver on the Jubilee campaign was stabbed to death by a fellow campaigner over campaign payments. Attacker assumed to be Jubilee.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: An unidentified middle aged man who accessed a restricted area of the state house was shot by GSU.

Attackers believed to be from the Bahgere clan from Wajir South attacked Fadiwein village, which is inhabited by Auliyan community, injuring one. Eleven houses were also burnt and the attackers made away with 300 goats and five camels. The two communities had been fighting over a disputed boundary with the Bahgere, claiming the area falls under Wajir South, while Auliyan says it is in Garissa county.

Following an alleged murder of a woman over a land dispute on 12/03/2017, villagers and the victim's family members attacked the houses of the suspects on 24/03/2017 in Riabotenene. Seven houses were burnt and their occupants were chased away. No fatalities.

The mother of Pastor Pius Muiru was found dead on 23/03/2017 in her farm in Karika village in Muranga. Police suspect that she was kidnapped and subsequently killed. Her son is the founder of an evangelical church and was the presidential candidate in 2007 for Kenya People's Party. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]
Police assault and arrest a journalist in Usengi. The scribe was targeted for investigating the use of excessive force by the officers who have been recently harming and harassing residents.
Ten people were killed and four injured in a cattle raid in Marti, Samburu, on 22/03/2017. It is believed to be a retaliatory attack run by thieves of a neighbouring community.
Police officers 'torture' a youth for unknown reason. A protest against the act followed.
A NASA political aspirant was reportedly shot dead on 20/3. Location not known - party headquarters in Nairobi.

Residents claim that in the last two months 10 people have been killed (4 in March, 6 in April) in raids on several villages in Lamu and Tana River counties. Though mainly related to cattle theft, a resident believes 'some politicians were behind the raids.'

Residents claim that in the last two months 10 people have been killed (4 in March, 6 in April) in raids on several villages in Lamu and Tana River counties. Though mainly related to cattle theft, a resident believes 'some politicians were behind the raids.'

In a continuance of ethnic violence, two Pokot woman are killed by suspected Tugen-Ilchamus raiders, after an attack on a police vehicle. It is not clear if the Pokot women were affiliated with the police, or if the police were simply caught in crossfire. In retaliation, Pokot militias soon after attacked Mukutan market, killing five women and four children and looting shops and homes. Other were reported injured.

In a continuance of ethnic violence, two Pokot woman are killed by suspected Tugen-Ilchamus raiders, after an attack on a police vehicle. It is not clear if the Pokot women were affiliated with the police, or if the police were simply caught in crossfire. In retaliation, Pokot militias soon after attacked Mukutan market, killing five women and four children and looting shops and homes. Other were reported injured.

Auliyan militia attacked Duse centre in Isiolo County in a retaliatory attack following their expulsion for the area by government forces weeks prior. Five killed, six injured. Two of the attackers were shot and killed by police.
Auliyan militia attacked Garba Tula, killing a 70-year old man. The attack is believed to be related to revenge after being forces off land.

Armed raiders invading a ranch shot dead a Briton in northern Kenya's Laikipia County on the evening of 05/03. The victim was shot dead after he went to inspect the remains of a friend's home that had been burnt down by raiders on 03/03. Related, on 04/03, a police helicopter was shot at in the same farm as security officers carried out aerial surveillance. A second source claims the attack took place on 6 March.
Unidentified gunmen kidnapped three teachers from Dadaab camp. Al Shabaab have carried out abductions in the past, though it is not clear who the perpetrators were in this instance.
Three are attacked and killed with blunt objects in Garissa on the night of 22/02. Perpetrators not known.
On 22 February 2017, one person was shot dead in Loruk by Pokot militants as 400 residents fled after their homes were set on fire.

On 22 February 2017, police found the bodies of four men in a vehicle in Gitaru. Police said they appeared to have been strangled to death and had visible injuries in their necks and faces. The reason for their deaths was not established.
On 22 February 2017, a teacher was killed by Pokot militants in Chepkesin in Baringo North.
Two more people were killed in Baringo county in attacks by armed Pokot militants. Specific details not provided.
On 19 February 2017, Pokot militants killed a young mother and her three-year old child at Natan in Baringo North. Another source reported that the attack took place on 21 February.
On 18 February 2017, two local leaders, MCA Kibet Cheretei and a Jubilee MP hopeful Pepe Kitambaa were shot dead by Pokot militants at a bar in Marigat town.

On 17 February 2017, four people were seriously injured after suspected Pokot assailants attacked a bus carrying former Inspector General David Kimaiyo's relatives. The attack occurred on the Chesongoch-Liter road, near Tot trading centre.
On 8 February 2017, an 82-year-old man who is the uncle of Kapseret MP was shot dead by heavily armed militants who raided his home in Kerio Valley.

On 8 February 2017, a 43-year-old man was hacked to death in a dispute between two factions of a family over land in Kinangop, Nyandarua county. Four attackers, armed with pangas attacked the family home.

On 3 February 2017, Eunice Wambui (aka Nyasuguta from Vitimbi), an actress who has been campaigning to become the MP for Embakasi South, was beaten with wooden rods by four political goons in Mukuru Kwa Ruben. [women targeted: candidates for office]
On 21 January 2017, suspected Somali militia shot dead a herder in Ukasi, Kitui county.
On 2 January 2017, Somali militants shot dead two herders in Inyanzae.
A Kipsigis man is dead and others are injured following an attack from suspected Maasai militia at Esoit, Junction and Kirindon in Trans Mara West. Similar violence had occurred in recent weeks.

One person was killed on the night of 26/12 while three others sustained serious injuries following an attack by suspected Pokot militia in Chesongoch, Kerio Valley. A similar attack occurred earlier in the week.
On 24 December 2016, Somali militants who have encroached Kitui county and posing as herders, gunned down a man in Katangini.
At least two people were killed and some others injured by suspected al-Shabaab who vandalized a communication mast in the Tarbaj area near the border with Somalia.
A Kipsigis is killed by people believed to be from the Maasai community outside Kilgoris at Esoit trading centre. The attack led to retaliation from Kipsigs militia.
Members of a Kipsigs militia attack and kill two Maasai in retaliation for earlier violence.

Pokot raiders attack and kill a crossing guard during in Liter village and two others in neighbouring Endo Location, both in the Kerio valley the early morning hours. The attacks led to ethnic tension in the area.
Members of the Kabsiren clan attacked and killed two of their Kapshoi counterparts accusing them of 'harbouring their enemies' from the Pokot community.
Three journalists were reported assaulted by 'county officials' at Nyakongo school, Nyamira County.

Unidentified gunmen open fire on a group of students sitting for examination in Wajir. The gunmen later exchanged fire with police with were guarding the institution. Motive not known. No reported deaths.
Al Shabaab attacked Haluqa, outside of Garissa, targeting a Safaricom building. The attackers abducted several workers and took them into Somalia.
Two children sustained gunshot injuries on Tuesday night when a lone gunman attacked the home of ODM candidate Josphat Ekeno ahead of a by-election.
A farmer is attacked and killed over land in the Kosovo area of Naivasha.
On 9 October 2016, a man was attacked by a police officer in Baragoi, Sumburu. He had been pelted with stones.
A cross-border al Shabaab attack kills six in Mandera. The attackers targeted 'non-locals' and/or 'Christians.'
A Borana man is attacked and killed by Somali herders in Garfasa, Isiolo County. The attack is believed to be retaliatory.

On 7 September 2016, unidentified assailants forced themselves into the house of photojournalist Denis Otieno in the town of Kitale, Rift Valley, and demanded photos in his camera before shooting him dead.
A man from Pimbinyiet sub location is discovered murdered by suspected rival-neighbours.
Man found killed, throat slit and body dumped in rice farm in Thiba. Perpetrators not known but locals blame terror gangs.

A man was shot dead while another injured on Wednesday night when gunmen laid an ambush at Pimbinyiet at the border of Trans Mara East and Trans Mara West Sub-Counties. The identities of the attackers as well as their motive is unknown.
A woman was killed while three others were critically injured when suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen attacked a vehicle between Fino and Lafey at around 7pm on Saturday night.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills a civilian in their home in Mbuwani.

Six people were killed and scores injured when a bus plying the Mandera-Nairobi route was sprayed with bullets by heavily armed assailants between Wargadud and Elwak. Government sources believe the assailants may have been a local militia group, not al Shabaab, which was the initial suspicion.

23 June. A lawyer and a taxi driver who were involved in a court case over police misconduct were are detained by three police officers in Nairobi. Their bodies are found dead in the Ol-Donyo River days later.
A widow and a middle aged man were shot with arrows at Daraja Mbili and Songhor areas over a land issue. The attack is a carry over of hostilities which began on 18/06.
A widow and a middle aged man were shot with arrows at Daraja Mbili and Songhor areas over a land issue. The attack is a carry over of hostilities which began on 18/06.
Eight Kenyans have been kidnapped by the al-Shabab militants in the past month in the Alango and Kurokura (Mandera County) areas. Dates unknown, though the latest kidnapping took place on 10/07.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill an area chief in Kiambu during the evening hours.

Armed men believed to be members of Al-Shabaab have killed three people in Kwale in Kenyas coastal region. The Kenyan government said the people killed were elders. Reports say that masked armed men arrived at the coastal town and hounded the people out of their homes and killed them in an open field.

Three Nyumba Kumi officials were assassinated by gunmen in Diani, Kwale County [coast region] on Sunday [29 May]. The perpetrators are believed to be al Shabaab. The three were killed separately, each in their homes.
Businessman and prominent critic of the government Jacob Juma is shot dead by unknown gunmen in Nairobi. Nothing was stolen. The opposition has labelled his killing an assassination.
11 April. An unidentified armed group killed a civilian working in a trade union and ranch in Zimmerman, Nairobi. The killing is believed to have been in relation to the victims work on land rights.

Three people have been killed in a village in Baringo South Sub-County in an attack suspected to retaliatory following the killing of a man on Sunday. Suspected Ilchamus militants attacked Mbechot Village on Tuesday evening when residents were having a meeting with Sub-County Commissioner Felix Kisalu.
An Ilchamus man is killed by a communal militia (suspected Tugen militia) in Olesampurmpur village in Baringo South.
Al Shabaab attacks Pandanguo village, targeting the homes of Christians. Al Shabaab claimed 'many' killed, though more reliable reports indicate three dead, plus injuries.

Five men were admitted to hospital after they were attacked by a gang of armed men in Silaloni, Samburu Sub-County, in Kwale. The camel keepers were attacked by men armed with pangas, bows and arrows as well as other crude weapons on the morning of 02/01. The reason for attack is not known.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills bus two travellers and wounds three others south of Mandera between Kotulo and Daba (Another report indicate the attacks occurred near El Wak) in Mandera County on 21/12.
An AP police officer opens fire indiscriminately on people in Hulugho on 06/12, injuring one. Authorities are attempting to ascertain if the attack was al Shabaab related.
Al Shabaab kidnaps a teacher at a refugee camp Hagadera. The victim was rescued four days later.
Three bodies with bullet wounds were found in Tagwa Forest, Kieni East sub county, Nyeri county. Perpetrators, motive and time of attack not known.
Turkana militia attack a Pokot camp in Narengmor, killing three in revenge of cattle theft.
A teacher is kidnapped by suspected al Shabaab in Hagadera refugee camp. The teacher was later rescued by Kenyan forces across the border into Somalia.
Turkana attackers kill five in a suspected cattle rustling operation. The attack caused tension in the area.
'One national INGO staff member got a gunshot wound to the leg and was taken to the hospital to receive medical attention.'

Around 15 July 2015 (month of), police officers in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) beat up a gay man and his three roommates to extract confessions that they were gay. The police was called by one of the men after a mob threatened to burst into his apartment.

Armed men attacked a passenger bus on 07/07 at Mpekatoni border town. There were no immediate reports of any casualties. Police later report the attack was not carried out by al Shabaab, but rather an unidentified group of locals.
A senior, off-duty National Intelligence Service officer is shot and killed on 03/07 by two unidentified assailants in Mombasa.
Nine are killed and six others injured on 01/07 following an attack by members of the Marhani clan of Somalia on Arabia.
One person was killed and two others injured in an attack by suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen in Mandera Town on the night of 26/06. All of the victims are 'non-locals,' origin not known.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a chief of Erib location in Wajir on 20/06.

20 people are killed in Durogo [phonetic] in Mandera County in what has been described as revenge attacks by Garre [clan] fighters following the killings of their clansmen. Perpetrators are not known. Date unclear - source dated 17/06.

Five pastoralists are killed by unidentified gunmen at Wari walo village some 10 kilometres from Kenya border. Those killed were three children (two boys and a girl), their father and a close relative. The five had recently left Elmole in pursuit of pasture and water for their animals.

Suspected al Shabaab opened fire at a residential area of Wajir on 06/06, killing three persons. Officials and residents said the attackers were believed to have been seeking to kill a local administrator who lives close to the scene of the attack and is known to be on an al Shabaab 'wanted' list for speaking out against the sects activities in the region.

Two non-local residents of Marsabit are killed in mysterious circumstances by unidentified assailants. Non-locals claim that they are being targeted in assassinations by police. The police deny the allegations.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill an off-duty police officer of the anti-radicalisation squad at close range in Kibokoni, outside of Mombasa.

Turkana raiders attack a Pokot village close to Nadome along the Turkana-East Pokot district border, killing 18 residents. Following the attack a Pokot militia assembled, chasing the attackers to nearby Kogh-Tuw village and killing 36.

At least fifteen people are feared dead in fresh attack among rival villages or groups in Baragoi, Samburu County. Eight people were reportedly killed during a raid at Lomirok early Sunday morning (03/05). Unconfirmed reports indicate that another six, among them women and children, were killed at Sarma along the Samburu-Marsabit border that evening.
April 30, 2015, unidentified assailants repeatedly hit the editor of the Eldoret-based Mirror Weekly, with blunt objects and killed him.
Suspected Somali Al-Shabaab kidnapped two Kenyan teachers on the evening of 24/04 in the Mandera border town.

Heavily armed gunmen suspected to be members of Al-Shabaab on the morning of 23/04 kidnapped senior Arabia chief in Mandera County along the Mandera-Arabia road. The chief was driven across the border into Somalia where he was killed at Gadoon Dhowe, Beled Xawo District.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: On 17 April 2015, officers from Kenya's anti-riot police, the General Service Unit (GSU), beat and kicked Nation journalist Nehemiah Okwembah and Citizen television cameraman Rueben Ogachi at Bombi village on the outskirts of the government-owned Kulalu Galana Ranch in Tana River county
Pokot militia kill a goat herder in Chemoe.

The bodies of two men are discovered in Kamirithu village on the morning of 08/04. Their deaths may have occurred the evening before. The motive of the attack as well as their identifies of the victims are not known.

Al Shabaab gunmen attack Garissa University during the morning hours in an operation that lasted the majority of the day. Almost all of the 148 people killed were students and another 79 people were injured.

At least one person was killed and three others injured on the morning of 01/04 when masked gunmen attacked a non-governmental organisations compound at the Dadaab Refugee Camp. The attack occurred during the early morning hours, perpetrators not known.

A Standard newspaper journalist in Eldoret town said he was kidnapped outside his house on March 22, 2015 by people who questioned him about stories he had been writing about irregular land acquisitions by individuals in positions of influence. The journalist said he was threatened, drugged, and discovered unconscious two days later more than 40 kilometers away.
The Member of County Assembly for Korogocho was shot and killed during an attack in Ruaraka, Nairobi on the morning of 18/03. The motive for the attack is not known.
Al Shabaab carries out the second attack in two days in Mandera. One death, three injuries reported. In the following days the death total was raised from 1 to 4.

Three people were killed and eight more wounded when al Shabaab launched a cross-border raid on a convoy carrying Mandera county governor Ali Roba. The governor escaped unharmed. The convoy was travelling either to or from Nairobi.
Al Shabaab attack, and then later claim responsibility for the death of four in Wajir. Three other injured.

One person was killed and two others injured in an attack by suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen in Mandera Town on the night of 25/02. The victims were witnessed crossing from nearby Somalia at an earlier date and are suspected to be Somalis
On 18 February 2015, police in Kwale (Matuga, Kwale) arrested two men and threatened them with violence to extract confessions that they were gay. Doctors conducted forced anal examinations.

A prominent Kenyan MP of the Jubilee Coalition (George Muchai) was shot dead along with two bodyguards and a driver in the centre of Nairobi in the early hours of 07/02. The masked perpetrators, who were driving an automobile with Ugandan licence plates, escaped. A senior police officer said the killing looked like an execution-style hit.

Four killed and several injured during a Pokot raid on a Turkana village. Authorities claimed the attacks were meant to scare members of the Turkana community into leaving Lomelo, Silale and Nadome villages, which Pokots have laid claim.
Three unidentified gunmen shoot and kill an Imam at a construction site in Likoni. Investigators have not established a motive.

Pokot cattle rustlers struck Namawanga village inhabited by members of the Luhya community and shot dead a local farmer before stealing three bulls from his home. In revenge, Luhya tribesmen hacked to death a Pokot man who operates a motor cycle taxis after they found him ferrying two passengers to Karnyarkwat market. The killing of the man sparked off protest from members of the Pokot community who thronged to Kapkoi market vowing to revenge over the killing of their tribesmen.

Pokot cattle rustlers struck Namawanga village inhabited by members of the Luhya community and shot dead a local farmer before stealing three bulls from his home. In revenge, Luhya tribesmen hacked to death a Pokot man who operates a motor cycle taxis after they found him ferrying two passengers to Karnyarkwat market. The killing of the man sparked off protest from members of the Pokot community who thronged to Kapkoi market vowing to revenge over the killing of their tribesmen.
A burnt mans body is discovered at a coffee plantation near Kangaru in Engu. Perpetrators not known. The time of death may have been up to three days before its discovery on 03/01.
Two women are killed by unknown gunmen on Garissa.

A prominent cleric is kidnapped and later found dead (28/12). Perpetrators not known, though Muslim leaders blame police forces for his death. Further, it is not known if the kidnapping has any connection the killing of two women the same day elsewhere in the town.

Nandi militia attack the Luhya village of Kuvasali (Obasari) in a suspected revenge attack. The violence, which broke up at 9a.m. [0600 gmt] has seen over 20 houses burnt, animals killed and plantations torched by attackers. Many residents fled the area. Causalities not reported.
Al Shabaab lines and executes 15 non-Muslim farmers by firing squad in Mado Gashi.

At least 28 people were killed after suspected Al-Shabaab militants attacked a Nairobi-bound bus in Omar Jilo, Mandera County in north-east Kenya. Witness said the attackers ordered all off the bus, divided the passengers along ethnic lines - Somali and non-Somali, shooting all non-Somalis. Many of the deceased were teachers.

Four are killed in Kisauni by 'radical youth' on the evening of 17/11. Police suspect that the incident may have been a revenge attack for the killing of a youth at Masgid Shuhadaa during a raid on two Mosques in Kisauni the previous evening.
Police raid two Kisauni mosques during the evening hours, arrest 250  suspects. One death from the raids reported.
Around 15 November 2014 (month of), about five police officers in Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) gang raped a male sex worker in their car. The man was arrested and charged with nuisance and loitering.

Unidentified persons shoot and kill an al Shabaab suspect in the Majengo area. The suspect was driving with his wife and niece. The assailants are rumoured to be members of a Kenyan Anti-militant unit. The killing sparked a violent protest several days later.
An outspoken moderate Muslim cleric and al Shabaab critic was assassinated outside his mosque in Mombasa. Perpetrators remain unknown.

One person was hacked to death and four others seriously injured in a fresh attack in Bora Moyo village of Kipini. The violence began when a militia from Garjel community attacked the town when they believed its residents had stolen a herd of goats.

Five passengers in two Miraa [mild narcotic] vans from Lamu to Ijara town were during the morning hours hijacked by suspected al Shabaab militia, which was later confirmed. The incident took place between Milimani and Basuba area in Lamu East sub-county. The five were taken to an unknown location. Kenyan security forces launched a search mission in response.
Two men Degodia men looking for their lost donkeys were attacked by Garre militia at Bula Dawa, Rhamu sub county, one death, one injury. The two clans have a history of rivalry.
A man was shot dead at Lonyangelem village in West Pokot by suspected raiders from the neighbouring Turkana county.
Unidentified Somali assailants attack a kill a Garissa trader and injure two others in the early hours of the morning. Protests against this action continued throughout the day.
Degodia fighters attack and kill two members of the Garre clan in the Darkale area of Mandera County.

Eight people are feared dead after about 200 heavily armed Garre militia from Ethiopia carried out an attack on the Degodia-dominated town. The attackers, who were dressed in military fatigues raided Banisa in Guba Sub-Location and targeted shops, villages, a school and a dispensary. The two clans have been recently been clashing in the area.
Unidentified gunmen attack an ambulance near Mandera (Isaack Kora town), injuring the driver. The attack may be in relation to a nearby clash between Garre and Degodia clans.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills two, steals vehicles at Basuba location, Lamu East. Security forces later launched a security sweep of the area.

A khat driver is kidnapped by al Shabaab while three of his colleagues were attacked, robbed and released as they travelled in or near Bothai, possibly Kiunga. It was later learned the driver was beheaded sometime later.
Al-Shabaab fighters have reportedly kidnapped 22 people from North-eastern Kenyan district of Mandera. The perpetrators later released the group after taking their possessions.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a quarry worker before fleeing into Somalia. Authorities speculate the motive for the attack is related to the presence of Kenya troops in Somalia.
Suspected al Shabaab, numbering 5, killed a road construction worker in Mandera County before fleeing across the border into Somalia.
Two casual laborious were shot dead by unknown assailants, later suspected to al Shabaab in the outskirts of Garissa town on the evening of 13/08.
Two are shot and killed in Garba Gola by unidentified gunmen. The reason for the killing is not known, but it should be noted one of the victims was Somali.

A German tourist is killed and a Ugandan tourist is injured after their attackers assaulted them along Kuze Road in the Old Town area. Nothing appeared to be stolen from the two. The source makes mention of al Shabaab activity in the area, but makes no assumptions as to the responsible party.

Hooded gunmen killed two people at a bar in the Majengo area of Mombasa Monday night (July 21st) after they entered and began shooting randomly. Authorities believe a connection between this attack and the one in Likoni may be connected.

Three are killed (some sources claim four) and several other injured in an al Shabaab-linked shooting (later discover to be ODM) in the Likoni area in Mombasa. It was learned the shooting was retribution for an earlier raid on an al Shabaab location.

Six Turkana herders have been killed during the afternoon hours following an attack by Pokot raiders on a village in Kaakong area in Kainuk location, Turkana county. Three women are among seven other people injured in the ongoing attack by cattle rustlers from the neighbouring Pokot region. There has been repeated conflict along the Pokot - Turkana border as competition for resources and cattle rustling take centre stage.

Fresh attacks have been reported in Ras Kitua area in Lamu. Reports say gunmen raided villages in Manda Island, stole household goods and torched several houses before disappearing into Boni forest. Lamu County Commissioner Miiri Njenga says they are conducting aerial patrols to hunt down the attackers. Causalities not listed. The attack may have had occurred on 14/07.
Unidentified persons shoot and killed a prominent businessman near the airport. Though the killers remain unknown the source alludes to al Shabaab, as they have been active in the area lately.
Unidentified assailants attack Pandanguo location, no immediate reports of causalities.
At least 21 people have been killed in new attacks late in the day in Kenyas Lamu coastal region. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018) Liyu Police
notes: Suspected Liyu Police paramilitaries assassinate a ONLF sympathiser along Kismayo Road in Garissa.

Between 10 and 15 suspected al Shabaab assailants attack Witu. A witness said that the attackers shot their victims first, made sure they bled, before tying them up and making them lie on the ground facing down. They then proceeded to hack them. The attackers are said to have vowed that they were not going to leave until they eliminate all non-believers from the area. At least 11 dead. The attack may have occurred in Maleli. As a result of the attacks, many of the residents have fled the area.

Turkana raiders attack a Pokot village, steal cattle. Less than 24 hours Pokot raiders attack Mukutani village in Baringo South in retaliation, themselves stealing cattle. No reported death or injuries.

Turkana raiders attack a Pokot village, steal cattle. Less than 24 hours Pokot raiders attack Mukutani village in Baringo South in retaliation, themselves stealing cattle. No injuries reported at either site. Earlier in the week Turkana raiders struck at several locations in Tiati.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018) Liyu Police
notes: An ONLF sympathiser narrowly survives an assassination attempt from suspected Ethiopian Liyu Police paramilitary gunmen. Suspicious of three men that entered a cafe he was patronizing, the target grabbed one of his would-be assailants, using him as a human shield. The ONLF target was shot, along with his human shield, multiple times and taken to a hospital in Nairobi. The attack was an apparent retaliation for a ONLF launched attack on a man known as Sheikh Abdi Rashid.

Turkana raiders attack several locations in Tiati sub-county (Silale, Choken, Kapetareng, Ioangii, Nadome, Calvat, KangoIio , ApIdiny, Chepisya, Naratito, Konghituw, and Nakwiadicho), killing four and stealing cattle.

Turkana raiders attack several locations in Tiati sub-county (Silale, Choken, Kapetareng, Ioangii, Nadome, Calvat, KangoIio , ApIdiny, Chepisya, Naratito, Konghituw, and Nakwiadicho), killing four and stealing cattle.
Two Turkana children are shot dead by unidentified raiders in the early afternoon.

Somali al Shabaab carjack two police vans in Witu, drive to Mpekatoni where they began opening fire on people in the street. It was later learned the attackers singled out-non Muslims before they opened fire. Areas affected were Mpeketoni Police station, two hotels, a bank and a fuel station. One of the hotels was burnt down in the attack. It is not clear if police forces returned fire. Out of the 60 people reported missing after the Mpeketoni clashes 8 people are yet to be accounted for. At least 57 people died in the attack.

A prominent Muslim cleric is gunned down in his Mombasa home. His attackers stole nothing. The cleric had been publicly criticised for not supporting Jihad teaching and being a government sympathiser.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018) Liyu Police
assoc_actor_2: UWSLF: United Western Somali Liberation Front
notes: A prominent Muslim religious leader and UWSLF leader was shot dead by suspected Ethiopian Liyu Police paramilitaries in Garissa [north-eastern Kenya] town on Sunday [1 June] night just 24 hours after one person was killed and three others seriously injured. The motive for the killing is believed to be related to the victims support of the Ogaden separatist government in Ethiopia and the ONLF. The victim had previously survived an assassination in 2012.

An Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission (IEBC) Coordinator was killed by unidentified assailants in Nanyuki town. The attackers shot the IEBC official three times in the chest, stole some items off his person, and fled. It is not clear if the perpetrators targeted their victim for political reasons or theft. The attack occurred during the morning hours.
A group of 30 members of suspected al Shabaab attack a power station. Police respond, killing two and recovering weapons. It is nor clear if there were any civilian injuries.

Two to four armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab, approached a vehicle (a UN agency vehicle) of the Kambioos-bound convoy stationed along the Hagadera hospital road and shot the driver on the right arm in the morning of 23/04. The second occupant of the car, an expatriate staff managed to get off the car and ran towards the nearest INGO compound for help. Both of the driver and the expatriate are currently safe with the driver undergoing treatment at the Hagadera hospital. The perpetrators escaped with the vehicle and drove south-east of Hagadera for approximately 30 km when the vehicle was remotely disabled, prompting the perpetrators to leave the car. Police reached the scene and were combing the area for the perpetrators. The attack was ;later revealed to be a kidnapping attempt against the UN staffers.

A Member of Kibiri Ward representative in Rachuonyo North Sub County within Homa Bay County has been shot dead at his home on this morning by unidentified assailants. The motive for the attack is not known.

A renown Somali peace seeker and businessman known as Shire Dhalabow was shot by two unidentified gunmen in north-eastern Kenyas border town of Mandera. The assailants who were boys of the ages between 14-17 years.

A prominent hard-line Muslim cleric known as 'Makaburi' is shot dead by unidentified assailants as he left a court hearing. Al Shabaab, of whom Makaburi is in league, stated that Kenyan security forces were behind the killing.
Five are attacked and set alight by unknown assailants. The motive for the attack is not known, but two of this victims are notable business personalities. Only injury reported.
Five herdsmen sustained gunshot wounds during a cattle raid at Nadome village in Tiaty sub county, Baringo. The suspects are believed to be Turkana.
One dead in land dispute violence.

Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed four people attending a church service in Likoni, outside of Mombasa. Many more were reported wounded. In the following days the death toll was raised to six. Police forces launched a large operation which yielded the arrests of 59 suspects.

One person was shot dead and another is fighting for his life at the Mandera Hospital after sustaining serious head injuries after suspected al Shabaab shot them at close range. (Though authorities believe al Shabaab is responsible, they also speculate job rivalry may have been a motive for the attack.
A former ally of slain Muslim cleric sheikh Aboud Rogo was this morning critically injured by a unidentified group of youths.

Three people were injured after a gang of about 10 people attacked worshipers at a church in Bamburis Mwembe Legeza area in Mombasa during the morning hours morning. The reason for the attack is not clear.

Makueni MP Daniel Maanzo and his wife are admitted at the Nairobi hospital after they were attacked and injured by armed thugs at their home. The attackers also stole cash and other valuables. It is not clear if the attack had political motivations.

A man is killed in Taveta following fighting over a land dispute. Witnesses said the deceased, who is the land owner, had gone to mark the boundary of their land at Makongeni area when they were attacked by unknown assailants.
Mombasa county government chief inspector of Logistic and Planning is shot and killed, along with his companion. The assailants are believed to be of or in league with al Shabaab.

A group of men from Kericho West attacked Nyakach during the overnight hours in revenge over stolen cattle. Several houses were torched, leaving many displaced and homeless. No report of death or injury. The exact date of the raid is not clear.

The more than 200 youth, armed with weapons raided a sand harvesting site in Kedong Ranch and set the lorries ablaze. The attack follows a fall-out between traders and the youth from Mai Mahiu over control of the sand business.
Four people have been confirmed dead after raiders, suspected to be Pokots, ambushed Turkana herdsmen at Juluk in Turkana South sub-county.

Ethiopian Merrile militia attack a group of fishermen in the north-west Turkana border district, on Lake Turkana, killing one and injuring several others. The motive for the attack is not clear, though several similar raid had been persistent in the area. Responding to the fishermens distress calls, Kenyan police battled the Merrile, pushing them back into Ethiopia. No causality figures provided from the police battle.

A senior Mijikenda Kayak elder was shot dead by unknown gangsters during the evening hours at his home in Jamb area of Wartime. Family members said the man had no local grudges and they had no idea of the motive.

assoc_actor_2: FORD-Kenya: Forum for the Restoration of Democracy-Kenya
notes: Unidentified gunmen open fire on Bungoma senator-elect Moses Wetangulas car during the evening hours along Mbagathi Way. The Senator escaped unhurt.

An unknown number of people are feared dead (coded as 3) and several others injured in Marsabit following fresh attacks by bandits believed to be from Ethiopia. The attack comes just days after four people were killed in the relative area over a water hole dispute, though it is not clear if this attack was motivated by ethnicity.
A prominent cleric is shot and killed in Ukunda, his killers escaped by motorbike. According to police reports the cleric was specifically targeted.
A group of youths, suspected to be members or supports of the MRC petrol bomb two churches during the early morning hours. Causalities not known.

A Muslim cleric has been shot dead by two gunmen at Kona ya Musa in Diani, Kwale county. The cleric was shot in the head unknown people a few metres from his business some minutes after evening prayers on 18/12.
At least two people were shot dead, and four others injured in a gun attack in Wajir town. This is the second attack in a week. A gunman shot the victims indiscriminately before escaping.
The bodies to two men are discovered in Kilifi, having been shot at close range. The attackers and their motivations are not known.
A Christian preacher is gunned down by two unidentified men at Tiwi in Ukunda. The reason for the assassination is not known.

Police forces gun down Hassan Suleiman Mwayuyu, an al Shabaab suspect while travelling by bus. The Kenya Standard reported a battle between the actors, but HRW conflicted this story. Police believed Mwayuyu had be planning grenade attacks on Mombasa.
A 13-year-old boy is shot and killed by suspected Turkana raiders in Kamurio village on Pokot-Turkana border.
Al Shabaab attacks quary workers near Mandera on 02/12, killing 38.
A madrassa teacher is beheaded for unknown reason in Malindi.
A man is abducted and beheaded at Ngomeni in Malindi by a suspected, unnamed named Muslim group.
Turkana militia raid Orwa town in West Pokot, killing a young boy and destroying property. In an act of revenge the villagers of Orwa mobilized, killing a man in the nearby Turkana village of Runo.
Turkana militia raid Orwa town in West Pokot, killing a young boy and destroying property. In an act of revenge the villagers of Orwa mobilized, killing a man in the nearby Turkana village of Runo.
Suspected Borana militia attack two lorries in the Sololo and Woldaa areas outside Moyale, which are a few kilometres apart. No reported causalities.
Al Shabaab attacks a civilian bus near Mandera, killing 28
Two men were in the evening hours shot dead at Kasses village in West Pokot by suspected raiders.
An unidentified man hacks a woman to death in a land dispute.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Health Workers (Kenya); Aid Workers (Kenya)
notes: A Red Cross officer is shot and injured by an armed group after delivering supplies to Nakwamoru village.

Police shoot and kill two 'militants' in the Eastleigh area or Nairobi. Their affiliation was not reported. Nairobi County commander Benson Kibue has said that the suspects are believed to be the gang that hurled a grenade that killed two people and seriously injured Kamukunji MP Yusuf Hassan in December last year. Human Rights Watch has of late contested this claim stating witnesses have claimed the two (Lenox David Swalleh and an unidentified person) where shot without warning while leaving a mosque.
Unidentified assailants attack the kill the parents of an MP. It is not clear if the attack was platonically motivated.
A man is shot and injured by cattle thieves at Sosian location in Laikipia West Sub-County.

A middle aged Pokot man was shot and killed while grazing animals at Chepurwo village in Ombolion location by suspected armed raiders from the neighbouring county. The raiders did not steal the victims animals.
A church pastor is 'hacked to death' by an unidentified assailant.
A Christian church leader is murdered by unknown assailants.

Two masked men armed with AK type rifles came to a small cinema in block N-29 of IFO 1 in Dadaab District in the night of 17/10. The motive of the attack is unknown. Six people were injured in the attack. The perpetrators escaped. It is believed the attackers are affiliated with al Shabaab.
A Christian church leader is murdered late in the evening by unknown assailants.
A man is shot and killed with arrows along the on the Chemelil-Nandi border. The reason for the attack is not known.
An unknown group attacked a Giriama village near Kipini in the Tana River Delta, burning three homes.

After a Boda boda rider was gunned down by a suspected police official for unknown reason, several of the victims delivery comrades protest the shooting. Several days later the group officially entered a labour strike in further protest.
